films.title: Night and Fog

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: The horrors of the Holocaust are shown in black and white, through documents, films and photographs found in German, Polish, and French archives. The footage of the now-empty camps, filmed only ten years after the liberation and shot in color, shows what remains of Auschwitz.
films.short_synopsis_html: The horrors of the Holocaust are shown in black and white, through documents, films and photographs found in German, Polish, and French archives. The footage of the now-empty camps, filmed only ten years after the liberation and shot in color, shows what remains of Auschwitz.
films.default_editorial: Just a decade after the liberation of France and the end of World War II, Alain Resnais (Hiroshima mon amour) made Night and Fog, the most acclaimed of his documentary shorts. An immensely powerful, stark and startling film that dauntlessly depicts the many atrocities and horrors of the Holocaust.
films.default_editorial_html: Just a decade after the liberation of France and the end of World War II, Alain Resnais (Hiroshima mon amour) made Night and Fog, the most acclaimed of his documentary shorts. An immensely powerful, stark and startling film that dauntlessly depicts the many atrocities and horrors of the Holocaust.

films.title: Paris Is Burning

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: New York City, 1980. In Harlem’s African American and Latinx drag-ball scene, rival houses compete in fierce contests for trophies. Meanwhile, legendary voguers, drag queens, and trans women—including Willi Ninja, Pepper LaBeija, and Venus Xtravaganza—reveal the rules and traditions of the scene.
films.short_synopsis_html: New York City, 1980. In Harlem’s African American and Latinx drag-ball scene, rival houses compete in fierce contests for trophies. Meanwhile, legendary voguers, drag queens, and trans women—including Willi Ninja, Pepper LaBeija, and Venus Xtravaganza—reveal the rules and traditions of the scene.
films.default_editorial: Full of iconic quotes that have shaped the queer lexicon, Jennie Livingston’s seminal documentary captures the ballroom scene of 1980s New York in all its vivacious joy and heartbreaking precarity. Carved out of sequins and solidarity, its safe havens are where fantasies become gloriously real.

Carved out of sequins and solidarity, its safe havens are where fantasies become gloriously real.

films.title: So Long, My Son
films.original_title: 地久天长 | Di jiu tian chang

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Two families in China face upheaval over three decades of social, political and human upheaval in China. After a tragic loss, their paths diverge, and fortunes change. A quest for truth and reconciliation remains despite life’s twists, and goodbyes take a lifetime.
films.short_synopsis_html: Two families in China face upheaval over three decades of social, political and human upheaval in China. After a tragic loss, their paths diverge, and fortunes change. A quest for truth and reconciliation remains despite life’s twists, and goodbyes take a lifetime.
films.default_editorial: China’s one-child policy is the historical backdrop for this sweeping chronicle of family and loss, a journey at once intimate and epic between a tragic past and a resilient present. Above all, its humanist beauty lies in the heart-wrenching performances, which won Best Actress and Actor in Berlin.
films.default_editorial_html: China’s one-child policy is the historical backdrop for this sweeping chronicle of family and loss, a journey at once intimate and epic between a tragic past and a resilient present. Above all, its humanist beauty lies in the heart-wrenching performances, which won Best Actress and Actor in Berlin.

films.title: La jetée

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: After World War III, Paris lies in ruins. A scientist researching time travel hopes to send subjects to various time periods. He finds a suitable subject in a prisoner with a vivid pre-war childhood memory. The prisoner travels in time and comes to understand an incident he witnessed as a child.
films.short_synopsis_html: After World War III, Paris lies in ruins. A scientist researching time travel hopes to send subjects to various time periods. He finds a suitable subject in a prisoner with a vivid pre-war childhood memory. The prisoner travels in time and comes to understand an incident he witnessed as a child.
films.default_editorial: Chris Marker’s game-changing photo-roman is an inventive distillation of cinema, combining montage and voiceover to create a recursive stream of melancholic memories and striking fragments. Forget about special effects: this ingenious vision of science-fiction embraces the power of the imagination.
films.default_editorial_html: Chris Marker’s game-changing photo-roman is an inventive distillation of cinema, combining montage and voiceover to create a recursive stream of melancholic memories and striking fragments. Forget about special effects: this ingenious vision of science-fiction embraces the power of the imagination.

films.title: Festen

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: At a countryside manor, a lavish 60th birthday celebration is being held for revered family patriarch, Helge. Everyone has been invited—most importantly, his wife and three grown-up children, Christian, Michael and Helene. That night, Christian makes a speech nobody will ever forget.
films.short_synopsis_html: At a countryside manor, a lavish 60th birthday celebration is being held for revered family patriarch, Helge. Everyone has been invited—most importantly, his wife and three grown-up children, Christian, Michael and Helene. That night, Christian makes a speech nobody will ever forget.
films.default_editorial: Arguably portraying one of cinema’s most messed-up families ever, Festen is considered the first film made under the rules of the radical Dogme 95 movement. Thomas Vinterberg’s madcap time-bomb of latent secrets and repressed grudges makes any family dinner seem like a piece of cake.
films.default_editorial_html: Arguably portraying one of cinema’s most messed-up families ever, Festen is considered the first film made under the rules of the radical Dogme 95 movement. Thomas Vinterberg’s madcap time-bomb of latent secrets and repressed grudges makes any family dinner seem like a piece of cake.

films.title: Meeting the Man: James Baldwin in Paris
films.original_title: Meeting the Man: James Baldwin in Paris
films.title_upcase: MEETING THE MAN: JAMES BALDWIN IN PARIS

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In 1970, a British film crew set out to make a literary portrait of James Baldwin set in Paris, insisting on setting aside his activism. The author visits Parisian landmarks and reflects on revolution, colonialism, and what it means to be Black in Europe—while bristling at the filmmakers’ questions.
films.short_synopsis_html: In 1970, a British film crew set out to make a literary portrait of James Baldwin set in Paris, insisting on setting aside his activism. The author visits Parisian landmarks and reflects on revolution, colonialism, and what it means to be Black in Europe—while bristling at the filmmakers’ questions.
films.default_editorial: Tense, combative, discursive: a meeting with James Baldwin doesn’t quite go according to plan for a group of presumptuous white filmmakers in this rarely seen, Paris-set short film. An illuminating snapshot of Baldwin’s intellectual worldview that bristles with friction and ideas.
films.default_editorial_html: Tense, combative, discursive: a meeting with James Baldwin doesn’t quite go according to plan for a group of presumptuous white filmmakers in this rarely seen, Paris-set short film. An illuminating snapshot of Baldwin’s intellectual worldview that bristles with friction and ideas.

films.title: Witches

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Director Elizabeth Sankey explores the connections between postpartum mental health and the portrayal of witches in Western society and popular culture. Sankey intertwines her personal experiences with historical and cinematic footage—while creating a new coven of women to reclaim their stories.
films.short_synopsis_html: Director Elizabeth Sankey explores the connections between postpartum mental health and the portrayal of witches in Western society and popular culture. Sankey intertwines her personal experiences with historical and cinematic footage—while creating a new coven of women to reclaim their stories.
films.default_editorial: Witches are figures of solace in this intimate documentary, which unravels the social stigmas that women have endured across centuries. Between affecting interviews and vividly illustrative film clips, Elizabeth Sankey concocts a potion that brims with courage, compassion, and healing insight.
films.default_editorial_html: Witches are figures of solace in this intimate documentary, which unravels the social stigmas that women have endured across centuries. Between affecting interviews and vividly illustrative film clips, Elizabeth Sankey concocts a potion that brims with courage, compassion, and healing insight.

films.title: Crossing the Bridge – The Sound of Istanbul
films.original_title: Crossing the Bridge – The Sound of Istanbul
films.title_upcase: CROSSING THE BRIDGE – THE SOUND OF ISTANBUL

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: German musician Alexander Hacke sets out with his mobile recording studio to capture the musical diversity of Istanbul and construct a portrait of Turkish music. His journey leads to the discovery of a broad spectrum ranging from rock and classical arabesque to modern electronic and hip-hop.
films.short_synopsis_html: German musician Alexander Hacke sets out with his mobile recording studio to capture the musical diversity of Istanbul and construct a portrait of Turkish music. His journey leads to the discovery of a broad spectrum ranging from rock and classical arabesque to modern electronic and hip-hop.
films.default_editorial: Transcending cultural borders and genres, Istanbul’s vibrant music scene takes the spotlight in Fatih Akin’s sonically immersive time capsule, now remastered in 4K. Thumping with an infectious energy, this movable feast celebrates the bonding power of art over political and generational divides.
films.default_editorial_html: Transcending cultural borders and genres, Istanbul’s vibrant music scene takes the spotlight in Fatih Akin’s sonically immersive time capsule, now remastered in 4K. Thumping with an infectious energy, this movable feast celebrates the bonding power of art over political and generational divides.

films.title: Tripping With Nils Frahm

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: An iconic artist at an iconic location. This concert film captures several mesmerizing live performances from the renowned German composer and producer Nils Frahm at the legendary Funkhaus Berlin. Expect soaring ambient and neo-classical piano from one of the greatest contemporary musicians around.
films.short_synopsis_html: An iconic artist at an iconic location. This concert film captures several mesmerizing live performances from the renowned German composer and producer Nils Frahm at the legendary Funkhaus Berlin. Expect soaring ambient and neo-classical piano from one of the greatest contemporary musicians around.
films.default_editorial: Renowned composer Nils Frahm is no stranger to cinema, having scored Sebastian Schipper’s one-shot film Victoria and the Cate Blanchett vehicle Manifesto. For this immersive concert film, his intimate and enthralling shows are captured on handheld cameras, centering us amid a unique experience.
films.default_editorial_html: Renowned composer Nils Frahm is no stranger to cinema, having scored Sebastian Schipper’s one-shot film Victoria and the Cate Blanchett vehicle Manifesto. For this immersive concert film, his intimate and enthralling shows are captured on handheld cameras, centering us amid a unique experience.

films.title: Fantastic Planet

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: On the distant planet Ygam, enslaved humans called Oms are the playthings of giant blue native inhabitants, the Draags. Terr, kept as a pet since infancy, escapes from his gigantic child captor and is swept up by a band of radical fellow Oms, who are resisting the Draags’ oppression and violence.
films.short_synopsis_html: On the distant planet Ygam, enslaved humans called Oms are the playthings of giant blue native inhabitants, the Draags. Terr, kept as a pet since infancy, escapes from his gigantic child captor and is swept up by a band of radical fellow Oms, who are resisting the Draags’ oppression and violence.
films.default_editorial: René Laloux’s beloved fantasia is a shimmering treasure in the canon of science-fiction cinema. Cosmic landscapes populated by strange, otherworldly creatures—thanks to the distinct cut-out animations of Roland Topor—and set to an ice-cool psychedelic jazz score: The results are out of this world.
films.default_editorial_html: René Laloux’s beloved fantasia is a shimmering treasure in the canon of science-fiction cinema. Cosmic landscapes populated by strange, otherworldly creatures—thanks to the distinct cut-out animations of Roland Topor—and set to an ice-cool psychedelic jazz score: The results are out of this world.

films.title: The Sacrifice

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Alexander, a retired actor, is celebrating his birthday with family and friends when a TV announcement warns of an impending World War III and imminent nuclear catastrophe. Faced with an existential crisis, Alexander vows to renounce all he holds dear to prevent the disaster.
films.short_synopsis_html: Alexander, a retired actor, is celebrating his birthday with family and friends when a TV announcement warns of an impending World War III and imminent nuclear catastrophe. Faced with an existential crisis, Alexander vows to renounce all he holds dear to prevent the disaster.
films.default_editorial: Winner of the Grand Prix at the Cannes Film Festival, this shattering masterwork was the final film by Russian visionary Andrei Tarkovsky. Shot in Sweden by legendary cinematographer Sven Nykvist and newly restored in 4K, The Sacrifice is a profound metaphysical interrogation of the artistic soul.
films.default_editorial_html: Winner of the Grand Prix at the Cannes Film Festival, this shattering masterwork was the final film by Russian visionary Andrei Tarkovsky. Shot in Sweden by legendary cinematographer Sven Nykvist and newly restored in 4K, The Sacrifice is a profound metaphysical interrogation of the artistic soul.

films.title: Sans soleil

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: An unnamed woman narrates the letters and philosophical reflections of an invisible world traveler accompanied by footage of Guinea-Bissau, Cape Verde, Iceland, Paris, San Francisco and, most significantly, Tokyo—a city whose people, streets, malls and temples inspire the traveler’s observations.
films.short_synopsis_html: An unnamed woman narrates the letters and philosophical reflections of an invisible world traveler accompanied by footage of Guinea-Bissau, Cape Verde, Iceland, Paris, San Francisco and, most significantly, Tokyo—a city whose people, streets, malls and temples inspire the traveler’s observations.
films.default_editorial: How to describe such an indescribable film? Chris Marker’s Sans Soleil is cinema as stream-of-consciousness, following the journey of an unseen hero around the globe and into the mind. Today, it is considered a masterpiece, a film that breaks free of the documentary form and into a world of its own.
films.default_editorial_html: How to describe such an indescribable film? Chris Marker’s Sans Soleil is cinema as stream-of-consciousness, following the journey of an unseen hero around the globe and into the mind. films.title: Seduce Me: Noah's Ark

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini goes back to biblical times and visits Noah’s Ark. How did Noah manage to organize every single animal species into couples? What about the hermaphrodite earthworm?
films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini goes back to biblical times and visits Noah’s Ark. How did Noah manage to organize every single animal species into couples? What about the hermaphrodite earthworm?
films.default_editorial: Setting her inquisitive gaze on the Bible, Isabella Rossellini challenges the gender binary implicitly attached to a famous parable. Crafted in the style of a pop-up book, this inventive short looks beyond individual species to take in the full spectrum of sexual practices across the animal world.
films.default_editorial_html: Setting her inquisitive gaze on the Bible, Isabella Rossellini challenges the gender binary implicitly attached to a famous parable. Crafted in the style of a pop-up book, this inventive short looks beyond individual species to take in the full spectrum of sexual practices across the animal world.

films.title: Maurice's Bar

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In 1942, on a train to nowhere, a former drag queen remembers a night from her past in one of Paris’ first queer bars. Lingering fragments of customer gossip conjure memories of the mythic bar and its mysterious Jewish-Algerian owner.
films.short_synopsis_html: In 1942, on a train to nowhere, a former drag queen remembers a night from her past in one of Paris’ first queer bars. Lingering fragments of customer gossip conjure memories of the mythic bar and its mysterious Jewish-Algerian owner.
films.default_editorial: Reclaiming a piece of queer history, Tzor Edery and Tom Prezman’s animated short movingly resurrects a forgotten gay bar from its tragic fate under the Nazi occupation of France. Awash with voluptuous imagery, this is a vital ode to the radical joy that dares to flourish in the face of intolerance.
films.default_editorial_html: Reclaiming a piece of queer history, Tzor Edery and Tom Prezman’s animated short movingly resurrects a forgotten gay bar from its tragic fate under the Nazi occupation of France. Awash with voluptuous imagery, this is a vital ode to the radical joy that dares to flourish in the face of intolerance.

films.title: Buena Vista Social Club

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Ry Cooder, Wim Wenders’ frequent musical collaborator, travels to Havana to bring a group of aging Cuban musicians—whose talents had been virtually forgotten following Fidel Castro’s takeover—out of retirement. Within a few months, the group go from obscurity to world stardom.
films.short_synopsis_html: Ry Cooder, Wim Wenders’ frequent musical collaborator, travels to Havana to bring a group of aging Cuban musicians—whose talents had been virtually forgotten following Fidel Castro’s takeover—out of retirement. Within a few months, the group go from obscurity to world stardom.
films.default_editorial: One of Wim Wenders’s latter-day triumphs, this Oscar®-nominated documentary explores the rich and vivacious music scene in Cuba. The New German Cinema icon follows numerous musical legends as they play and navigate the vibrant streets of Havana in this loving testament to the “son de Cuba.” A tonic!
films.default_editorial_html: One of Wim Wenders’s latter-day triumphs, this Oscar®-nominated documentary explores the rich and vivacious music scene in Cuba. The New German Cinema icon follows numerous musical legends as they play and navigate the vibrant streets of Havana in this loving testament to the “son de Cuba.” A tonic!

films.title: Persepolis

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In 1970s Iran, Marjane, an 8-year-old girl, dreams of saving the world. Cherished by her beloved family, she watches the events that led to the downfall of the Shah’s brutal regime through her young eyes. Now a punk-loving teenager, Marjane witness her country transform into an oppressive society.
films.short_synopsis_html: In 1970s Iran, Marjane, an 8-year-old girl, dreams of saving the world. Cherished by her beloved family, she watches the events that led to the downfall of the Shah’s brutal regime through her young eyes. Now a punk-loving teenager, Marjane witness her country transform into an oppressive society.
films.default_editorial: This acclaimed coming-of-age feature chronicles a young girl during the 1979 Iranian Revolution. Co-directed and adapted by Marjane Satrapi from her graphic autobiography into beautiful black-and-white animation, the film is voiced by mother-daughter duo Chiara Mastroianni and Catherine Deneuve!
films.default_editorial_html: This acclaimed coming-of-age feature chronicles a young girl during the 1979 Iranian Revolution. Co-directed and adapted by Marjane Satrapi from her graphic autobiography into beautiful black-and-white animation, the film is voiced by mother-daughter duo Chiara Mastroianni and Catherine Deneuve!

films.title: Hiroshima mon amour

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In postwar Hiroshima, a French actress and a Japanese architect engage in a brief, intense affair. Their consuming mutual fascination compels them to exorcise their own scarred memories of love and suffering.
films.short_synopsis_html: In postwar Hiroshima, a French actress and a Japanese architect engage in a brief, intense affair. Their consuming mutual fascination compels them to exorcise their own scarred memories of love and suffering.
films.default_editorial: With an Academy Award®–nominated screenplay written by no less than Marguerite Duras, Alain Resnais’ French New Wave landmark is a painfully intimate mosaic of memories of love and suffering. Rendered through a startling, jagged flashback structure, this is one of the most beautiful films ever made.
films.default_editorial_html: With an Academy Award®–nominated screenplay written by no less than Marguerite Duras, Alain Resnais’ French New Wave landmark is a painfully intimate mosaic of memories of love and suffering. Rendered through a startling, jagged flashback structure, this is one of the most beautiful films ever made.

films.title: The Edge of Heaven

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: The lives of six German-Turkish immigrants are drawn together by circumstance: An old man and a sex worker forging a partnership, a young scholar reconciling his past, two young women falling in love, and a mother putting the shattered pieces of her life back together.
films.short_synopsis_html: The lives of six German-Turkish immigrants are drawn together by circumstance: An old man and a sex worker forging a partnership, a young scholar reconciling his past, two young women falling in love, and a mother putting the shattered pieces of her life back together.
films.default_editorial: Starring the great Hanna Schygulla (The Bitter Tears of Petra von Kant), Fatih Akin followed up his Golden Bear-winner Head-On with this intricate drama. Though split between Germany and Turkey, Akin’s intertwining narratives bridge the gaps between these nations and their cultures.

Though split between Germany and Turkey, Akin’s intertwining narratives bridge the gaps between these nations and their cultures.

films.title: Don't Let Them Shoot the Kite
films.title_upcase: DON'T LET THEM SHOOT THE KITE

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Barış, a five-year-old boy, lives in prison with his detained mother. Within the high security walls, he forms an unexpected bond with İnci, a young political prisoner. Their special relationship opens up a new world for Barış and impacts the lives of other women prisoners.
films.short_synopsis_html: Barış, a five-year-old boy, lives in prison with his detained mother. Within the high security walls, he forms an unexpected bond with İnci, a young political prisoner. Their special relationship opens up a new world for Barış and impacts the lives of other women prisoners.
films.default_editorial: Camaraderie and fleeting joys soften harsh realities in Don’t Let Them Shoot the Kite, which reemerges as a Turkish classic in this fresh 4K restoration. Capturing the profound resilience of its characters through a child’s tender gaze, Tunç Başaran’s prizewinner is a testament to enduring spirit.

films.title: The Man Without a Past

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Arriving in Helsinki, a nameless man is beaten within an inch of his life by thugs, miraculously recovering only to find that he has completely lost his memory. Back on the streets, he attempts to begin again from zero, befriending a moody dog and becoming besotted with a Salvation Army volunteer.
films.short_synopsis_html: Arriving in Helsinki, a nameless man is beaten within an inch of his life by thugs, miraculously recovering only to find that he has completely lost his memory. Back on the streets, he attempts to begin again from zero, befriending a moody dog and becoming besotted with a Salvation Army volunteer.
films.default_editorial: Aki Kaurismäki scored one of his biggest hits with this winsome ode to community and kindness. Earning an Oscar® nod for foreign picture alongside its armful of prizes from Cannes, The Man Without a Past harmonises compassion and rarefied stylistic poise into a swoonworthy serenade to humanity.

films.title: Ninjababy

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Rakel is a graphic designer dropout who loves a party. When she finds out she’s six months pregnant after a one-night stand, adoption looks like the only option. That’s when Ninjababy, an animated character who makes her life a living hell, turns up.
films.short_synopsis_html: Rakel is a graphic designer dropout who loves a party. When she finds out she’s six months pregnant after a one-night stand, adoption looks like the only option. That’s when Ninjababy, an animated character who makes her life a living hell, turns up.
films.default_editorial: If The Worst Person in the World had a little sister with a lot of tattoos, then it would be Ninjababy. Just as relatable, droll, and brazen about the rebellious desires of millennial women, the film shows the mess of muddling along into adulthood with sensitivity—and a good deal of hilarity too.

films.title: A Natural History of the Studio
films.title_upcase: A NATURAL HISTORY OF THE STUDIO

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: South African artist William Kentridge investigates life in the studio. He imagines his studio as an enlarged head, where multiple dialogues occur between the artist and himself. Kentridge begins interviewing his double. Soon, the whole studio is populated by Kentridge’s many selves.
films.short_synopsis_html: South African artist William Kentridge investigates life in the studio. He imagines his studio as an enlarged head, where multiple dialogues occur between the artist and himself. Kentridge begins interviewing his double. Soon, the whole studio is populated by Kentridge’s many selves.

episode.label: Self-Portrait as a Coffee-Pot - Episode 1
episode.episode_title: A Natural History of the Studio

films.default_editorial: Step inside the roving creative imagination of William Kentridge with this exclusive nine-part series. An ode to procrastination, pacing, and messy desks, this playful first episode sees the South African artist invoke a doppelgänger with whom to squabble over the intangible seeds of inspiration.

films.title: Tokyo Sonata
films.original_title: トウキョウソナタ | Tôkyô sonata

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Salaryman Ryūhei is suddenly fired from his job. He hides the news from his family, but his lie soon unravels the bonds that hold his family together. His youngest son begins taking secret piano lessons, his oldest son wants to join the US military, and his wife becomes dissatisfied as a matriarch.
films.short_synopsis_html: Salaryman Ryūhei is suddenly fired from his job. He hides the news from his family, but his lie soon unravels the bonds that hold his family together. His youngest son begins taking secret piano lessons, his oldest son wants to join the US military, and his wife becomes dissatisfied as a matriarch.
films.default_editorial: If any movie changed the perception that Kiyoshi Kurosawa only excelled at horror films, this is it: a domestic drama—the hallowed realm of Ozu—but reinvented. A prizewinner at Cannes, he scored his biggest hit yet with an unusual blend of redemptive family story, dystopian dread, and deadpan humor.

films.title: In Defence of Optimism

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: William Kentridge explores the optimism of making things—how, even in dire circumstances, there will be people who play, create, and sing. He enlists a local brass band to lead a jolly procession out of the studio and into Johannesburg. But will Kentridge’s two split parts come to an agreement?

films.default_editorial: As the doppelgängers ponder the optimism that exists between the tip of a pencil and the pad beneath, the impossible question of endings arises. “Why don’t we just stop?” they muse. Enter a deus ex machina and an expression of pure joy—an exultant procession through the studio and into the streets.

films.title: First Cow

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In the 1820s, a taciturn loner and skilled cook travels west to Oregon Territory, where he meets a Chinese immigrant also seeking his fortune. Soon the two team up on a dangerous scheme to steal milk from the wealthy landowner’s prized Jersey cow—the first, and only, in the territory.
films.short_synopsis_html: In the 1820s, a taciturn loner and skilled cook travels west to Oregon Territory, where he meets a Chinese immigrant also seeking his fortune. films.default_editorial: Kelly Reichardt, an inimitable voice of American cinema, redefines the notion of what a western can be. Set among outcasts on the edge of capitalism’s grasp, First Cow is a rare tale of the blossoming of a heartfelt male friendship, and one told with sublime gentleness and touching compassion.

films.title: Lost Highway

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Fred Madison, a musician, starts receiving mysterious VHS tapes of him and his wife in their home and is tortured by the idea that his wife is having an affair. After being suddenly convicted of her murder, he inexplicably disappears and is replaced by a young mechanic leading a different life.
films.short_synopsis_html: Fred Madison, a musician, starts receiving mysterious VHS tapes of him and his wife in their home and is tortured by the idea that his wife is having an affair. films.default_editorial: This misunderstood cult classic sees surrealist mastermind David Lynch back in Los Angeles, journeying once more down the rabbit hole. Indulging in a career-long interest in doubling and doppelgängers, the looping and splintered story of this nightmarish neo-noir weighs heavily with foreboding.

films.short_synopsis: Five taxi drivers across the world have remarkable encounters over one eventful night. In LA, a talent agent decides her cabbie should star in her next movie. In Rome, a non-believing driver finds a dead bishop in his back seat. Meanwhile in Paris, a beautiful blind woman distracts her cabbie…

films.default_editorial: Before his broader anthology film Coffee and Cigarettes, Jim Jarmusch traversed five cities for this tragicomic travelogue, a series of symmetrical vignettes that explore the ephemeral interactions and fleeting relationships between taxi drivers and their passengers. films.title: Songs My Brothers Taught Me

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: High school senior Johnny is about to leave the Pine Ridge Reservation when his rodeo-cowboy father suddenly dies. Reluctant to leave his 13-year-old sister behind, Johnny must face an inner conflict standing in the way of his departure, which leads both of them to rediscover the meaning of home.

films.default_editorial: Before her breakthrough The Rider and Academy Award®-winning Nomadland, Chloé Zhao came to prominence with her similarly beautiful and melancholic first feature. A portrait of life on the fringes of American society, Songs… is impressively brought to life by its nonprofessional actors.

films.title: ...A Valparaíso

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A melancholic narrator begins a tour up the steep hills and across the sea of Valparaíso, a Chilean port city that was once a central stop around Cape Horn. Now, the glories of a cosmopolitan past are a faint memory—and the contrasts between poor and rich are immediately evident.
films.short_synopsis_html: A melancholic narrator begins a tour up the steep hills and across the sea of Valparaíso, a Chilean port city that was once a central stop around Cape Horn. Now, the glories of a cosmopolitan past are a faint memory—and the contrasts between poor and rich are immediately evident.
films.default_editorial: This collaboration between Joris Ivens and Chris Marker fascinates not just for its subject matter—daily life in the titular Chilean seaport city—but the traces of their distinct points-of-view. A fertile dynamic emerges from the realism of Ivens’ images and the fluid associations of Marker’s prose.

films.title: Self-Portrait as a Coffee-Pot

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: William Kentridge explores the making of a self-portrait as a way of coming to know oneself. He also welcomes the dancer Dada Masilo into his studio. As Kentridge attempts to draw his own figure with a brush attached to the tip of a long stick, his double watches the imperfect outcome from afar.
films.short_synopsis_html: William Kentridge explores the making of a self-portrait as a way of coming to know oneself. He also welcomes the dancer Dada Masilo into his studio. As Kentridge attempts to draw his own figure with a brush attached to the tip of a long stick, his double watches the imperfect outcome from afar.
films.default_editorial: As the pandemic rages, Kentridge turns his mind to the human body. Employing the techniques of early cinema—and a Marx Brothers mirror gag—Episode 2 is alive with Méliès magic, as figures dance across blackboards and notebooks for a sprightly discourse on selfhood and corporeal representation.

films.title: Le Havre

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In the French harbor city of Le Havre, fate throws young African refugee Idrissa into the path of Marcel Marx, a well-spoken bohemian who works as a shoe-shiner. With innate optimism and the tireless support of his community, Marcel stands up to officials pursuing the boy for deportation.
films.short_synopsis_html: In the French harbor city of Le Havre, fate throws young African refugee Idrissa into the path of Marcel Marx, a well-spoken bohemian who works as a shoe-shiner. With innate optimism and the tireless support of his community, Marcel stands up to officials pursuing the boy for deportation.
films.default_editorial: Aki Kaurismäki returns to France with this sun-kissed utopian parable. One of his most politically resonant films, Le Havre echoes The Man Without a Past’s ruminations on community and resilience, albeit this time (via a hat tip to Carl Dreyer’s Ordet) with a nod to the vagaries of the divine.

films.title: Blackbird Blackbird Blackberry

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Etero, a 48-year-old woman living in a small village in Georgia, never wanted a husband. She cherishes her freedom as much as her cakes. But her choice to live alone is the cause of much gossip among her fellow villagers. Unexpectedly, she finds herself passionately falling for a man.

films.default_editorial: Tenderly erotic and delightfully funny, this portrait of a defiant woman from Georgian filmmaker Elene Naveriani delicately mixes modernity into tradition. Beaming with an endearing lead performance, this tale of a pleasure-seeker’s awakening is full of apricot-colored warmth and honest beauty.

films.title: Drifting Clouds

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: The ever-poker-faced Ilona loses her job as a restaurant hostess, as her tram driver husband, Lauri, also finds himself out of work. Together they must hit the streets of Helsinki, facing up to hardship and humiliation in their quest for survival, guided through the gloom by a ray of hope.
films.short_synopsis_html: The ever-poker-faced Ilona loses her job as a restaurant hostess, as her tram driver husband, Lauri, also finds himself out of work. films.default_editorial: One of Aki Kaurismäki’s most poignant and compassionate works, this droll situational comedy charts the struggles and misfortunes of a couple on the breadline. Formally rigorous, and vibrantly art directed, Drifting Clouds is prime Kaurismäki all the way up to its final, majestic crane shot.

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Vincent, a young Parisian uncomfortable with his appearance, installs a brain chip named Reality+ which allows users to see themselves and fellow users with their dream body. However, Reality+ only works over 12-hour intervals, proving infuriating for Vincent as he falls for Stella, another user.

films.default_editorial: A future Paris sparkles with unnervingly beautiful people in Coralie Fargeat’s transfixing sci-fi short. Testing out a speculative self-optimization technology ten years ahead of The Substance, the French director won numerous awards for this electrifying descent into an image-obsessed society.

films.title: Au hasard Balthazar

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Balthazar, a donkey in rural France, is passed from owner to owner and, in turn, treated kindly and cruelly. Despite his powerlessness, Balthazar accepts his fate nobly. Meanwhile, his first owner, an innocent farmer’s daughter, is seduced by the leader of a group of black-jacketed delinquents.
films.short_synopsis_html: Balthazar, a donkey in rural France, is passed from owner to owner and, in turn, treated kindly and cruelly. Despite his powerlessness, Balthazar accepts his fate nobly. Meanwhile, his first owner, an innocent farmer’s daughter, is seduced by the leader of a group of black-jacketed delinquents.
films.default_editorial: Transcending its austere aesthetic with sublime heights of emotion, Robert Bresson’s holy heartbreaker is devoted to two saintly figures. No one forgets the guileless face of young Anne Wiazemsky or the poor donkey who goes by the name of Balthazar after watching this masterpiece of modern cinema.

films.title: Farewell Amor

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Reunited after a 17 year separation, Walter, an Angolan immigrant, is joined in the U.S. by his wife and teenage daughter. Now absolute strangers sharing a one-bedroom apartment, they discover a shared love of dance that may help overcome the emotional distance between them.
films.short_synopsis_html: Reunited after a 17 year separation, Walter, an Angolan immigrant, is joined in the U.S. by his wife and teenage daughter. Now absolute strangers sharing a one-bedroom apartment, they discover a shared love of dance that may help overcome the emotional distance between them.
films.default_editorial: Tanzanian-American director Ekwa Msangi’s debut insightfully describes the experience of immigration with a personal yet universal approach too little seen in film. Set in New York, this tender family drama delighted critics at Sundance in 2020 and features star-making turns from its three leads.

films.title: An Urban Allegory

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: A ballet dancer is late for an audition for a show inspired by Plato’s Allegory of the Cave. She arrives with her seven-year-old son, Jay, and begs the director to give her a chance. But when the rehearsals start, Jay escapes, embarking on a poetic and philosophical journey through Paris.
films.short_synopsis_html: A ballet dancer is late for an audition for a show inspired by Plato’s Allegory of the Cave. She arrives with her seven-year-old son, Jay, and begs the director to give her a chance. But when the rehearsals start, Jay escapes, embarking on a poetic and philosophical journey through Paris.
films.default_editorial: Enchanted by a child’s curious gaze, An Urban Allegory is quintessential Alice Rohrwacher. Together with street artist JR, the supernal filmmaker assembles a kaleidoscopically playful vision of art, tracing how it moves through this stage of magical light and alluring shadow we call the world.

films.title: Time to Love

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: On the Princes’ Islands to the south of Istanbul, the days are rainy and full of longing. Poor but proud painter Halil gets a job in one of the island’s villas, where he encounters the photograph of a beautiful woman and falls in love with her image.
films.short_synopsis_html: On the Princes’ Islands to the south of Istanbul, the days are rainy and full of longing. Poor but proud painter Halil gets a job in one of the island’s villas, where he encounters the photograph of a beautiful woman and falls in love with her image.
films.default_editorial: For MUBI’s first-ever restoration project, we are thrilled to present Metin Erksan’s unsung masterwork, an achingly gorgeous love story inspired by Sufi tales. Imbued with a longing for self-actualization amid modern loneliness, this mercurial wonder evokes the fatal idealism of cross-class romance.

films.title: Vanishing Points

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: William Kentridge investigates how memory connects to place. Using two large blank sheets of paper, the artist draws a fictional colonial landscape, like those he remembers hanging in his childhood dining room. Meanwhile, his doppelgänger draws what he remembers actually seeing in Johannesburg.
films.short_synopsis_html: William Kentridge investigates how memory connects to place. Using two large blank sheets of paper, the artist draws a fictional colonial landscape, like those he remembers hanging in his childhood dining room. Meanwhile, his doppelgänger draws what he remembers actually seeing in Johannesburg.
films.default_editorial: Episode 3 finds Kentridge in a reflective mood, wrestling with the fickle nature of memory, time, and space. The recollection of a scenic painting in his grandparents’ home sparks a masterclass in vanishing points, and the suggestion that a satisfying landscape is simply a matter of perspective.

films.title: Down by Law

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Three men—an unemployed disc jockey, a small-time pimp, and a hapless Italian tourist—find themselves in the same prison cell for crimes they didn’t commit. Together, they plan their escape, soon ending up in the Louisiana wilds with no refuge in sight.

films.default_editorial: This cool, character-driven comedy from American indie giant Jim Jarmusch is founded on one of the most unusual combinations of actors in cinema: Roberto Benigni, John Lurie & Tom Waits. films.title: Green Porno: Elephant Seal

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini visits Argentinian Patagonia to witness the beachside mating rituals of elephant seals. Along with biologist Claudio Campagna, Rossellini discovers that size really does matter in the hierarchy of elephant seals.
films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini visits Argentinian Patagonia to witness the beachside mating rituals of elephant seals. Along with biologist Claudio Campagna, Rossellini discovers that size really does matter in the hierarchy of elephant seals.
films.default_editorial: In this startling short, Rossellini goes from playing with paper cutouts of elephant seals to coming face-to-face with the real thing—it’s as though she needs to see them for herself to believe that they exist. By turns domineering and gentle, these beasts seem to be crawling contradictions.

films.title: I Am Not a Witch

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In Zambia, eight-year-old orphan Shula is accused of witchcraft and exiled to a witch camp run by a corrupt government official. As the only child witch, Shula is exploited by adults for financial gain and forced to decide whether to resign herself to life on the camp, or take a risk for freedom.
films.short_synopsis_html: In Zambia, eight-year-old orphan Shula is accused of witchcraft and exiled to a witch camp run by a corrupt government official. As the only child witch, Shula is exploited by adults for financial gain and forced to decide whether to resign herself to life on the camp, or take a risk for freedom.
films.default_editorial: Exploring Zambia’s little-known culture of “witch camps,” Rungano Nyoni’s debut masterfully combines comedy, tragedy, and mesmerizing visuals. A portrait of a defiant young girl, I Am Not a Witch mounts an acerbic critique of women’s oppression and corruption through tourism, media and superstition.

films.title: Finding One's Fate

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: Remembering a story his father told him when he was a child, of Perseus killing his grandfather by accident, William Kentridge reflects on the inescapability of one’s destiny. He explores the story of the Cumana Sibyl, who revealed people’s fate inscribed on leaves that fell from a tree.
films.short_synopsis_html: Remembering a story his father told him when he was a child, of Perseus killing his grandfather by accident, William Kentridge reflects on the inescapability of one’s destiny. films.default_editorial: A dialogue on Greek mythology introduces Kentridge’s work as a theater practitioner, as Episode 4 captures rehearsals for his collaborative chamber opera, Waiting for the Sibyl. It’s a swirling analog meditation on mortality, fate, and uncertainty—poignant materials for a time of sickness and war.

films.short_synopsis: While investigating the mysterious death of a nightshift waitress, Special Agents Chester Desmond and Dale Cooper unravel bizarre clues and mysterious disappearances in the peaceful town of Twin Peaks. This leads them to the last seven days of Laura Palmer’s troubled life, and ultimately the killer.

films.title: You Hide Me

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Buried deep in the basement of the British Museum, hidden in plastic bags and wooden boxes, lies a wealth of ancient and rare African artifacts. Over one day, the valuable objects are unveiled for the first time, revealing the vast expanse of African art stolen by colonial forces.
films.short_synopsis_html: Buried deep in the basement of the British Museum, hidden in plastic bags and wooden boxes, lies a wealth of ancient and rare African artifacts. Over one day, the valuable objects are unveiled for the first time, revealing the vast expanse of African art stolen by colonial forces.
films.default_editorial: Banned for anti-British sentiment even in recently liberated Ghana, this short casts essential light on African art’s histories of circulation and exhibition. Illuminating the myriad hypocrisies of colonial forces, Nii Kwate Owoo’s radical show-and-tell unambiguously calls for immediate restitution.

films.short_synopsis: Sindbad the Sailor proclaims himself to be the greatest sailor in the world, a claim which is challenged by Popeye’s arrival to his island with Olive Oyl and J. Wellington Wimpy in tow. Sindbad, with the help of his bird Rokh, treats Popeye to a series of challenges to prove his greatness.

films.default_editorial: Adapted to the screen by Fleischer Studios, Popeye was able to surpass Walt Disney’s Mickey Mouse at the 1930s box office and still remains an ingenious animated series. The only episode in the series to receive a nomination at the Academy Awards, this short is an adventurous feat of animation.

films.short_synopsis: Dona Flor’s passionate yet irresponsible husband Vadinho drops dead while dancing in the streets. Seeking a stable life, the widowed Dona remarries a respectable pharmacist shortly after. However, when her new love life turns out to be less than satisfying, the ghost of her late husband returns.

films.default_editorial: Made during Brazil’s military dictatorship, Bruno Barreto’s magic realist feature is sensual and darkly comedic, propelling Sônia Braga from soap star to national deity. For a deep dive into the film’s legacy, this liberating tale of female desire is explored in episode 3 of the MUBI Podcast.

content_rating.label: mature

films.short_synopsis: Alice is 27 years old today. She still lives with her parents and tends to live in her dreams to escape her dreary everyday life. After a psychedelic party on a factory roof, she has a serious drunken bike accident. Will this give her the courage to become an adult?
films.short_synopsis_html: Alice is 27 years old today. She still lives with her parents and tends to live in her dreams to escape her dreary everyday life. After a psychedelic party on a factory roof, she has a serious drunken bike accident. Will this give her the courage to become an adult?
films.default_editorial: A surreal reverie laced with hallucinogenic imagery, Flóra Anna Buda’s animated Cannes prizewinner basks in the glorious messiness of young adulthood. Against the all-too-relatable reality of financial precarity and other grown-up blues, 27 liberates the mind through playfully raunchy fantasies.

films.title: Our Body

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Claire Simon observes the everyday operations of the gynecological ward in a public hospital in Paris. She meets patients in all stages of life—young and old, cisgender and trans. Unique stories of fertility, gender transitions, and cancer unfold, including the one of the filmmaker herself.
films.short_synopsis_html: Claire Simon observes the everyday operations of the gynecological ward in a public hospital in Paris. She meets patients in all stages of life—young and old, cisgender and trans. Unique stories of fertility, gender transitions, and cancer unfold, including the one of the filmmaker herself.
films.default_editorial: Compassionate towards its subjects, this critically acclaimed film by Claire Simon explores the issue of women’s health. With an all-female crew and an empathetic eye, the renowned documentarian assembles a deeply invested study that demystifies the bodies we hold in common, across our differences.

films.title: The Tube with a Hat

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Very early in the morning, Marian, a 7-year-old boy from a small Romanian village, wakes up his father and persuades him to go to the city to fix their old TV set. The father and son begin carrying the TV set there, hoping they will find Bichescu, a specialist, who will fix their problem.

films.default_editorial: Taking the film-festival world by storm upon its release, Radu Jude’s outstanding debut short roams through the muddy roads of rural Romania. Tender in parts yet never straying into sentimentalism, this snapshot of a father-son bond inhabits the realities of poverty with a matter-of-fact clarity.

films.title: Incompatible with Life

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: From her personal experience of pregnancy with a diagnosis of fetal malformation incompatible with life, the filmmaker sheds light on women who went through a similar situation in Brazil, where abortion may lead to prison.
films.short_synopsis_html: From her personal experience of pregnancy with a diagnosis of fetal malformation incompatible with life, the filmmaker sheds light on women who went through a similar situation in Brazil, where abortion may lead to prison.
films.default_editorial: Starting from a place of private turmoil, Eliza Capai’s searingly vital documentary widens its scope to take in the collective struggle for women’s reproductive rights in Brazil. Shedding light on the toll of perinatal grief, a tapestry of diverse voices forms a fervent call for legislative reform.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini takes a close look at the seduction habits of dolphins, the smartest creatures in the sea. But when it comes to sex and dolphins, anything goes—anything!
films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini takes a close look at the seduction habits of dolphins, the smartest creatures in the sea. But when it comes to sex and dolphins, anything goes—anything!
films.default_editorial: Dolphins rank among the smartest animals in the world, but do you know that they’re also… kinky? Fizzing with mischievousness, this frothy Seduce Me short follows Isabella Rossellini on a merry deep dive, as she explores the many, many lovemaking positions enjoyed by the open-minded mammal.

films.title: Dead Man

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: 19th century America. Accountant William Blake has hardly arrived in the godforsaken frontier town of Machine before he’s caught in the middle of a deadly lovers’ quarrel. Wounded and on the run, Blake finds a friend in the outcast Nobody, who guides him on a spiritual journey.

films.default_editorial: King-of-cool Jim Jarmusch showed up to Cannes in 1995 with possibly his best film. This self-described “psychedelic western” rebuilds the genre as a ragged, comic, uniquely American trip, with help from an ensemble cast including Johnny Depp and Iggy Pop, and scored to a mystic jam by Neil Young.

films.title: Shadows in Paradise

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: After losing his friend and co-worker to a sudden heart attack, lonely Helsinki garbageman Nikander finds himself completely directionless. But unlikely redemption comes in the form of Ilona, a plain supermarket cashier with whom he begins a tentative love affair.
films.short_synopsis_html: After losing his friend and co-worker to a sudden heart attack, lonely Helsinki garbageman Nikander finds himself completely directionless. But unlikely redemption comes in the form of Ilona, a plain supermarket cashier with whom he begins a tentative love affair.
films.default_editorial: The first entry in Aki Kaurismäki’s so-called “Proletariat Trilogy,” Shadows in Paradise effectively set the template for the maestro’s singular style. Punctuated with bursts of primary colors, this beautiful wisp of a film finds a delicately negotiated optimism amid the ruins of its dashed dreams.

films.title: Chronicle of a Summer

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In the summer of 1960, anthropologist filmmaker Jean Rouch and sociologist Edgar Morin set out to chronicle the everyday lives of Parisians through intimate interviews, debates and observation. Artists, factory workers, students, and others open up to share their experiences, fears and aspirations.
films.short_synopsis_html: In the summer of 1960, anthropologist filmmaker Jean Rouch and sociologist Edgar Morin set out to chronicle the everyday lives of Parisians through intimate interviews, debates and observation. Artists, factory workers, students, and others open up to share their experiences, fears and aspirations.
films.default_editorial: From the simplest of starting points, this remarkable documentary—a collaboration between an anthropologist and a sociologist—metamorphoses into a revealing, reflexive study of human behavior and belief. An influential classic of cinema vérité—in fact, co-director Edgar Morin coined the term!

films.title: Suzhou River

content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Along the banks of the Suzhou River, Marda falls in love with a young woman named Moudan. When he loses her in an attempted kidnapping gone wrong, she seems to disappear into the river forever—until he meets MeiMei, a woman who performs in a nightclub and who happens to look exactly like Moudan.

films.default_editorial: Now dazzlingly restored, Lou Ye’s seductive neo-noir casts a mysterious spell over Shanghai, where industrialization and myths dreamily collide. Echoes of Vertigo ricochet through this love story, an urban fairytale haunted by wandering city slickers, beautiful lookalikes, and shimmering mermaids.

films.title: Tokyo-Ga

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: German director Wim Wenders travels to Tokyo to explore the world of one of his cinematic heroes, Japanese celebrated film director Yasujirō Ozu. Sequences of Wenders’ view of Japan alternate with encounters and conversations with the crew and cast members of Ozu’s films.
films.short_synopsis_html: German director Wim Wenders travels to Tokyo to explore the world of one of his cinematic heroes, Japanese celebrated film director Yasujirō Ozu. Sequences of Wenders’ view of Japan alternate with encounters and conversations with the crew and cast members of Ozu’s films.
films.default_editorial: Four decades before Perfect Days , Wim Wenders journeyed to his beloved Tokyo to fashion this heartfelt ode to Yasujirō Ozu. Featuring interviews with the Japanese master’s actors—and a rare glimpse of Chris Marker!—Tokyo-Ga is at once a poignant travelogue and a love letter to a cinematic idol.

films.title: Mishima: A Life in Four Chapters
films.original_title: Mishima: A Life in Four Chapters
films.title_upcase: MISHIMA: A LIFE IN FOUR CHAPTERS

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: November 25, 1970. Yukio Mishima, the acclaimed Japanese author, faces his final day. Meanwhile, interrupting flashbacks intertwine Mishima’s past with scenes from his works, revealing the inner turmoil and contradictions of a man who attempted an impossible harmony between self, art, and society.
films.short_synopsis_html: November 25, 1970. Yukio Mishima, the acclaimed Japanese author, faces his final day. Meanwhile, interrupting flashbacks intertwine Mishima’s past with scenes from his works, revealing the inner turmoil and contradictions of a man who attempted an impossible harmony between self, art, and society.
films.default_editorial: For the centenary of Yukio Mishima’s birth, we’re revisiting one of cinema’s greatest experiments in biopic form. Drawing from the Japanese iconoclast’s life and art, director Paul Schrader harmonizes a series of fractured sketches into a ravishing, expressionist elegy for violent transcendence.

films.title: The Bohemian Life

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In Paris, three penniless artists, all kindred spirits, share their views of the world and their love stories over a bottle of wine. Marcel is an unsuccessful writer with a penchant for monumental drama, Rodolfo, an Albanian painter with no visa, and Schaunard, an avant-garde composer of noise.
films.short_synopsis_html: In Paris, three penniless artists, all kindred spirits, share their views of the world and their love stories over a bottle of wine. Marcel is an unsuccessful writer with a penchant for monumental drama, Rodolfo, an Albanian painter with no visa, and Schaunard, an avant-garde composer of noise.
films.default_editorial: Loosely based on Henri Murger’s renowned novel, Aki Kaurismäki’s first French-language feature infuses a deadpan Finnish humor into the romanticism of Paris, evocatively shot in black and white. Hung over frugal bistro lunches and cheap red wine are contemplations on the foibles of artists’ lives.

films.title: Ariel

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Taisto is a newly unemployed Lapland miner who sets off in a convertible Cadillac for a fresh start in Helsinki. Joined in his odyssey by parking attendant Irmeli and her young son, Taitso’s plans take a series of unexpected turns when he gets framed for a crime he didn’t commit.
films.short_synopsis_html: Taisto is a newly unemployed Lapland miner who sets off in a convertible Cadillac for a fresh start in Helsinki. Joined in his odyssey by parking attendant Irmeli and her young son, Taitso’s plans take a series of unexpected turns when he gets framed for a crime he didn’t commit.
films.default_editorial: A romantic road movie that has little time for traditional notions of love and happiness, this second part of the Proletariat Trilogy finds Kaurismäki taking his first leap into genre territory. Fit to burst with existential yearning, Ariel is a ruthlessly unsentimental tale of escape and survival.

films.title: Eraserhead

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In an industrial town, Henry lives in an abandoned building amidst constant noise and smoke. He finds solace in the Lady in the Radiator’s music. His girlfriend, Mary X, has fits and gives birth to a terrifying mutant child, injecting sexual imagery into the chaotic mix.
films.short_synopsis_html: In an industrial town, Henry lives in an abandoned building amidst constant noise and smoke. He finds solace in the Lady in the Radiator’s music. His girlfriend, Mary X, has fits and gives birth to a terrifying mutant child, injecting sexual imagery into the chaotic mix.
films.default_editorial: One of the great independent features, David Lynch’s 1977 debut is a miracle of craft and sound design. Featuring an enigmatic lead performance from Jack Nance and spilled-ink lensing from Frederick Elms, Eraserhead is a visionary nightmare that plunders the darkest recesses of the American psyche.

content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: 17-year-old Lucas is drifting through his last year of boarding school until the sudden death of his father strips away everything he took for granted. Left filled with anger and despair, he visits his older brother in Paris seeking comfort in the new city.
films.short_synopsis_html: 17-year-old Lucas is drifting through his last year of boarding school until the sudden death of his father strips away everything he took for granted. Left filled with anger and despair, he visits his older brother in Paris seeking comfort in the new city.
films.default_editorial: Christophe Honoré returns to his timeless themes of family, mortality, and sexuality in a gay coming-of-age story imbued with breathtaking poignancy. As a teenager trying to make sense of grief, newcomer Paul Kircher is devastatingly good—and shares the screen with none other than Juliette Binoche.

films.title: The Bones

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: The world’s first stop-motion animation film is excavated as Chile drafts a new Constitution. The film shows a girl performing a ritual exorcism to free Chile from its feudal heritage. Among a dance of bones, organs, and body parts, the spirits of two damned Secretaries of State are invoked.
films.short_synopsis_html: The world’s first stop-motion animation film is excavated as Chile drafts a new Constitution. films.default_editorial: A major prizewinner at the Venice Film Festival, this stop-motion danse macabre from Chilean filmmaking duo Joaquín Cociña and Cristóbal León (The Wolf House) evokes the spirit of early Tim Burton. Executive produced by Ari Aster (Hereditary), The Bones is an incantatory gothic fantasia.

content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In the Gulf of Djibouti, a platoon of the French Foreign Legion repairs the roads and trains for war under the strict discipline of Sergeant Galoup. For him, this male community represents his life and home. But the order will gradually break with the arrival of the recruit Sentain.
films.short_synopsis_html: In the Gulf of Djibouti, a platoon of the French Foreign Legion repairs the roads and trains for war under the strict discipline of Sergeant Galoup. films.default_editorial: Set amid the French Foreign Legion in the sun-parched desert landscapes of Djibouti, Claire Denis’s masterpiece is a hypnotic exploration of obsessive male desire, masculine codes, and the dark legacy of colonialism. Bonus: Denis Lavant’s magnetic disco moves in a dance scene for the ages.

But when Iris discovers she is pregnant after a one-night stand, years of pent-up rage explode in a shocking outburst.

One of his greatest films, the bleak social realism soon takes a turn into viciously dark comedy, as Kati Outinen’s downtrodden protagonist wreaks revenge on her relentless persecutors.

films.title: Revanche

films.short_synopsis: In a ragged section of Vienna, hardened ex-con Alex works in a brothel, where he falls for Ukrainian sex worker Tamara. Their desperate plans for escape unexpectedly intersect with the lives of a rural cop and his seemingly content wife, leading to acts of vengeance and redemption.
films.short_synopsis_html: In a ragged section of Vienna, hardened ex-con Alex works in a brothel, where he falls for Ukrainian sex worker Tamara. films.default_editorial: Austrian filmmaker Götz Spielmann scored an Oscar® nomination for Best Foreign Language Film for this simmering revenge thriller. A lovers-on-the-lam tale that kicks off with a catastrophic bank robbery, Revanche smartly eschews genre cliché for a thoughtfully open-ended social and moral enquiry.

films.title: Jaggi

films.short_synopsis: In rural Punjab, a schoolboy’s impotence leads to accusations of being gay, triggering relentless bullying. Amid this torment and dark family revelations, he battles inner demons that push him further to the edge. When pressured into an arranged marriage, he’s forced to make a heartbreaking choice.
films.short_synopsis_html: In rural Punjab, a schoolboy’s impotence leads to accusations of being gay, triggering relentless bullying. films.default_editorial: Made in a DIY fashion, this Punjabi indie is a testament to the audacious passion of its crew. Backed by Ramnish Chaudhary’s gut-wrenching portrayal of the titular Jaggi, Anmol Sidhu’s remarkable directorial debut boldly confronts toxic masculinity and clichéd Punjabi machismo tropes onscreen.

films.short_synopsis: Mouchette is an adolescent living in the rough countryside. Her mother is dying and her father is absent. Remaining silent in the face of the humiliations she undergoes she finds respite in the woods. Everything changes when she meets poacher Arsene.

films.default_editorial: Among the very best of Robert Bresson’s films, Mouchette is a supreme example of the refined, enormously evocative style of its filmmaker: a cathartic purge of emotion, a tragedy in its most fundamental sense. An unforgettable Nadine Nortier leads this profoundly poignant, affecting film.

films.short_synopsis: Daniella Carter, Koko Da Doll, Liyah Mitchell, and Dominique Silver are four Black transgender women navigating the sex work industry in Atlanta and New York City. They recount tales of resilience, survival, and identity—challenging stereotypes and revealing the harsh realities of their world.
films.short_synopsis_html: Daniella Carter, Koko Da Doll, Liyah Mitchell, and Dominique Silver are four Black transgender women navigating the sex work industry in Atlanta and New York City. films.default_editorial: Shunned by the music industry after her transition, Grammy-nominated record producer D. Smith brings a dynamic sense of rhythm to her format-defying debut. A raw and honest look at the lives of Black trans sex workers in New York and Georgia, Kokomo City breaks social stigmas with a vivacious style.

films.title: Soul Kitchen

content_rating.label: caution

films.short_synopsis: Owner of a locals-only diner in Hamburg, Zinos is down on his luck. His girlfriend has moved to Shanghai, customers are boycotting the kitchen’s new gourmet menu, and he’s now got back issues. Things improve when a hip crowd embraces his revamped restaurant, but that doesn’t fix Zinos’ broken heart.

films.default_editorial: A change of pace from flexible director Fatih Akin (Head On, In the Fade), this ensemble comedy is a crowd-pleasing, lively look at the frantic and frenzied reality of running a restaurant. Set in Hamburg, Soul Kitchen is another of Akin’s depictions of modern, multicultural Germany.

films.title: Kings of the Road

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A roving film projector repairman saves the life of a depressed psychologist who has driven his car into a river. They end up on the road together, traveling from one rural German movie theater to another. Along the way, the two men, each running from his past, bond over their shared loneliness.
films.short_synopsis_html: A roving film projector repairman saves the life of a depressed psychologist who has driven his car into a river. They end up on the road together, traveling from one rural German movie theater to another. Along the way, the two men, each running from his past, bond over their shared loneliness.
films.default_editorial: A landmark film from the New German Cinema, Wenders’s iconic road movie offers up a cool portrait of post-war Germany—and its cinemas—through two lonely, sensitive souls. Photographed in sumptuous black-and-white by legendary cinematographer Robby Müller, the film was also dedicated to Fritz Lang!

films.title: Naked

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Johnny is a charming and eloquent, but relentlessly vicious, drifter. Rejecting anyone who might care for him, the volcanic Johnny hurls himself around London on a nocturnal odyssey, colliding with a succession of other desperate and dispossessed people and scorching everyone in his path.
films.short_synopsis_html: Johnny is a charming and eloquent, but relentlessly vicious, drifter. Rejecting anyone who might care for him, the volcanic Johnny hurls himself around London on a nocturnal odyssey, colliding with a succession of other desperate and dispossessed people and scorching everyone in his path.
films.default_editorial: With a manic and dark sense of humor, an unforgettable David Thewlis drifts through the cold streets of London on a probing, desperate and furious existential odyssey. One of the greatest works from British filmmaker Mike Leigh, Naked deservedly won the Best Actor and Best Director awards at Cannes.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini explores the deadly mating habits of bees. As the huge queen bee lays about all day producing eggs, a horny yet doomed drone bee awaits his new female lover.
films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini explores the deadly mating habits of bees. As the huge queen bee lays about all day producing eggs, a horny yet doomed drone bee awaits his new female lover.
films.default_editorial: Internecine squabbling, regal indolence, lecherous appetites—the queen bee runs a royal household like any other. Expounding on the division of sexual labor within the imperial headquarters, this sanguineous short weighs the pound of flesh taken as payment for the privilege of servicing the boss.

films.title: As If

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: William Kentridge begins to paint black curved brushstrokes that align, but only from one point of view, into the shape of a horse. He debates with his doppelgänger, who sits on a tall wooden horse. The artist and a team of collaborators start to work on a large abstract sculpture.
films.short_synopsis_html: William Kentridge begins to paint black curved brushstrokes that align, but only from one point of view, into the shape of a horse. He debates with his doppelgänger, who sits on a tall wooden horse. The artist and a team of collaborators start to work on a large abstract sculpture.
films.default_editorial: Anamorphic riddles suddenly take on recognizable forms in this ingenious episode, as the doppelgängers trade malapropisms and discuss the essence of perception. While Tom Waits croons about eggs and sausage, Kentridge examines “the chaos that sits inside the coherence” of his studio practice.

films.title: The 36th Chamber of Shaolin
films.original_title: 少林三十六房 | Shao Lin san shi liu fang

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: San Te, a civilian on the run from oppressive Manchu officers, takes refuge in a Shaolin temple where he devotes himself to the most rigorous of kung fu training. Each of the temple’s chambers specializes in one precise aspect of training—be it swordplay, wrist strength, eyesight, or enlightenment.
films.short_synopsis_html: San Te, a civilian on the run from oppressive Manchu officers, takes refuge in a Shaolin temple where he devotes himself to the most rigorous of kung fu training. films.default_editorial: Martial arts movies don’t come more iconic than this kung fu masterpiece from director Lau Kar-leung. With an acute focus on the disciplines of combat, it’s the ultimate training film, as Gordon Liu’s lithe apprentice eschews the path of vengeance for one of grace and spiritual self-determination.

films.title: A Short Story
films.original_title: 破碎太阳之心 | Pòsuì tàiyáng zhī xīn

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: Once upon a time, there was a strange black cat in a long trenchcoat with no friends, no home, and no purpose in life. However, one day, an encounter with a scarecrow sets the black cat off on a mysterious quest to answer a single question: What is the most precious thing in the world?
films.short_synopsis_html: Once upon a time, there was a strange black cat in a long trenchcoat with no friends, no home, and no purpose in life. However, one day, an encounter with a scarecrow sets the black cat off on a mysterious quest to answer a single question: What is the most precious thing in the world?
films.default_editorial: All the inventiveness of Bi Gan—the Chinese cineaste best known for an epic with an astonishing hour-long take—is channeled into his spellbinding new short. Unfurling from a feline point-of-view, this surrealist trick film draws from the realm of dreams and is brimming with technical magic.
