films.title: A Summer's Tale

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Graduate Gaspard goes on holiday to the seaside. He’s hoping his sort-of girlfriend Léna will join him there, but as time passes, he welcomes the interest of Margot. When Margot encourages him to date her friend Solène, he complies. But when Léna turns up, Gaspard will have to choose.
films.short_synopsis_html: Graduate Gaspard goes on holiday to the seaside. He’s hoping his sort-of girlfriend Léna will join him there, but as time passes, he welcomes the interest of Margot. When Margot encourages him to date her friend Solène, he complies. But when Léna turns up, Gaspard will have to choose.
films.default_editorial: Another gorgeously sun-drenched drama from New Wave director Éric Rohmer, this tender, often playful coming-of-age story captures the curiously mercurial nature of first love. One of his “Tales of the Four Seasons,” it stars Amanda Langlet, who played the titular character in Pauline at the Beach.

films.title: Masculin Féminin

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Paul is young, just demobbed from service in the French Army, and disillusioned with civilian life. While his girlfriend builds herself a career as a pop singer, Paul becomes more isolated from his peers—“the children of Marx and Coca Cola”, as the credits announce—and from their social politics.
films.short_synopsis_html: Paul is young, just demobbed from service in the French Army, and disillusioned with civilian life. While his girlfriend builds herself a career as a pop singer, Paul becomes more isolated from his peers—“the children of Marx and Coca Cola”, as the credits announce—and from their social politics.
films.default_editorial: Humming with energy, pop music, politics, sex, and above all cinema, this classic is a model of filmmaking freedom. Starring Jean-Pierre Léaud and yé-yé singer Chantal Goya, this is a recent restoration of one of the most emblematic films of 1960s Paris, and a must-see in Godard’s filmography!

films.title: Harvest of Devotion

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: William Kentridge recreates rehearsals for previous performance pieces. He reads a phonetic poem with performers Hamilton Dlamini, Mncedisi Shabangu, Nhlanhla Mahlangu and Mica Manganye. In contrast, they read John Chilembwe’s 1915 letter to the Nyasaland Times, arguing for equal standing in Malawi.
films.short_synopsis_html: William Kentridge recreates rehearsals for previous performance pieces. He reads a phonetic poem with performers Hamilton Dlamini, Mncedisi Shabangu, Nhlanhla Mahlangu and Mica Manganye. In contrast, they read John Chilembwe’s 1915 letter to the Nyasaland Times, arguing for equal standing in Malawi.
films.default_editorial: Dadaist sound poems, exploding pigeons, and laments for the dead take center stage for a cinematic reimagining of Kentridge’s WWI centenary works The Head & the Load and KABOOM!. Elucidating the creative process, Episode 6 is a dynamic multidisciplinary interrogation of the paradoxes of colonialism.

films.title: Control

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In 1970s Manchester, troubled musician Ian Curtis is on the brink of international fame and fortune as lead singer of the band Joy Division. A husband and father, Curtis begins to feel the strain of his band’s growing success, his crumbling marriage to wife Deborah, and his worsening epilepsy.
films.short_synopsis_html: In 1970s Manchester, troubled musician Ian Curtis is on the brink of international fame and fortune as lead singer of the band Joy Division. A husband and father, Curtis begins to feel the strain of his band’s growing success, his crumbling marriage to wife Deborah, and his worsening epilepsy.
films.default_editorial: The story of Joy Division is given impecable treatment by auteur Anton Corbijn, who photographed the post-punk band in their heyday. Recalling the minimalist monochrome of Corbijn’s photography, this moody portrait of a doomed star features an electric and uncanny performance by Sam Riley.

films.title: Grand Theft Hamlet

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: With theaters shut during the COVID-19 pandemic, two jobless actors, Sam and Mark, are uncertain about their futures—finding solace in the virtual chaos of Grand Theft Auto Online. Desperate for purpose, they decide to stage Shakespeare’s Hamlet in the unpredictable world of their favorite game.
films.short_synopsis_html: With theaters shut during the COVID-19 pandemic, two jobless actors, Sam and Mark, are uncertain about their futures—finding solace in the virtual chaos of Grand Theft Auto Online. Desperate for purpose, they decide to stage Shakespeare’s Hamlet in the unpredictable world of their favorite game.
films.default_editorial: Swapping the tumult of a locked-down world for the anarchic digital hinterlands of gaming’s very own Wild West, this uproarious documentary yanks Shakespeare into the 21st century. Winner of the Grand Jury Award at SXSW, Grand Theft Hamlet finds community and creativity in the unlikeliest of places.

films.title: Our Voice of the Earth, Memory and the Future

films.title_upcase: OUR VOICE OF THE EARTH, MEMORY AND THE FUTURE

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: An alloy between two terms arbitrarily assumed to be dissimilar: the documentary record and the staging. Five years in the experience of an indigenous group to reveal from within the complexity of a process that goes from submission to organization.
films.short_synopsis_html: An alloy between two terms arbitrarily assumed to be dissimilar: the documentary record and the staging. Five years in the experience of an indigenous group to reveal from within the complexity of a process that goes from submission to organization.
films.default_editorial: Recently restored, Marta Rodríguez and Jorge Silva’s mystical first feature allies political force with aesthetic beauty. Cherishing the imperiled land and rituals of an indigenous people in Colombia, the couple’s rousing poetic documentary traces how history is made and cultures are kept alive.

films.short_synopsis: Small paper puppets and actors wearing masks endlessly dance in a fictional Soviet museum as William Kentridge documents the making of his 2022 installation Oh to Believe in Another World, made in response to Symphony No. 10 by the Russian composer Dmitri Shostakovich.
films.short_synopsis_html: Small paper puppets and actors wearing masks endlessly dance in a fictional Soviet museum as William Kentridge documents the making of his 2022 installation Oh to Believe in Another World, made in response to Symphony No. 10 by the Russian composer Dmitri Shostakovich.

episode.label: Self-Portrait as a Coffee-Pot - Episode 8
episode.episode_title: Oh to Believe in Another World

films.default_editorial: Stalin, Lenin, Trotsky, Mayakovsky—the Russian revolutionary gang’s all here for a rapturous dioramic staging of a Shostakovich symphony. With the aid of a little green-screen magic, Kentridge examines history as a construction, “as something that we make and understand, rather than just discover.”

films.title: Mädchen in Uniform

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: After being sent to a strict Prussian all-girls boarding school, Manuela is drawn out of her shell by the young and empathetic teacher Elizabeth von Bernburg. But when Manuela starts to fall in love with her kind-hearted teacher, a scandal erupts and rocks the school’s very foundation.
films.short_synopsis_html: After being sent to a strict Prussian all-girls boarding school, Manuela is drawn out of her shell by the young and empathetic teacher Elizabeth von Bernburg. But when Manuela starts to fall in love with her kind-hearted teacher, a scandal erupts and rocks the school’s very foundation.
films.default_editorial: In Leontine Sagan’s anti-fascist masterpiece, a key film in lesbian cinema history, a girlish crush ignites a revolution. Directed and written by women—as well as featuring an all-female cast—this is a landmark work in every sense: politically radical, visually mesmerizing, and swooningly romantic.

films.title: Green Porno: Snail

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini demonstrates the sadomasochistic mating habits of the snail. With its whole body tucked inside its shell, leaving one big slimy foot to crawl around on, the snail hides its penis and vagina until it spots a lover.
films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini demonstrates the sadomasochistic mating habits of the snail. With its whole body tucked inside its shell, leaving one big slimy foot to crawl around on, the snail hides its penis and vagina until it spots a lover.
films.default_editorial: Even snails are not impervious to crises of accommodation. Cramped quarters require troublesome contortion, leaving face and anus in incommodious proximity. Still, with each gastropod in possession of both male and female sex organs, it’s a small price to pay for never having to leave the house.

films.title: Rewind & Play

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In December 1969, legendary pianist and composer Thelonious Monk ended his European tour in Paris. Before the show, Monk appeared on French TV to perform and speak with French jazz pianist Henri Renaud. Newly discovered footage reveals the disconnect between Monk and his interviewer.
films.short_synopsis_html: In December 1969, legendary pianist and composer Thelonious Monk ended his European tour in Paris. Before the show, Monk appeared on French TV to perform and speak with French jazz pianist Henri Renaud. Newly discovered footage reveals the disconnect between Monk and his interviewer.
films.default_editorial: Working with unseen outtakes from a 1969 French TV interview, director Alain Gomis fashions a riveting, sharp-edged essay on the media’s treatment of a genius of jazz piano, Thelonious Monk. Hypnotic, nerve-wrangling, and immersive, Rewind and Play lets the music—and the silence—do the talking.

films.short_synopsis: Being a mamma requires sacrifice, especially for the Diaea ergandros. Isabella Rossellini explores how the spider lets herself be devoured by her babies.
films.short_synopsis_html: Being a mamma requires sacrifice, especially for the Diaea ergandros. Isabella Rossellini explores how the spider lets herself be devoured by her babies.
films.default_editorial: Cobwebs are heart strings to be pulled for maximum pathos in this melodramatic episode, in which our star zoologist enacts an arachnoid form of maternal altruism. Adorned with eight limbs and eight peepers, Isabella Rossellini deteriorates into abyssal motherly mush for her creepy-crawly children.

films.title: Born in Flames

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Ten years after a social-democratic cultural revolution in the US, Adelaide Norris, the Black radical founder of the Woman’s Army, is mysteriously killed. In response, a feminist insurgency—a coalition of women across all lines of race, class, and sexual preference—emerges to blow the System apart.
films.short_synopsis_html: Ten years after a social-democratic cultural revolution in the US, Adelaide Norris, the Black radical founder of the Woman’s Army, is mysteriously killed. In response, a feminist insurgency—a coalition of women across all lines of race, class, and sexual preference—emerges to blow the System apart.
films.default_editorial: Lizzie Borden’s incendiary work of feminist provocation and grungy, science-fiction futurism is charged with the energy of revolution. Born in Flames is both a vital time capsule of 1980s pre-gentrification New York and a disruptive, timely film that speaks so clearly to our discordant present.

films.title: Mystery Train

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A rock ’n roll-obsessed Japanese couple pays a visit to Graceland, the home of Elvis. An inept gang of thugs hide out after a liquor store robbery. A frazzled Italian widow has a ghostly encounter with the King himself. All their stories collide in one sleazy downtown motel in Memphis, Tennessee.
films.short_synopsis_html: A rock ’n roll-obsessed Japanese couple pays a visit to Graceland, the home of Elvis. An inept gang of thugs hide out after a liquor store robbery. A frazzled Italian widow has a ghostly encounter with the King himself. All their stories collide in one sleazy downtown motel in Memphis, Tennessee.
films.default_editorial: Among the most romantic depictions of Memphis, Tennessee ever put on film, Jim Jarmusch’s nocturnal odyssey takes in three tales across a single night in Elvis’s hometown. Oozing cool, Mystery Train remains Jarmusch’s most nostalgic work—an elegiac ode to the pop cultural relics of bygone Americana.

films.title: Seduce Me: Duck

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini reveals the complex seduction habits of ducks. While males show dominance by forcefully mating with her, the female duck will still choose which male will father her ducklings.
films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini reveals the complex seduction habits of ducks. While males show dominance by forcefully mating with her, the female duck will still choose which male will father her ducklings.
films.default_editorial: Rossellini gives a game, lively performance as a hen assailed by aggressive suitors in this short. If she leans into the crudeness often associated with this unexotic and ordinary bird, it’s only to better surprise us when she details the beauty and grace of the female duck’s reproductive system.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini explores how life and death surround the reproductive activities of salmon. Babies are born into the decay of their dead parents’ bodies, but they will avenge their parents’ deaths!

films.default_editorial: For the plucky salmon, the famous metaphor that compares orgasms to little deaths becomes quite gruesomely literal. Plastered in old-age makeup that gradually morphs into a bona fide horror scene, Isabella Rossellini brings a devilish touch of the macabre to the bliss of reproduction and birth.

films.title: Tavern Man

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: A typical day in the life of a lonely man who works in an unsuccessful tavern located in the historical center of Guimarães, an old town in Portugal. During the day, the man spends his time coming up with new menu items for his tavern, while at night he gets ready to meet someone special.
films.short_synopsis_html: A typical day in the life of a lonely man who works in an unsuccessful tavern located in the historical center of Guimarães, an old town in Portugal. During the day, the man spends his time coming up with new menu items for his tavern, while at night he gets ready to meet someone special.
films.default_editorial: Having just finished Le Havre in the titular French city, Aki Kaurismäki hopped over to Guimarães, Portugal to shoot his segment of the anthology film Centro Historico. Attuned to the gentle rhythms of the small tourist town, Tavern Man is a yearning, dialogue-free meditation on unfulfilled dreams.

films.title: I Hired a Contract Killer

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Henri Boulanger wants to die. Since his helpless attempts to end his days go down the drain, he hires a contract killer to do the job. While waiting for the killer, however, he makes the mistake of sipping a whisky for the first time in his life, meets a woman and promptly falls in love.
films.short_synopsis_html: Henri Boulanger wants to die. Since his helpless attempts to end his days go down the drain, he hires a contract killer to do the job. films.default_editorial: In his first collaboration with Aki Kaurismäki, iconic French star Jean-Pierre Léaud proves a perfect fit for the director’s droll and deadpan, not-quite-comedy style. Absurd and existential, the London-set I Hired a Contract Killer is a rare and fascinating outsider’s view of late-80s Britain.

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A woman, terrorised by an invisible force, enters a house at night. The rasping of crickets and a distorted music give way to explosions, screams and garbled voices. In an eruption of panicked subjectivity, her face multiplies across the screen while flashes of solarised imagery invade the frame…
films.short_synopsis_html: A woman, terrorised by an invisible force, enters a house at night. The rasping of crickets and a distorted music give way to explosions, screams and garbled voices. In an eruption of panicked subjectivity, her face multiplies across the screen while flashes of solarised imagery invade the frame…
films.default_editorial: The Austrian found footage auteur masterfully reworks sequences from Sidney J. Furie’s ’80s horror film The Entity to craft this tactile and immersive examination of cinematic space. Tscherkassky creates a maelstrom of audiovisual fragments and shards that delightfully destroy narrative norms.

films.title: Joy Division

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: An account of the musical journey and ongoing legacy of Joy Division, the influential Manchester post-punk rock band of the late 1970s, featuring interviews with the surviving band members (now known as New Order), never-before-seen live performance footage, and newly discovered audio tapes.
films.short_synopsis_html: An account of the musical journey and ongoing legacy of Joy Division, the influential Manchester post-punk rock band of the late 1970s, featuring interviews with the surviving band members (now known as New Order), never-before-seen live performance footage, and newly discovered audio tapes.
films.default_editorial: Documentarian Grant Gee reveals the mystical power of Joy Division in this extensive documentary on the rock band who played not for fame but from necessity. A brilliant insight into the youth punk culture of Britain, it is an essential watch for anyone curious about this musical phenomenon.
films.default_editorial_html: Documentarian Grant Gee reveals the mystical power of Joy Division in this extensive documentary on the rock band who played not for fame but from necessity. films.title: Perfumed Nightmare

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Young Kidlat is a jeepney driver in the Philippines, but his dream is to leave his village and travel to Europe, the embodiment of the technological advancement he idolizes. Instead, he discovers inhumane modernity no better than what he left behind.
films.short_synopsis_html: Young Kidlat is a jeepney driver in the Philippines, but his dream is to leave his village and travel to Europe, the embodiment of the technological advancement he idolizes. Instead, he discovers inhumane modernity no better than what he left behind.
films.default_editorial: In a surreal style entwining dream and documentary, Filipino actor-director Kidlat Tahimik’s debut creatively catches its disillusioned protagonist between the “First” and “Third” Worlds. A milestone film in post-colonial cinema, later championed stateside by Werner Herzog and Francis Ford Coppola.

Playing a shrimp ready to mate with another crustacean, Isabella Rossellini teasingly sheds her red paper shell, and the camera respectfully pans away. But life isn’t always rosy for the small shellfish…

films.title: A Personal Journey with Martin Scorsese Through American Movies
films.original_title: A Personal Journey with Martin Scorsese Through American Movies
films.title_upcase: A PERSONAL JOURNEY WITH MARTIN SCORSESE THROUGH AMERICAN MOVIES

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Martin Scorsese explores the history of American cinema by focusing on the work of a number of highly influential filmmakers. In addition to examining pioneering productions by D.W. Griffith and F.W. Murnau, he looks at a variety of key directors, while featuring interviews with cinema luminaries.
films.short_synopsis_html: Martin Scorsese explores the history of American cinema by focusing on the work of a number of highly influential filmmakers. In addition to examining pioneering productions by D.W. Griffith and F.W. Murnau, he looks at a variety of key directors, while featuring interviews with cinema luminaries.
films.default_editorial: Like having an intimate conversation with your favorite director about the movies, this acclaimed documentary offers a whirlwind tour through American film history. With his hallmark rapid-fire chat, Scorsese’s cinematic love letter is an inspiration (and a guiding light) for cinephiles everywhere.
films.default_editorial_html: Like having an intimate conversation with your favorite director about the movies, this acclaimed documentary offers a whirlwind tour through American film history. With his hallmark rapid-fire chat, Scorsese’s cinematic love letter is an inspiration (and a guiding light) for cinephiles everywhere.

films.title: Whores' Glory

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In Bangkok, Thailand, women punch a clock and wait for clients in a brightly lit glass box; in the red-light district of Faridpur, Bangladesh, a madam haggles over the price of a teenage girl; and in the border town of Reynosa, Mexico, crack-addicted women pray to a deity named Lady Death.
films.short_synopsis_html: In Bangkok, Thailand, women punch a clock and wait for clients in a brightly lit glass box; in the red-light district of Faridpur, Bangladesh, a madam haggles over the price of a teenage girl; and in the border town of Reynosa, Mexico, crack-addicted women pray to a deity named Lady Death.
films.default_editorial: This beautiful, unsettling documentary from the adventurous maverick Michael Glawogger travels from Thailand to Bangladesh to Mexico to view how the oldest profession differs across cultures. The candid, intimate experiences of sex workers form the empathetic center of this remarkable film.
films.default_editorial_html: This beautiful, unsettling documentary from the adventurous maverick Michael Glawogger travels from Thailand to Bangladesh to Mexico to view how the oldest profession differs across cultures. films.title: Short Sharp Shock

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Gabriel, Bobby and Costa are old friends from Altona, a multicultural hood in Hamburg. Just out of prison, Gabriel wants to turn his back on crime, but the others continue to operate as petty criminals. Friendships are tested as the trio navigate a dark world of mafia bosses and deals gone wrong.
films.short_synopsis_html: Gabriel, Bobby and Costa are old friends from Altona, a multicultural hood in Hamburg. Friendships are tested as the trio navigate a dark world of mafia bosses and deals gone wrong.
films.default_editorial: Credited with ushering in a new era of multicultural German filmmaking, Fatih Akin’s vital debut is as tonally volatile as a classic Scorsese gangster film. Loving family celebrations are juxtaposed with dangerous underground deeds, weaving a vibrant and complex tapestry of immigrant life in Hamburg

films.title: Purple Noon

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Wealthy Mr Greenleaf hires Tom Ripley to bring back his son Philippe from Italy to the US, as he fears that he is squandering his inheritance. However, when Tom becomes attracted to Philippe’s lifestyle and girlfriend, his intentions take a lethal turn as he decides to take on Phillipe’s identity.
films.short_synopsis_html: Wealthy Mr Greenleaf hires Tom Ripley to bring back his son Philippe from Italy to the US, as he fears that he is squandering his inheritance. However, when Tom becomes attracted to Philippe’s lifestyle and girlfriend, his intentions take a lethal turn as he decides to take on Phillipe’s identity.
films.default_editorial: Before Matt Damon, Dennis Hopper, and Andrew Scott, there was Alain Delon: the first actor to portray Patricia Highsmith’s talented Tom Ripley on screen. Murder and deception are on the menu in this queer-coded thriller, which takes to Italy for a sun-baked sojourn with the beautiful and the damned.

films.title: Boro in the Box

content_rating.label: adult
content_rating.description: Contains very strong sexual and/or violent content.

films.short_synopsis: A fantasized portrayal of Polish auteur Walerian Borowczyk: Boro in the Box discovers a cruel and obscene world. He experiences banal yet colorful adventures, from Poland to Paris, caressing erotic birds and organic cameras in a phantasmagorical Alphabet.
films.short_synopsis_html: A fantasized portrayal of Polish auteur Walerian Borowczyk: Boro in the Box discovers a cruel and obscene world. He experiences banal yet colorful adventures, from Poland to Paris, caressing erotic birds and organic cameras in a phantasmagorical Alphabet.
films.default_editorial: Bertrand Mandico (The Wild Boys) defied all expectations of the genre with his surreal and captivating biopic of the Polish filmmaker Walerian Borowczyk. A fictionalized account of Borowczyk’s life, Boro in the Box is an elliptical paean to his singularly provocative cinema.

films.title: Dawson City: Frozen Time

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: Using archival footage to tell the story, Dawson City: Frozen Time pieces together the bizarre true history of a collection of some 500 films dating from 1910s-1920s, which were lost for over 50 years until being discovered buried in a sub-arctic swimming pool deep in the Yukon Territory in 1978.
films.short_synopsis_html: Using archival footage to tell the story, Dawson City: Frozen Time pieces together the bizarre true history of a collection of some 500 films dating from 1910s-1920s, which were lost for over 50 years until being discovered buried in a sub-arctic swimming pool deep in the Yukon Territory in 1978.
films.default_editorial: A history lesson had never been so mesmerizing! This wondrous work of cinematic excavation by Bill Morrison is an archival odyssey into the abyss of capitalism. The documentary is an exquisite ode to the materiality of celluloid and a political and poetic act of resistance in the digital age.
films.default_editorial_html: A history lesson had never been so mesmerizing! This wondrous work of cinematic excavation by Bill Morrison is an archival odyssey into the abyss of capitalism. films.title: Hara-kiri: Death of a Samurai

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Poverty-stricken samurai Hanshiro is seeking an honorable end. He requests to commit hara-kiri in a feudal lord’s courtyard. Trying to dismiss his wish, the lord recounts a similar plea from a young samurai years ago. But soon he will realize that Hanshiro’s request is different from what it seems.
films.short_synopsis_html: Poverty-stricken samurai Hanshiro is seeking an honorable end. He requests to commit hara-kiri in a feudal lord’s courtyard. Trying to dismiss his wish, the lord recounts a similar plea from a young samurai years ago. But soon he will realize that Hanshiro’s request is different from what it seems.
films.default_editorial: Following the explosive 13 Assassins, the iconoclastic Takashi Miike revisited the samurai genre with this underrated remake of the 1962 classic Harakiri. Scored by the legendary Ryuichi Sakamoto, Death of a Samurai is an elegant reckoning with notions of sacrifice and duty in the 17th century.

films.title: Coffee and Cigarettes

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In a series of comic vignettes, various well-known actors and musicians sit down to talk about almost anything—from Tesla coils to jukeboxes, long-lost relatives to the dentist. The conversations are separate in time and place, but they all have two things in common: coffee and cigarettes.
films.short_synopsis_html: In a series of comic vignettes, various well-known actors and musicians sit down to talk about almost anything—from Tesla coils to jukeboxes, long-lost relatives to the dentist. The conversations are separate in time and place, but they all have two things in common: coffee and cigarettes.
films.default_editorial: Made over 15 years, this cooler-than-cool compilation by Jim Jarmusch is a veritable buffet of deadpan comedy and an extended jam session with the hippest cast of the ‘00s, from RZA and GZA to Bill Murray and the White Stripes. To quote Iggy Pop: "Cigarettes and coffee, man, that’s a combination."

films.short_synopsis: As she fries some calamari, Isabella Rossellini takes an intimate look at the romantic sex lives of the squid. When two squid have a passionate twenty-arm embrace, things get steamy.
films.short_synopsis_html: As she fries some calamari, Isabella Rossellini takes an intimate look at the romantic sex lives of the squid. When two squid have a passionate twenty-arm embrace, things get steamy.
films.default_editorial: Rossellini’s affection for the natural world is evident throughout the Green Porno series, and made explicit in this engaging, militant film. Backed by a biologist, the star shows with both candor and urgency the impact that our fondness for fried calamari can have on the life cycle of a squid.

films.title: Gasoline Rainbow

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: With high school in the rearview, five teenagers from inland Oregon embark on one last adventure. Piling into a van with a busted tail light, their mission takes them to a place they’ve never been—the Pacific coast, five hundred miles away. Their plan, in full: “Fuck it.”
films.short_synopsis_html: With high school in the rearview, five teenagers from inland Oregon embark on one last adventure. Piling into a van with a busted tail light, their mission takes them to a place they’ve never been—the Pacific coast, five hundred miles away. Their plan, in full: “Fuck it.”
films.default_editorial: Reimagining the road movie with the next generation of misfits, celebrated directorial duo the Ross Brothers make a coming-of-age film that runs on free-flowing feeling. Alive with friendship and the promise of the moment, Gasoline Rainbow is a beautiful reminder of what matters and what’s real.

films.title: Green Porno: Spider

films.short_synopsis: A six-eyed and eight-legged Isabella Rossellini explores the treacherous mating habits of the spider. With his hand-like appendages covered in sperm, the male spider makes his way to the web of the dangerous female spider.
films.short_synopsis_html: A six-eyed and eight-legged Isabella Rossellini explores the treacherous mating habits of the spider. With his hand-like appendages covered in sperm, the male spider makes his way to the web of the dangerous female spider.
films.default_editorial: Itsy bitsy adventurer of childhood legend or hell-demon fueler of arachnophobic nightmares? Those inclined toward the latter ungovernable philosophy aren’t likely to be swayed by this svelte explication of the spider’s sexual practices—a terrifying hit-and-run job fraught with cannibalistic peril.

films.title: World of Glory

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: On the outskirts of a Swedish city, a crowd watches as naked men, women, and children are herded into a lorry and driven to their deaths. A plain, middle-aged man turns to the camera. He begins a guided tour of his life, showing his loveless marriage, dull job, and mundane day-to-day activities.
films.short_synopsis_html: On the outskirts of a Swedish city, a crowd watches as naked men, women, and children are herded into a lorry and driven to their deaths. A plain, middle-aged man turns to the camera. He begins a guided tour of his life, showing his loveless marriage, dull job, and mundane day-to-day activities.
films.default_editorial: A prelude to the director’s acclaimed studies of human alienation, this magnificent short from Swedish master Roy Andersson is shattering yet darkly ironic. Unfurling in drab domestic and public spaces, World of Glory lays bare the grotesque numbness of a man’s life, and modern society at large.

films.title: Metamorphosis

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: As William Kentridge explores metamorphosis, sounds are visualized through painting, a shadow turns into a sculpture, time morphs into a film strip, and an abstract blotch becomes an image. Meanwhile, the performers Joanna Dudley and Ann Masina act out a myth from Ovid’s Metamorphoses.
films.short_synopsis_html: As William Kentridge explores metamorphosis, sounds are visualized through painting, a shadow turns into a sculpture, time morphs into a film strip, and an abstract blotch becomes an image. Meanwhile, the performers Joanna Dudley and Ann Masina act out a myth from Ovid’s Metamorphoses.
films.default_editorial: Film’s ability to turn time into a physical element of weight and substance kicks off this episode’s wondrous inquiry into the nature of transformation. Icarus and Philomela leap from the well-thumbed pages of Ovid, as ideas find protean form in the improvisatory chaos of doodles, music, and dance.

films.title: Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives

films.title_upcase: UNCLE BOONMEE WHO CAN RECALL HIS PAST LIVES

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Dying from kidney failure, Uncle Boonmee spends his final days in the countryside, where he has visions of his past lives and is visited by different spirits and loved ones. Contemplating the reasons for his illness, Boonmee treks through the jungle with his family to a mysterious hilltop cave.
films.short_synopsis_html: Dying from kidney failure, Uncle Boonmee spends his final days in the countryside, where he has visions of his past lives and is visited by different spirits and loved ones. Contemplating the reasons for his illness, Boonmee treks through the jungle with his family to a mysterious hilltop cave.
films.default_editorial: Winner of the Palme d’Or, Apichatpong Weerasethakul’s gentle, quietly audacious tale of memories shows past lives reinvented, with each 16mm film reel subtly taking a different style—horror film, fairy tale, and more. A film that finds comfort in the mysteries around us, and a modern masterpiece.

films.title: From What is Before

films.short_synopsis: The Philippines, 1972. Mysterious things are happening in a remote barrio. Wails are heard from the forest, cows are hacked to death, a man is found bleeding to death at the crossroad and houses are burned.
films.short_synopsis_html: The Philippines, 1972. Mysterious things are happening in a remote barrio. Wails are heard from the forest, cows are hacked to death, a man is found bleeding to death at the crossroad and houses are burned.
films.default_editorial: Lav’s Golden Leopard winner in Locarno is an epic remembrance of a period of transition that marked the traumatic time of dictator Ferdinand Marcos’ rule. The film’s structure unfurls with slow power, growing increasingly complex, political, and emotional over its five-and-a-half hour story.

films.title: Mammas: Hamster

content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: On trial for eating her tenth baby, Isabella Rossellini pleads that if she were a hamster, this would be considered natural. Rossellini takes a close look at the infanticidal maternal instincts of the hamster.
films.short_synopsis_html: On trial for eating her tenth baby, Isabella Rossellini pleads that if she were a hamster, this would be considered natural. Rossellini takes a close look at the infanticidal maternal instincts of the hamster.
films.default_editorial: Sentimentality, be damned: the killer females of this rodent order are merciless when it comes to newborns. Slipping out of prison uniform and into a furry onesie, our informative host discerns the strengths and shortcomings of a new litter with pragmatism—and an appetite for whichever is the runt.

films.title: The Hypnosis

content_rating.label: caution

films.short_synopsis: Vera and André are a couple who get the chance to pitch their startup business at a prestigious pitching competition. Right before the contest, Vera tries hypnotherapy to quit smoking, with an unexpected side effect: she loses all social inhibitions.
films.short_synopsis_html: Vera and André are a couple who get the chance to pitch their startup business at a prestigious pitching competition. Right before the contest, Vera tries hypnotherapy to quit smoking, with an unexpected side effect: she loses all social inhibitions.
films.default_editorial: For his zany feature debut, Ernst De Geer mounts a biting satire of startup culture, where authenticity is just another branded product for sale. Wreaking havoc as a modern couple on the verge of chaos, stars Asta Kamma August and Herbert Nordrum channel millennial anxiety with terrifying accuracy.

films.title: Mammas: Maternal Instinct

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini reflects on how all mothers cannot help being maternal. She touches on the various maternal instincts—some heart-warming, some disturbing—of the animals she explores throughout Mammas.
films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini reflects on how all mothers cannot help being maternal. She touches on the various maternal instincts—some heart-warming, some disturbing—of the animals she explores throughout Mammas.
films.default_editorial: Introducing her Mammas series, Isabella Rossellini sets up the sticky question of feminine nature. Darwinian theories of evolution suggest women are born caregivers—but when the iconic actor gets into the mindset of various female creatures, she complicates that claim with mischievous delight.

films.title: La antena

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: An entire city has lost its voice. Mr. TV, the owner of the city’s only television channel, is carrying out a sinister plan to control all of the city’s inhabitants. He kidnaps a singer, the only one who still has The Voice. An inventor witnesses the kidnapping and flees to thwart approaching doom.

films.default_editorial: The first film ever to screen on MUBI, this surreal fairytale from visionary auteur Esteban Sapir champions the power of the human voice over consumerism and totalitarian control. Using the language of silent cinema, La Antena devises a fantastical dreamscape, packed with eye-popping visual effects.

films.title: Scott Walker: 30 Century Man

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Four years in the making, this documentary is an in-depth look at the enigmatic American musician who turned his back on fame to follow a very singular and uncompromising artistic path, and who morphed into one of the most influential and enigmatic figures in rock history.
films.short_synopsis_html: Four years in the making, this documentary is an in-depth look at the enigmatic American musician who turned his back on fame to follow a very singular and uncompromising artistic path, and who morphed into one of the most influential and enigmatic figures in rock history.
films.default_editorial: Scott Walker began as a teen heartthrob in the 1960s, moved to covering Jacques Brel songs with his incredible voice, and evolved into one of the most complex contemporary artists. A new picture of Walker emerges in this rare look at his creative process and masterpiece album The Drift.

films.title: The Future Tense

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: When two Irish filmmakers travel home from London with their daughter, they reflect on their relationship to Ireland, and their adopted home, England. They explore their own experiences in ageing, parenting, and mental illness, along with the brutal history that lies beneath Ireland’s heavy earth.
films.short_synopsis_html: When two Irish filmmakers travel home from London with their daughter, they reflect on their relationship to Ireland, and their adopted home, England. They explore their own experiences in ageing, parenting, and mental illness, along with the brutal history that lies beneath Ireland’s heavy earth.
films.default_editorial: Bumpy journeys across the Irish Sea don’t come more timely than this. Playing with turbulent, limbo-like airspace between London and Dublin, directorial duo Christine Molloy and Joe Lawlor make profound use of poetic license to investigate what it means, in a fast-changing present, to belong.

films.title: A Cambodian Spring

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Over the course of six years, three land-rights activists are caught up in the chaotic and often violent wave of change that is shaping modern-day Cambodia. The three speak out against the injustices taking place all around them in the name of progress, development, and democracy.
films.short_synopsis_html: Over the course of six years, three land-rights activists are caught up in the chaotic and often violent wave of change that is shaping modern-day Cambodia. The three speak out against the injustices taking place all around them in the name of progress, development, and democracy.
films.default_editorial: It took Irish filmmaker Chris Kelly six years to complete this unwavering survey of the Cambodian conflict, achieving unexpected universality with his focus on the power of activism in the face of corruption. A raw documentary on the uprising of a nation carrying the weight of a violent history.

films.title: The Factory

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Visiting day. Lindalva prepares food to take to her son in jail. Metruti shaves and wears the best clothes to welcome his mother. Today is a very special day and he really needs to make a phone call. His mother is taking the risk to smuggle a cell phone for him into the penitentiary…
films.short_synopsis_html: Visiting day. Lindalva prepares food to take to her son in jail. Metruti shaves and wears the best clothes to welcome his mother. films.default_editorial: The space of a jail is portrayed with gritty yet striking aesthetics in this Brazilian short film, from which shines the bright humanism that lies at its core. The Factory depicts the relationship between a mother and son, and the intricate machinations needed to provide justice within the prison.

films.title: Leningrad Cowboys Go America

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A struggling Siberian rock band leaves home in the lonely tundra to tour the United States because, as they’re told, “they’ll buy anything there.” The musicians bravely venture across the States, carrying a bandmate and some beer in a coffin, and sporting hairdos resembling unicorn horns.
films.short_synopsis_html: A struggling Siberian rock band leaves home in the lonely tundra to tour the United States because, as they’re told, “they’ll buy anything there.” The musicians bravely venture across the States, carrying a bandmate and some beer in a coffin, and sporting hairdos resembling unicorn horns.
films.default_editorial: Eastern European dry humor meets American idiosyncrasies in Aki Kaurismäki’s delightfully absurd classic, released the same year the Berlin Wall fell. Speeding through the Deep South, this off-beat adventure—featuring a Jim Jarmusch cameo—marks the birth of the most unforgettable cover band on film.

films.title: In the Realm of the Senses
films.original_title: 愛のコリーダ | Ai no korīda
films.title_upcase: IN THE REALM OF THE SENSES

content_rating.label: adult
content_rating.description: Contains very strong sexual and/or violent content.

films.short_synopsis: Sade Abe is a former geisha working as a hotel maid in pre-World War II Japan. After she begins a torrid affair with the owner, they become completely infatuated. Their experimental sexual encounters spiral into an all-consuming and destructive love affair where even life is worth sacrificing.
films.short_synopsis_html: Sade Abe is a former geisha working as a hotel maid in pre-World War II Japan. After she begins a torrid affair with the owner, they become completely infatuated. Their experimental sexual encounters spiral into an all-consuming and destructive love affair where even life is worth sacrificing.
films.default_editorial: A no-holds-barred cult classic from director Nagisa Ôshima, this provocative chamber drama has lost none of its unsettling power. A vigorous attack on Japanese cultural values and patriarchal mores, In the Realm of the Senses steers its tragic tale of amour fou into a transgressive death spiral.
films.default_editorial_html: A no-holds-barred cult classic from director Nagisa Ôshima, this provocative chamber drama has lost none of its unsettling power. films.title: Special Flight

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: 9 months immersed in the administrative detention center of Geneva. Each year, thousands of men and women in Switzerland are imprisoned without trial or sentence. Simply because they stay in the country illegally, they may be deprived of liberty for up to 18 months before being deported.
films.short_synopsis_html: 9 months immersed in the administrative detention center of Geneva. Each year, thousands of men and women in Switzerland are imprisoned without trial or sentence. Simply because they stay in the country illegally, they may be deprived of liberty for up to 18 months before being deported.
films.default_editorial: An intimate and emotionally charged portrait of undocumented immigrants and asylum-seekers in affluent Switzerland. From documentarian Fernard Melgar (The Fortress), winner of the Filmmakers of the Present Golden Leopard at the Locarno Festival.
films.default_editorial_html: An intimate and emotionally charged portrait of undocumented immigrants and asylum-seekers in affluent Switzerland. From documentarian Fernard Melgar (The Fortress), winner of the Filmmakers of the Present Golden Leopard at the Locarno Festival.

films.title: Corpo celeste

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Thirteen-year-old Marta moves from Switzerland to a small Calabrian town along with her mother and sister. There, she is sent to the local church to prepare for her Catholic confirmation and hopefully make new friends. But the religion she finds there—and how it dominates people’s lives—is strange.
films.short_synopsis_html: Thirteen-year-old Marta moves from Switzerland to a small Calabrian town along with her mother and sister. There, she is sent to the local church to prepare for her Catholic confirmation and hopefully make new friends. But the religion she finds there—and how it dominates people’s lives—is strange.
films.default_editorial: Celestial blues are speckled with red and religious icons flicker and fall in Alice Rohrwacher’s first feature. With cinematography by Hélène Louvart, the filmmaker braids the discoveries of girlhood into towering questions of faith to create a coming-of-age tale that is at once lived-in and divine.

films.title: Letter from Siberia

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A traveler goes on a journey through the vast territory and isolated villages of Siberia, recording his observations on its people and places, wildlife and culture. Urbanization, reckless deforestation and the demise of the wooly mammoth all fall under his critical gaze.
films.short_synopsis_html: A traveler goes on a journey through the vast territory and isolated villages of Siberia, recording his observations on its people and places, wildlife and culture. Urbanization, reckless deforestation and the demise of the wooly mammoth all fall under his critical gaze.
films.default_editorial: Bolstered by a cheeky script and a spirited score from the French New Wave’s Georges Delerue, Chris Marker’s stunning travelogue charms with a sweet tenderness for the people and the landscape of Siberia. As in his other celebrated works, the presence of animals is at once unexpected and delightful.

films.title: Incoherence

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A teacher hides his pornographic magazine from a female student. A jogger steals milk and blames it on a newspaper delivery boy. A drunk man desperately searches for a public toilet late at night. Over three episodes, three respectable middle-aged men find themselves behaving badly.
films.short_synopsis_html: A teacher hides his pornographic magazine from a female student. A jogger steals milk and blames it on a newspaper delivery boy. A drunk man desperately searches for a public toilet late at night. Over three episodes, three respectable middle-aged men find themselves behaving badly.
films.default_editorial: Made with his signature blend of acidic satire and social critique, this witty graduation short from Parasite auteur Bong Joon Ho is a delightful prelude to an illustrious career. Contrasting public righteousness with private vice, Incoherence boldly strips Korean elites of their hypocritical masks.

films.title: Lights in the Dusk

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Outcast by his co-workers and living alone, Koistinen is a security guard who works the night shift in a luxury shopping mall in Helsinki. But when icy blonde Mirja approaches him, the lonely Koistinen falls helplessly for her, unaware she is manipulating him for her criminal boyfriend.
films.short_synopsis_html: Outcast by his co-workers and living alone, Koistinen is a security guard who works the night shift in a luxury shopping mall in Helsinki. But when icy blonde Mirja approaches him, the lonely Koistinen falls helplessly for her, unaware she is manipulating him for her criminal boyfriend.
films.default_editorial: Aki Kaurismäki concludes his so-called “Loser Trilogy” with a minimalist Bressonian fable. An existentially charged anatomisation of urban loneliness indebted to the work of Edward Hopper, this noirish morality tale seeks love and redemption along modern Helsinki’s thoroughfares of broken dreams.

films.title: Paradise: Love

content_rating.label: adult
content_rating.description: Contains very strong sexual and/or violent content.

films.short_synopsis: On the beaches of Kenya they’re known as “Sugar Mamas” —European women who seek out African boys selling love to earn a living. Teresa, a 50-year-old Austrian and mother of a daughter entering puberty, travels to this vacation paradise, moving from beach to beach…
films.short_synopsis_html: On the beaches of Kenya they’re known as “Sugar Mamas” —European women who seek out African boys selling love to earn a living. Teresa, a 50-year-old Austrian and mother of a daughter entering puberty, travels to this vacation paradise, moving from beach to beach…
films.default_editorial: The first in the Paradise thematic trilogy, Love starts the series of darkly comic tales about the human search for happiness, making bold connections between sex tourism and globalization through the lens of aging desire. The rounded lead character of contradictions is consistently fascinating.

films.title: The Time Masters

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Piel, the young son of a space traveler, is left behind on the planet Perdide, where huge and hungry hornets roam. Jaffar, Piel’s father’s friend, abandons an important mission to rescue the child, with the help of an old sailor and two dwarves who communicate by telepathy.
films.short_synopsis_html: Piel, the young son of a space traveler, is left behind on the planet Perdide, where huge and hungry hornets roam. Jaffar, Piel’s father’s friend, abandons an important mission to rescue the child, with the help of an old sailor and two dwarves who communicate by telepathy.
films.default_editorial: While less well-known than Fantastic Planet, René Laloux’s second Stefan Wul adaptation is just as mind-bending. Illustrated by none other than the legendary cartoonist Mœbius, this mesmerizing rescue mission in a savage galaxy juxtaposes childhood innocence with the thrills of adventure.

films.title: The Reluctant Revolutionary

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In Yemen, tour guide leader Kais offers reflections on loss, anger and hope during the build up to the Yemeni Revolution of 2011-12. Soon, Kais himself embarks on a journey from pro-president to reluctant revolutionary, joining angry protesters in the increasingly bloody streets of Sana’a.
films.short_synopsis_html: In Yemen, tour guide leader Kais offers reflections on loss, anger and hope during the build up to the Yemeni Revolution of 2011-12. Soon, Kais himself embarks on a journey from pro-president to reluctant revolutionary, joining angry protesters in the increasingly bloody streets of Sana’a.
films.default_editorial: Before the acutely moving A Syrian Love Story, Sean McAllister directed this surprising documentary, where he lucidly dissects the reality of Yemen amid the Arab Spring uprisings. An uncommon central character guides us through a simmering revolution.
films.default_editorial_html: Before the acutely moving A Syrian Love Story, Sean McAllister directed this surprising documentary, where he lucidly dissects the reality of Yemen amid the Arab Spring uprisings. An uncommon central character guides us through a simmering revolution.

films.title: Occupied

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In the West Bank, Palestine, young and disenfranchised artists discuss the choices they have made in pursuing their creative paths as a response to their surroundings. Amidst the persecution and marginalization they face, these artists celebrate life, love, and hope.
films.short_synopsis_html: In the West Bank, Palestine, young and disenfranchised artists discuss the choices they have made in pursuing their creative paths as a response to their surroundings. Amidst the persecution and marginalization they face, these artists celebrate life, love, and hope.
films.default_editorial: Who pays the price in a war? Filmed in Palestine between 2016 and 2017, Occupied explores that question through intimate interviews that capture the essence of home, freedom, and occupation. Through local artists’ eyes, it paints a picture of life that becomes a testament to human resilience.

films.title: Room 666

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In a small hotel room at the 1982 Cannes Film Festival, Wim Wenders initiates a survey among his colleagues about the future of cinema. Godard, Fassbinder, Spielberg, Antonioni, Herzog, and other filmmakers respond to Wenders’ question: “Is cinema a language about to get lost, an art about to die?”
films.short_synopsis_html: In a small hotel room at the 1982 Cannes Film Festival, Wim Wenders initiates a survey among his colleagues about the future of cinema. Godard, Fassbinder, Spielberg, Antonioni, Herzog, and other filmmakers respond to Wenders’ question: “Is cinema a language about to get lost, an art about to die?”
films.default_editorial: From Godard to Antonioni, Herzog to Spielberg, Wim Wenders gathers the great and good of world cinema to ponder an existential question. Enlightening and hilarious, Room 666 considers the aesthetics of television, and asks whether its polluting effects will sound a death knell for the seventh art.
films.default_editorial_html: From Godard to Antonioni, Herzog to Spielberg, Wim Wenders gathers the great and good of world cinema to ponder an existential question. films.title: L'avance

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Aliou, a burgeoning student at Les Beaux-Arts in Paris, sells a painting of his dead mother for 3000 euros to a famous collector. Upon delivering the painting, he is taken on a journey through which he will bear the burden of the money he has just earned.
films.short_synopsis_html: Aliou, a burgeoning student at Les Beaux-Arts in Paris, sells a painting of his dead mother for 3000 euros to a famous collector. Upon delivering the painting, he is taken on a journey through which he will bear the burden of the money he has just earned.
films.default_editorial: After collaborating with fashion icon Virgil Abloh, rising star Djiby Kebe muses on the transactional realm of art for his astute debut short. Smudged with wavering feelings of unease, L’avance adds color to the existential dilemmas of an African diasporic painter with vitality and novel style.

films.title: Seduce Me: Snake

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini reveals how monogamy is the goal of the male garter snake—he’s got to be the only one. Once he’s mated with his female lover, he hopes that no other males come along to undo his work.
films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini reveals how monogamy is the goal of the male garter snake—he’s got to be the only one. Once he’s mated with his female lover, he hopes that no other males come along to undo his work.
films.default_editorial: While serpent imagery might evoke forbidden temptations, male garter snakes worship at the altar of fidelity. Downright medieval in spirit, their possessive methods of staking sexual territories are wittily reimagined by Isabella Rossellini, complete with impish chuckles and knowing eye rolls.

films.title: Following

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Driven by boredom, a writer randomly shadows strangers on London’s bustling streets. What starts as fictional research becomes an unsettling journey when he’s confronted by a burglar named Cobb. Drawn into Cobb’s world of crime, the writer treads a perilous path, entangled in obsession and danger.
films.short_synopsis_html: Driven by boredom, a writer randomly shadows strangers on London’s bustling streets. What starts as fictional research becomes an unsettling journey when he’s confronted by a burglar named Cobb. Drawn into Cobb’s world of crime, the writer treads a perilous path, entangled in obsession and danger.
films.default_editorial: Before Christopher Nolan became a towering talent in the game of big-budget filmmaking with the likes of Inception and Oppenheimer, he made this ingenious small-scale thriller. As complexly structured and cerebrally tangled as his best work, this intimate neo-noir is as beguiling as the classics.

films.title: Seduce Me: Seahorse

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini explores the seduction habits of seahorses. Meet Dad, aka Mr. Mom. But, kids, don’t get too attached, particularly if Dad is a pipefish, a cousin of the seahorse.
films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini explores the seduction habits of seahorses. Meet Dad, aka Mr. Mom. But, kids, don’t get too attached, particularly if Dad is a pipefish, a cousin of the seahorse.
films.default_editorial: Seen as nature’s symbol of paternal nurture, male seahorses entice the opposite sex by flaunting their egg pouches. In contrast to this romantic underwater waltz, Isabella Rossellini introduces us to the temperamental pipefish, a cousin breed whose fatherly love can be quite perversely conditional.

films.title: Working Girls

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Photographer Molly works part-time in a Manhattan brothel. Over one day, she juggles a stream of clients while nurturing relationships with her coworkers and satisfying her ambitious madam. In a trade where the personal and the professional easily blur, Molly fights to maintain her sense of self.
films.short_synopsis_html: Photographer Molly works part-time in a Manhattan brothel. Over one day, she juggles a stream of clients while nurturing relationships with her coworkers and satisfying her ambitious madam. In a trade where the personal and the professional easily blur, Molly fights to maintain her sense of self.
films.default_editorial: Where dominant culture was salacious and judgmental, Lizzie Borden desensationalized sex work with a feminist film of wit and radical warmth. Immersed in the mundane details and rhythms of labor—bad bosses, long hours—Borden’s clear-cut images strike with vital realism in a lucid restoration.
films.default_editorial_html: Where dominant culture was salacious and judgmental, Lizzie Borden desensationalized sex work with a feminist film of wit and radical warmth. films.default_editorial: Made long before Gus Van Sant’s acclaimed biopic, but only 6 years after Milk’s murder, this documentary builds on TV footage and interviews to trace the life of the activist. films.short_synopsis: Two stories, two reciprocal trajectories. Olga, a nurse from Ukraine, abandons her family to look for a better life in the West. Paul, an unemployed security guard from Vienna, is looking for a reason to get up in the mornings and heads East with his stepfather.

films.default_editorial: Looking to the future of jazz while honoring the legends of the past, Moor Mother’s spellbinding music transcends time and genre—and so does Cyrus Moussavi’s companion piece. films.short_synopsis_html: Walking around a sea of giant and colorful animal penises, Isabella Rossellini reflects on the importance of the vagina. Rossellini explores why each penis needs to be a cozy fit for its targeted vagina.
films.default_editorial: The dry tone often used in documentaries about sexuality can feel alarming. By contrast, Isabella Rossellini’s explanation of what vaginas are for is matter-of-fact but playful, and her mischievous approach is strangely reassuring as she highlights the ingenuity of this female organ.

films.title: A Winter's Tale

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: One summer, the young Felicie and Charles fall deeply, passionately in love. Five years later, after accidentally giving him a false address, she is raising his child and drifting back and forth between two infatuated men with whom she’s unwilling, or unable, to settle down.
films.short_synopsis_html: One summer, the young Felicie and Charles fall deeply, passionately in love. Five years later, after accidentally giving him a false address, she is raising his child and drifting back and forth between two infatuated men with whom she’s unwilling, or unable, to settle down.
films.default_editorial: The second entry in Rohmer’s “Tales of the Four Seasons” is a graceful exploration of love and faith, a romantic comedy with engrossing characters that will stay with you long after the end credits.  Life’s choices proliferate—and Felicie’s quest for the right direction is completely entrancing.

films.title: Spectre: Sanity, Madness & The Family

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Jean, the youngest of a large family, grew up in a community influenced by Chris, a spiritual guide. After receiving a tape from his sister, he rediscovers voices and sounds from his past. As the memories begin to emerge, he decides to follow in Chris’ footsteps, only to discover his family secret.
films.short_synopsis_html: Jean, the youngest of a large family, grew up in a community influenced by Chris, a spiritual guide. After receiving a tape from his sister, he rediscovers voices and sounds from his past. As the memories begin to emerge, he decides to follow in Chris’ footsteps, only to discover his family secret.
films.default_editorial: Excavating an unusual family archive laden with secrets, this mesmerizing first feature from French composer Jean-Baptiste de Laubier, aka Para One, is a sonic journey through the ghosts of childhood. Echoing his collaborations with Céline Sciamma, the enigmatic score unlocks a portal to the past.

films.title: Atlantics

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: Dakar, 2009. At night, three friends gather around a fire. Recently repatriated from Spain, Serigne tells Cheikh and Alpha about his journey. He has only one plan in mind: to jump on a boat and go to sea again. His friends try to convince him to stay but Serigne, as if bewitched, seems already gone.
films.short_synopsis_html: Dakar, 2009. At night, three friends gather around a fire. Recently repatriated from Spain, Serigne tells Cheikh and Alpha about his journey. He has only one plan in mind: to jump on a boat and go to sea again. His friends try to convince him to stay but Serigne, as if bewitched, seems already gone.
films.default_editorial: Fifteen years before she won the Golden Bear for Dahomey, Mati Diop began her career with an atmospheric tale of treacherous voyages and lives risked to the ocean. Flickering with the mercurial hopes of Senegalese youth, Atlantics later inspired her ghostly, acclaimed feature of the same name.

films.title: Diary of an African Nun

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A nun in Uganda is consumed by fear and doubt about her decision to take the solemn vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience. Her anguish intensifies night after night as she lies on a hard bed in her small room at the convent and listens to the rhythmic, beckoning drums of her village.
films.short_synopsis_html: A nun in Uganda is consumed by fear and doubt about her decision to take the solemn vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience. Her anguish intensifies night after night as she lies on a hard bed in her small room at the convent and listens to the rhythmic, beckoning drums of her village.
films.default_editorial: Temptation knocks at commitment’s door with sounds of men, fire, and dancing in this heady early work from Julie Dash. Dynamic use of montage contrasts an ascetic life with the seductive pleasures of our persistent flesh, as the titular sister narrates her dilemma in mesmerizing, poetic voice-over.

films.title: Call Me Marianna

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Marianna is an attractive 40-year-old woman who has just sued her parents in order to obtain a sex change. Alienated from her mother and neglecting her best friends, she seeks refuge in a theatre group where she tries to make sense of her situation by rehearsing a play based on her past.
films.short_synopsis_html: Marianna is an attractive 40-year-old woman who has just sued her parents in order to obtain a sex change. Alienated from her mother and neglecting her best friends, she seeks refuge in a theatre group where she tries to make sense of her situation by rehearsing a play based on her past.
films.default_editorial: Split between profile format and an artistic expression of internal pain, this tender, award-winning documentary empathetically explores the difficulties transgender people face. While rooted in the Polish culture of star Marianna’s upbringing, the film is a universal lesson in courage and dignity.

films.title: The Snails

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A gardener tries his best to make his salad plants grow. It is only when he cries that his tears finally water the field and the salads grow huge. The incredible size attracts a multitude of snails that quickly become giant too, causing disasters and panic in the nearby city.
films.short_synopsis_html: A gardener tries his best to make his salad plants grow. It is only when he cries that his tears finally water the field and the salads grow huge. The incredible size attracts a multitude of snails that quickly become giant too, causing disasters and panic in the nearby city.
films.default_editorial: Before the legendary French animator René Laloux went to outer space with his psychedelic fantasia Fantastic Planet, he kept his feet firmly rooted in the soil in this charming—and award-winning!—short about snails. Exactly what will it take to make the poor farmer’s plants flourish?

films.title: Take Care of Your Scarf, Tatiana

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Sometime in the mid-sixties, Southern Finland. Two misfits, Valto and Reino, hit the road in a black Volga. Along the way, they pick up two women, one Estonian and the other Russian. In spite of language barriers and the men’s incapability to approach the opposite sex, romance begins to brew.
films.short_synopsis_html: Sometime in the mid-sixties, Southern Finland. Two misfits, Valto and Reino, hit the road in a black Volga. Along the way, they pick up two women, one Estonian and the other Russian. In spite of language barriers and the men’s incapability to approach the opposite sex, romance begins to brew.
films.default_editorial: A joyous 65-minute confection from Finnish auteur Aki Kauismäki, this period road movie is a delightfully absurdist, transnational comedy of miscommunication. Shot in shimmering monochrome, Take Care of Your Scarf, Tatiana takes a droll plunge into the headspace of the a 1960s Finnish everyman.

films.title: Mammas: Dunnock

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Dunnocks practice polyandry, where one female has multiple partners. Isabella Rossellini uncovers how the mamma dunnock manages her roster of fathers.
films.short_synopsis_html: Dunnocks practice polyandry, where one female has multiple partners. Isabella Rossellini uncovers how the mamma dunnock manages her roster of fathers.
films.default_editorial: Humanity has its history of harems; these perching birds, however, let females rule sexual roosts. Flirting with several puppet pappas, Isabella Rossellini flecks maternal resolve with winking humor before discoursing on the limits of monogamy in an artist’s impression of a Parisian park.

films.title: Crime and Punishment

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Rahikainen, a slaughterhouse worker and former law student in Helsinki, finds the drunk driver who killed his fiancée and coldly shoots him dead. He is seen by a young woman named Eeva, who says nothing to the police. Instead, she becomes involved in a love affair that cannot possibly have a future.
films.short_synopsis_html: Rahikainen, a slaughterhouse worker and former law student in Helsinki, finds the drunk driver who killed his fiancée and coldly shoots him dead. He is seen by a young woman named Eeva, who says nothing to the police. Instead, she becomes involved in a love affair that cannot possibly have a future.
films.default_editorial: Transplanting Dostoyevsky’s novel to 1980s Finland, this fiction debut from Aki Kaurismäki plays fast and loose with its source material. Eschewing bleakness for humanism—with plenty of deadpan, absurdist touches—it’s a fascinating work in the development of the great director’s signature style.

films.title: Horse Money

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Ventura, an elderly Cape Verdean immigrant living in Lisbon, is seemingly the inmate of a cavernous, antiquated psychiatric ward. As he traverses a seemingly endless night, an odyssey into his real, imagined and nightmarish memories begins.
films.short_synopsis_html: Ventura, an elderly Cape Verdean immigrant living in Lisbon, is seemingly the inmate of a cavernous, antiquated psychiatric ward. As he traverses a seemingly endless night, an odyssey into his real, imagined and nightmarish memories begins.
films.default_editorial: From Portugal’s greatest living filmmaker comes this dreamlike hallucination of a lost soul belonging to the country’s repressed, abused, misused and forgotten underclass. With his rivetingly poetic political cinema, Pedro Costa gives the unheard and unseen a voice and a true cinematic presence.

films.title: Light Sleeper

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: John LeTour is a recovering drug user who suffers insomnia and still deals to a high-end New York clientele, even though he’s trying to get out of the business. John’s professional midlife crisis becomes something more acute—and dangerous—when he re-encounters an old flame.
films.short_synopsis_html: John LeTour is a recovering drug user who suffers insomnia and still deals to a high-end New York clientele, even though he’s trying to get out of the business. John’s professional midlife crisis becomes something more acute—and dangerous—when he re-encounters an old flame.
films.default_editorial: Like Taxi Driver and American Gigolo before it, Paul Schrader’s Light Sleeper is a vivid portrait of how loneliness entwines with crime. This study of spiritual and existential angst, mired in the sleazy New York underworld of drug dealing, stars the brilliant Willem Dafoe and Susan Sarandon.

films.title: Touchez pas au grisbi

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Max and Riton are two ageing gangsters who manage to pull off their final heist, a spectacular robbery at Orly airport. All is well until Max’s former girlfriend Josy tips off a rival gangster, Angelo. The latter kidnaps Ritton and threatens him unless Max hands over the spoils from his robbery.
films.short_synopsis_html: Max and Riton are two ageing gangsters who manage to pull off their final heist, a spectacular robbery at Orly airport. All is well until Max’s former girlfriend Josy tips off a rival gangster, Angelo. The latter kidnaps Ritton and threatens him unless Max hands over the spoils from his robbery.
films.default_editorial: Legendary actor Jean Gabin, starring opposite a young Jeanne Moreau, revitalized his career with this iconic gangster film from Jacques Becker. A distinctly French ode to Hollywood noir, Touchez pas au grisbi is an atmospheric classic, and a major influence on Scorsese’s The Irishman.
