films.title: Socialist Realism

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: On one side, we have Lucho and the working class; on the other, intellectuals backing the Popular Unity movement alongside the petite bourgeoisie. Their unlikely friendship escalates into scenes of action, gunfire, and discordant songs, offering a satirical portrayal of the era.
films.short_synopsis_html: On one side, we have Lucho and the working class; on the other, intellectuals backing the Popular Unity movement alongside the petite bourgeoisie. Their unlikely friendship escalates into scenes of action, gunfire, and discordant songs, offering a satirical portrayal of the era.
films.default_editorial: Previously disrupted by the 1973 Chilean coup d’état, Raúl Ruiz’s lost project was completed by Valeria Sarmiento and released on the 50th anniversary of this harrowing event. Probing the limits of revolutionary thoughts, this sardonic, hybrid film bears witness to the embers of left-wing idealism.

films.title: Charles, Dead or Alive

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: On the 100th anniversary of the founding of a watchmaking company in Geneva, its owner Charles Dé gives his family the slip and moves in with a young couple he meets by chance, doing the cooking, reading, drinking, and engaging in philosophical discussions with them.
films.short_synopsis_html: On the 100th anniversary of the founding of a watchmaking company in Geneva, its owner Charles Dé gives his family the slip and moves in with a young couple he meets by chance, doing the cooking, reading, drinking, and engaging in philosophical discussions with them.
films.default_editorial: For his 1969 feature debut, director Alain Tanner (In the White City) transplants the revolutionary spark and spirit of May ‘68 to his native Switzerland, intelligently examining a man’s attempt to trade his comfortable bourgeois life for the counterculture. films.title: Living Still Life

content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In a world in decay, Fièvre, an enigmatic woman, collects dead animals. She brings them to life by filming them and creating animated films. However, one day, a man comes to see Fièvre. He has a request for her regarding his dead wife…
films.short_synopsis_html: In a world in decay, Fièvre, an enigmatic woman, collects dead animals. She brings them to life by filming them and creating animated films. However, one day, a man comes to see Fièvre. He has a request for her regarding his dead wife…
films.default_editorial: Another of Mandico’s chimerical cinematic offerings, Living Still Life echoes the strange rhythms and internal logic of dreams. Stop-motion animation and up-close, visceral shots of animals bring to life a world in decay, as we chase down the rabbit hole a woman driven by strange pursuits.

films.default_editorial: Filmed on the fabled Greek island of Hydra, Paweł Pawlikowski’s playful, virtuosic short is a modern myth that dazzles in dynamic black and white. Adding flashes of high fashion to shades of early cinema, model and actor Małgosia Bela strikes the poses of a fearless muse with chameleonic style.

films.short_synopsis: Left on an orphanage’s doorstep as a baby, young Yuki leads a happy, free-spirited life in the beautiful countryside of Hokkaido. But, one day, she gets adopted, and everything changes.
films.short_synopsis_html: Left on an orphanage’s doorstep as a baby, young Yuki leads a happy, free-spirited life in the beautiful countryside of Hokkaido. But, one day, she gets adopted, and everything changes.

films.title: A Swedish Love Story

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Two teenagers meet and cautiously fall in love in beautiful surroundings during the peak of an idyllic Swedish summer. Oblivious to social boundaries, they innocently create their own inner world, expecting little from the dysfunctional and world-weary adults around them.
films.short_synopsis_html: Two teenagers meet and cautiously fall in love in beautiful surroundings during the peak of an idyllic Swedish summer. Oblivious to social boundaries, they innocently create their own inner world, expecting little from the dysfunctional and world-weary adults around them.
films.default_editorial: Thirty years before Songs from the Second Floor, Roy Andersson made his feature debut with this glorious love story. Looser than his later masterworks—but every bit as funny!—its keen eye for balancing the existential and the absurd means there’s little mistaking this for the work of anyone else.

films.title: Further Beyond

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Taking the compelling 18th Century figure Ambrose O’Higgins as their point of departure, two filmmakers attempt to retrace his remarkable journey from Ireland to Chile and speculate on the idea of place. But the duo continually get sidetracked by a competing story of immigration and displacement.

films.default_editorial: A riveting, completely original anti-biopic from one of our favorite filmmaker duos, whose revisionist crime film, Helen is an ingenious gem. Molloy & Lawlor’s first foray into documentary explores identity and space while playfully dissecting the very nature of cinematic language. And it’s funny!

films.short_synopsis: A Chinese kung fu master must salvage his honor after accidentally insulting the family of his new Japanese bride. With his loyalty—and marriage—on the line, the dishonored martial artist can only attempt to regain his in-laws’ trust by dueling with seven skillful Japanese ninjas.
films.short_synopsis_html: A Chinese kung fu master must salvage his honor after accidentally insulting the family of his new Japanese bride. Talked into a marriage of convenience, Gordon Liu meets his match in Yuka Mizuno’s feisty bride, while Lau Kar-leung shows why he’s the king of action staging, with some of the most dynamic battles on his CV.

films.short_synopsis: In a haunting, dream-like world, a young girl navigates a labyrinth of physical and emotional challenges within the decaying walls of an abandoned house. There, she must choose between succumbing to her fears or transforming into a formidable force.
films.short_synopsis_html: In a haunting, dream-like world, a young girl navigates a labyrinth of physical and emotional challenges within the decaying walls of an abandoned house. There, she must choose between succumbing to her fears or transforming into a formidable force.
films.default_editorial: Artist, designer, and filmmaker Susanne Deeken draws on our intimate associations with the home for this surreal trip into a haunted soul. Evocative of both children’s drawings and horror films, A Place Without Fear uses analog and digital techniques to conjure a nightmarish vision all its own.

films.title: Querelle

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In the port of Brest, handsome Belgian sailor Querelle turns on his drug-smuggling accomplice and murders him. He then goes to a notorious brothel run by the eccentric Lysiane, who will lead him on a voyage of highly charged, violent homosexual self-discovery that will change him forever.
films.short_synopsis_html: In the port of Brest, handsome Belgian sailor Querelle turns on his drug-smuggling accomplice and murders him. He then goes to a notorious brothel run by the eccentric Lysiane, who will lead him on a voyage of highly charged, violent homosexual self-discovery that will change him forever.
films.default_editorial: Querelle is Fassbinder’s last film, an English-language interpretation of Jean Genet, starring Jeanne Moreau in an otherwise male-only cast. Evoking the world of cruising, its homoerotic sexual tension and striking aesthetics make it an astonishing work and a cult classic in the LGBTQ+ pantheon.

films.title: Jakub

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: After WWII, the people from Ruthenia’s Carpathian villages were promised a better life in Bohemia. But in their new homes, they felt like strangers—so telling stories quickly became very important to the homesick people. One of these beloved tales is about Jakub, a man who knew the bible by heart.
films.short_synopsis_html: After WWII, the people from Ruthenia’s Carpathian villages were promised a better life in Bohemia. But in their new homes, they felt like strangers—so telling stories quickly became very important to the homesick people. One of these beloved tales is about Jakub, a man who knew the bible by heart.
films.default_editorial: Piecing together the life of a seemingly ordinary villager, Jana Ševčíková’s stirring portrait uncovers the generational struggles faced by the Ruthenians, a displaced minority group. Bearing witness to regime changes and shifting national ideologies, Jakub questions the very idea of the homeland.

films.title: 2 or 3 Things I Know About Her

films.title_upcase: 2 OR 3 THINGS I KNOW ABOUT HER

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Juliette Janson, a housewife from the Paris suburbs, lives in a high-rise apartment with her husband and two children. As consumer culture in Paris booms, Juliette decides to start a part-time job as a sex worker to afford some of life’s little luxuries and escape suburbia.
films.short_synopsis_html: Juliette Janson, a housewife from the Paris suburbs, lives in a high-rise apartment with her husband and two children. As consumer culture in Paris booms, Juliette decides to start a part-time job as a sex worker to afford some of life’s little luxuries and escape suburbia.
films.default_editorial: The “her” is Paris, but it’s also everything: Only Godard could conjure the cosmos in a cup of coffee—which he does in this brilliant, candy-colored provocation. A landmark transition from the maestro’s jazzy genre deconstructions of the 60s to his gorgeous and inquisitive essay films of the future.

films.title: Green Vinyl

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A mother and her daughter live in an apartment in Recife. The mother gives her daughter a box of old colored records with children’s music. She can listen to anything apart from the green vinyl. If she does, it will have tragic consequences.
films.short_synopsis_html: A mother and her daughter live in an apartment in Recife. The mother gives her daughter a box of old colored records with children’s music. She can listen to anything apart from the green vinyl. If she does, it will have tragic consequences.
films.default_editorial: Innocent sounds of birdsong signal a fresh chance for rule-breaking in this early, playfully spooky Kleber Mendonça Filho short. Spinning a fairytale of risky curiosity into a photo-roman of mischievous girlhood, the Brazilian filmmaker delights in tearing the dreariness of obedience limb from limb.

films.title: Spring Night, Summer Night

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: The melancholy story of a half brother and sister in rural southern Ohio whose relationship suddenly turns intimate, sending the already-struggling farm family into a crisis of love, shame and recrimination. Cast entirely with regional actors and filmed on location in shimmering 35mm B&W.
films.short_synopsis_html: The melancholy story of a half brother and sister in rural southern Ohio whose relationship suddenly turns intimate, sending the already-struggling farm family into a crisis of love, shame and recrimination. Cast entirely with regional actors and filmed on location in shimmering 35mm B&W.
films.default_editorial: This remarkably forgotten American independent, set in a declining rural town in Ohio, explores the struggles of its past through the mirror of a complicated relationship. Working with nonprofessional actors, Joseph L. Anderson’s late-60s drama tells a melancholic story of revenge and liberation.
films.default_editorial_html: This remarkably forgotten American independent, set in a declining rural town in Ohio, explores the struggles of its past through the mirror of a complicated relationship. Working with nonprofessional actors, Joseph L. Anderson’s late-60s drama tells a melancholic story of revenge and liberation.

films.title: Green Porno: Limpet

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini gets intimate with the strange mating rituals of limpets. A sexless young limpet affixes itself to a rock—only when other limpets join it will its sex be determined.
films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini gets intimate with the strange mating rituals of limpets. A sexless young limpet affixes itself to a rock—only when other limpets join it will its sex be determined.
films.default_editorial: Spending your life stuck to a rock could seem like a tragic fate—were it not for all the sex. Rossellini’s portrayal of the titular snail and its astounding reproductive process is hilarious. But she is also totally sincere when describing the phenomenon, never denying its unsettling oddity.

films.title: The Red Sea Makes Me Wanna Cry
films.original_title: The Red Sea Makes Me Wanna Cry
films.title_upcase: THE RED SEA MAKES ME WANNA CRY

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A haunted woman named Ida journeys from Germany to Jordan, to an eerie and deserted port town on the Red Sea where her partner, Ismail, recently died. Wandering through desolate bars, hotels, and offices, Ida attempts to feel Ismail’s presence one last time and to say goodbye.
films.short_synopsis_html: A haunted woman named Ida journeys from Germany to Jordan, to an eerie and deserted port town on the Red Sea where her partner, Ismail, recently died. Wandering through desolate bars, hotels, and offices, Ida attempts to feel Ismail’s presence one last time and to say goodbye.
films.default_editorial: One of the first Jordanian films to premiere at Cannes, Faris Alrjoob’s beguiling short languidly drifts on the shifting tides of love and loss. At once eerie and sensuously pleasurable, sun-drenched frames are imprinted with the specter of grief, made achingly tangible on sumptuous 16mm film stock.

At once eerie and sensuously pleasurable, sun-drenched frames are imprinted with the specter of grief, made achingly tangible on sumptuous 16mm film stock.

films.title: The Potemkinists

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In 1905, the rebellious sailors on the battleship Potemkin are given political asylum in Romania—an act of defiance against Russia. In 2021, as a sculptor plans an artwork inspired by the event, he unveils the truth behind the fictional elements of Sergei Eisenstein’s Battleship Potemkin.
films.short_synopsis_html: In 1905, the rebellious sailors on the battleship Potemkin are given political asylum in Romania—an act of defiance against Russia. In 2021, as a sculptor plans an artwork inspired by the event, he unveils the truth behind the fictional elements of Sergei Eisenstein’s Battleship Potemkin.
films.default_editorial: As sharp as a knife’s blade, Radu Jude’s short visually quotes Sergei Eisenstein’s Soviet classic Battleship Potemkin to dissect the paradoxes of the present. Holding no punches, darkly comic musings on cinema and memory expose the sheer absurdity of artmaking under bureaucratic authorities.

Holding no punches, darkly comic musings on cinema and memory expose the sheer absurdity of artmaking under bureaucratic authorities.

films.title: O-Bi, O-Ba: The End of Civilization
films.title_upcase: O-BI, O-BA: THE END OF CIVILIZATION

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A year has passed since the nuclear war, and 800 sick and hungry people have taken shelter in a concrete building. They are waiting for the landing of The Ark, a mythical vessel that is supposed to bring collective salvation. But this news was invented by the ruling team…
films.short_synopsis_html: A year has passed since the nuclear war, and 800 sick and hungry people have taken shelter in a concrete building. They are waiting for the landing of The Ark, a mythical vessel that is supposed to bring collective salvation. But this news was invented by the ruling team…
films.default_editorial: Conjuring a claustrophobic vision of post-nuclear Poland, Piotr Szulkin lends his satirical eye to the weaponization of religion as a means of social control. A utilitarian triumph of ramshackle world-building, O-Bi, O-Ba is a hallucinatory examination of apocalyptic anxieties in the atomic age.

A utilitarian triumph of ramshackle world-building, O-Bi, O-Ba is a hallucinatory examination of apocalyptic anxieties in the atomic age.

films.title: Pepe

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A voice that claims to be the ghost of Pepe, the first and only hippopotamus ever killed in the Americas, tells his story. Beginning in Southern Africa and moving to South America, Pepe narrates his eventful life—from being owned by Colombian drug baron Pablo Escobar to his final days roaming free.
films.short_synopsis_html: A voice that claims to be the ghost of Pepe, the first and only hippopotamus ever killed in the Americas, tells his story. Beginning in Southern Africa and moving to South America, Pepe narrates his eventful life—from being owned by Colombian drug baron Pablo Escobar to his final days roaming free.
films.default_editorial: Taking inspiration from an infamous runaway hippo, this shapeshifting adventure won Silver Bear for Best Director at the Berlinale. Traveling through timelines, planes of consciousness, and dazzlingly diverse forms of experimentation, Pepe summons specters of violence with eclectic, mystical style.

Traveling through timelines, planes of consciousness, and dazzlingly diverse forms of experimentation, Pepe summons specters of violence with eclectic, mystical style.

films.title: Empire of Passion
films.original_title: Ai no borei | 愛の亡霊

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In feudal Japan, a young soldier begins an intense affair with an older married woman. Driven by passion, obsession, and jealousy, they decide to murder her husband. But when the husband returns from the dead, the couple is pushed deep into the dark realms of insanity.
films.short_synopsis_html: In feudal Japan, a young soldier begins an intense affair with an older married woman. Driven by passion, obsession, and jealousy, they decide to murder her husband. But when the husband returns from the dead, the couple is pushed deep into the dark realms of insanity.
films.default_editorial: Nagisa Ôshima’s turn-of-the-century drama explores the slow and creeping breakdown of a relationship. Inverting the gender dynamics of his earlier film In the Realm of the Senses, this lusciously dark, erotic tale of a tainted love affair precisely dissects the torrid nature of a “crime of passion.”

films.title: Lost and Beautiful

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Pulcinella, a foolish servant, is sent to present-day Campania to grant the last wish of shepherd Tommaso: he must rescue a young buffalo called Sarchiapone. In the Royal Palace of Carditello,  the ruins of which were once looked after by Tommaso, Pulcinella finds the buffalo and leads him North.
films.short_synopsis_html: Pulcinella, a foolish servant, is sent to present-day Campania to grant the last wish of shepherd Tommaso: he must rescue a young buffalo called Sarchiapone. In the Royal Palace of Carditello, the ruins of which were once looked after by Tommaso, Pulcinella finds the buffalo and leads him North.
films.default_editorial: This beguiling shape-shifter of a film began as a portrait of the groundskeeper of an Italian palace until the subject’s untimely death transformed the project into something more fable-like and phantasmagoric. Martin Eden’s Pietro Marcello embarks on an enigmatic journey through a bucolic Italy.

films.title: The Class

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: François and his fellow teachers prepare for a new year at a high school in a tough neighborhood of Paris. Neither stuffy nor severe, François’ frankness often takes the students by surprise. But his classroom ethics are put to the test when his students begin to challenge his methods.
films.short_synopsis_html: François and his fellow teachers prepare for a new year at a high school in a tough neighborhood of Paris. Neither stuffy nor severe, François’ frankness often takes the students by surprise. But his classroom ethics are put to the test when his students begin to challenge his methods.
films.default_editorial: The surprise winner of the Palme d’Or at Cannes, this riveting schoolroom drama is based on the book by educator-turned-writer François Bégaudeau, who also stars. A revealing and engrossing exposé of the triumphs and challenges of teacher-student relationships in a disadvantaged Parisian school.
films.default_editorial_html: The surprise winner of the Palme d’Or at Cannes, this riveting schoolroom drama is based on the book by educator-turned-writer François Bégaudeau, who also stars. A revealing and engrossing exposé of the triumphs and challenges of teacher-student relationships in a disadvantaged Parisian school.

films.title: Blank Narcissus (Passion of the Swamp)

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: An ageing porn director makes a commentary in 2022 for the DVD of an underground 16mm film he made in 1972 that has recently been rediscovered. As the beautiful stud in the film undergoes a series of erotic reveries, the director laments his doomed love affair with his protagonist.
films.short_synopsis_html: An ageing porn director makes a commentary in 2022 for the DVD of an underground 16mm film he made in 1972 that has recently been rediscovered. As the beautiful stud in the film undergoes a series of erotic reveries, the director laments his doomed love affair with his protagonist.
films.default_editorial: Evoking the fantastical eroticism and unapologetic camp of James Bidgood’s queer classic Pink Narcissus, British auteur Peter Strickland packs kitsch erotics with intense emotion into this saucy, shimmering short. A potent merger of desire and memory that is most definitely NSFW!

films.title: Actual People

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: There’s one week left before college ends, and Riley has a professor failing her, a roommate who wants her out, and a UTI. But after meeting Leo, a fellow Asian-American from her hometown who’s a great listener, Riley drops everything and heads back to Philadelphia to pursue this perfect man.
films.short_synopsis_html: There’s one week left before college ends, and Riley has a professor failing her, a roommate who wants her out, and a UTI. But after meeting Leo, a fellow Asian-American from her hometown who’s a great listener, Riley drops everything and heads back to Philadelphia to pursue this perfect man.
films.default_editorial: Scrappy low-budget filmmaking has a new kid on the block in actor, director, and writer Kit Zauhar. Zeroing in on an Asian-American student’s premature case of postgraduate drift, she brings an altogether different charm to independent cinema with her wry, plucky, and perceptive first film.

films.title: Good Thanks, You?

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In the aftermath of an attack, Amy is left voiceless and must deal with shock, the incompetence of those supposed to help her, and herself. As she is thrown further into trauma by the authorities, she must find a way to confront what has happened and save what matters most to her.
films.short_synopsis_html: In the aftermath of an attack, Amy is left voiceless and must deal with shock, the incompetence of those supposed to help her, and herself. As she is thrown further into trauma by the authorities, she must find a way to confront what has happened and save what matters most to her.
films.default_editorial: Before her breakout feature How to Have Sex, Molly Manning Walker explored the struggle to express painful truths in a culture of dismissive silence. As enlightening as it is immersive, this powerful short confirms that the British filmmaker is one of the nation’s most exciting new talents.

films.title: An Autumn Tale

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Magali is a widowed wine grower whose best friend, Isabelle, is concerned that she is lonely now that her daughter has grown up. Isabelle secretly decides that she must find her a new husband, and puts an advert in a lonely hearts column. When she looks for a suitable candidate, she finds Gerald.
films.short_synopsis_html: Magali is a widowed wine grower whose best friend, Isabelle, is concerned that she is lonely now that her daughter has grown up. Isabelle secretly decides that she must find her a new husband, and puts an advert in a lonely hearts column. When she looks for a suitable candidate, she finds Gerald.
films.default_editorial: Rohmer’s last comedy of manners in his “Tales of Four Seasons” cycle was a big commercial success and won the Best Screenplay award in Venice. In the bucolic vineyards of Southern France, the search for love of Magali, played by Marie Rivière, gives way to a multitude of romantic entanglements.

films.title: Broadway by Light

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: Broadway, New York City, 1950s. The flashing bulbs and neons of Times Square adverts and the silhouettes of men at work on theatre marquees re-arranging letters on the lightboxes—poised like acrobats on their stepladders—create a kaleidoscopic light show.
films.short_synopsis_html: Broadway, New York City, 1950s. The flashing bulbs and neons of Times Square adverts and the silhouettes of men at work on theatre marquees re-arranging letters on the lightboxes—poised like acrobats on their stepladders—create a kaleidoscopic light show.
films.default_editorial: Renowned filmmaker-photographer William Klein died in 2022, leaving behind a career built out of eclectic, visually extraordinary subjects. His first film, Broadway by Light, is an avant-garde short intoxicated by the colorful, abstract and pop potential of Manhattan’s neon light shows.

films.title: Occupied City

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Past and present collide in a modern-day Amsterdam haunted by its history. As a narrator details significant events that took place in the Dutch capital during the Nazi occupation from 1940 to 1945, contemporary footage shot between 2020 and 2022 captures the exact locations where they occurred.
films.short_synopsis_html: Past and present collide in a modern-day Amsterdam haunted by its history. As a narrator details significant events that took place in the Dutch capital during the Nazi occupation from 1940 to 1945, contemporary footage shot between 2020 and 2022 captures the exact locations where they occurred.
films.default_editorial: Adapting Bianca Stigter’s monumental book of biographies and testimonies, Steve McQueen’s bold epic redefines how stories of the Second World War are told onscreen. An engrossing rumination on how ghosts of the past linger in a modern city, this poetic documentary is both shattering and inspiring.
films.default_editorial_html: Adapting Bianca Stigter’s monumental book of biographies and testimonies, Steve McQueen’s bold epic redefines how stories of the Second World War are told onscreen. films.title: Plastic Semiotic

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: The average life of human beings—from birth to old age—is represented by children’s toys. Barbie dolls, plastic dinosaurs, and model cars are assembled to recreate life’s inevitabilities, including holidays, traffic jams, and death.
films.short_synopsis_html: The average life of human beings—from birth to old age—is represented by children’s toys. Barbie dolls, plastic dinosaurs, and model cars are assembled to recreate life’s inevitabilities, including holidays, traffic jams, and death.
films.default_editorial: If you ever wondered what a Radu Jude-directed Barbie would look like, here’s a taste. Staging colorful toys in comic and grotesque positions, this stop-motion short lampoons the sad cycle of human life, filled with sex, consumerism, and war. In such an existence, death seems to be a sweet release.

films.title: King Boxer
films.original_title: 天下第一拳 | Tian xia di yi quan

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Hoping to win the top prize in a boxing tournament, Chao Chih-hao joins a fighting school. But when his fingers are viciously shattered by a rival gang, Chao must train his way back to peak form and learn the all-powerful Iron Palm technique. Only then can he wreak vengeance on his enemies.
films.short_synopsis_html: Hoping to win the top prize in a boxing tournament, Chao Chih-hao joins a fighting school. But when his fingers are viciously shattered by a rival gang, Chao must train his way back to peak form and learn the all-powerful Iron Palm technique. films.default_editorial: A pivotal classic that marked the rise of the 1970s kung fu craze, Jeong Chang-hwa’s international crossover hit ruled box-office charts upon its release in America. Starring martial arts legend Lo Lieh, this audacious tale of red-hot vengeance punctuates gravity-defying battles with startling gore.

films.title: Mammas: Toad

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Dressed as a toad, the Pipa pipa, Isabella Rossellini is seduced by a male toad. Now a toad mamma, she won’t carry one big baby in her belly, but many babies on her back.
films.short_synopsis_html: Dressed as a toad, the Pipa pipa, Isabella Rossellini is seduced by a male toad. Now a toad mamma, she won’t carry one big baby in her belly, but many babies on her back.
films.default_editorial: Save for red lipstick, Isabella Rossellini besmirches her glamor to become toadlike in this mud-colored installment. Pregnant with playful physical humor, the performance of froggy fornication between two sumo-suited actors heaves its suggestive, unforgettable way to creamy goo and comic ecstasy.

films.title: Attenberg

content_rating.label: adult
content_rating.description: Contains very strong sexual and/or violent content.

films.short_synopsis: Marina, an emotionally stunted 23-year-old, lives with her dying architect father in a seaside factory town. Finding humans strange and repellent, she keeps her distance, watching David Attenborough nature documentaries instead. Then a stranger arrives and challenges her to a foosball duel.
films.short_synopsis_html: Marina, an emotionally stunted 23-year-old, lives with her dying architect father in a seaside factory town. Finding humans strange and repellent, she keeps her distance, watching David Attenborough nature documentaries instead. Then a stranger arrives and challenges her to a foosball duel.
films.default_editorial: Athina Rachel Tsangari fulfils the promise of the Greek New Wave with this unclassifiably weird and provocative sophomore feature. A deadpan, off-kilter look at familial dysfunction, estrangement, and sexual inexperience, Attenberg doubles up as state-of-the nation commentary on modern Greece.
films.default_editorial_html: Athina Rachel Tsangari fulfils the promise of the Greek New Wave with this unclassifiably weird and provocative sophomore feature. A deadpan, off-kilter look at familial dysfunction, estrangement, and sexual inexperience, Attenberg doubles up as state-of-the nation commentary on modern Greece.

films.title: Matt and Mara

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In Toronto, creative writing professor Mara bumps into Matt, a free-spirited author from her past. Bonded by their shared interests, the two grow closer as Mara juggles marriage, motherhood and work. But when Matt joins her on a road trip, pressure slowly mounts against their undefined relationship.
films.short_synopsis_html: In Toronto, creative writing professor Mara bumps into Matt, a free-spirited author from her past. Bonded by their shared interests, the two grow closer as Mara juggles marriage, motherhood and work. But when Matt joins her on a road trip, pressure slowly mounts against their undefined relationship.
films.default_editorial: Risking ellipses and question marks, Canadian director Kazik Radwanski traces the ambiguous forms that romance can take with Matt and Mara. Through the surprises and genuine laughs of improvisation, the talented leads articulate a rare, real attraction for which there are, ordinarily, only clichés.

films.title: Dammi

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A man returns to his native Paris in search of a connection with his estranged father. This personal journey through memories of his past and surreal fragments of the present opens new pathways to explore his identity and recover his roots.
films.short_synopsis_html: A man returns to his native Paris in search of a connection with his estranged father. This personal journey through memories of his past and surreal fragments of the present opens new pathways to explore his identity and recover his roots.
films.default_editorial: This deeply personal short from Yann Mounir Demange is incandescent with love and vulnerability. Beautifully led by Riz Ahmed and featuring designs by fashion house AMI, Dammi conjures a uniquely transportive vision of Paris for its dreamlike exploration of cultural identity and family ties.

content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini exposes the deep-sea mating habits of the whale. But before he can mate, the male whale must control his six-foot penis in the push-and-pull motions of the ocean.
films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini exposes the deep-sea mating habits of the whale. But before he can mate, the male whale must control his six-foot penis in the push-and-pull motions of the ocean.
films.default_editorial: Rossellini’s ability to look dignified in any circumstance grants the Green Porno films a hypnotic power. Dressed here as a male whale, she captures both the brutality and strange poignancy of cetacean copulation, transforming the oddly mechanical act into something we might actually want to see.

films.title: This Closeness

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In Philadelphia for the weekend, Tessa and Ben, a couple on the rocks, rent a room in the apartment of Adam, a reclusive stranger who quickly becomes an unwilling voyeur to the most private parts of the couple’s life. Tensions rise as the three enter an intimate battle to gain and reclaim territory.
films.short_synopsis_html: In Philadelphia for the weekend, Tessa and Ben, a couple on the rocks, rent a room in the apartment of Adam, a reclusive stranger who quickly becomes an unwilling voyeur to the most private parts of the couple’s life. Tensions rise as the three enter an intimate battle to gain and reclaim territory.
films.default_editorial: Intimacy is brilliantly weaponized in this standout film from American rising star Kit Zauhar. Assembling a chamber drama with staggering performances and bruising humor, she twists space and sound into battle zones of emotion where closeness is at once bitter and erotic, touching and barbed.

content_rating.label: caution

films.short_synopsis: With cameras in hand, directors Bill and Turner Ross return to their hometown of Sidney, Ohio—zip code 45365—for nine months. In this small town, the stories of a father and son, cops and criminals, officials and their electorate coalesce into a mosaic of faces, places, and events.
films.short_synopsis_html: With cameras in hand, directors Bill and Turner Ross return to their hometown of Sidney, Ohio—zip code 45365—for nine months. In this small town, the stories of a father and son, cops and criminals, officials and their electorate coalesce into a mosaic of faces, places, and events.
films.default_editorial: Crafted with the kind of insight and affection that only locals could provide, this entrancing debut from the Ross Brothers is a panoramic portrait of small-town America. Winner of the Grand Jury Prize at SXSW Film Festival, 45365 is an all-embracing ode to Sidney, Ohio and its motley inhabitants.

films.title: Paradise: Faith

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: For Anna Maria, paradise lies with Jesus, and she devotes her time to door-to-door missionary work.  One day after years of absence, her husband, an Egyptian Muslim confined to a wheelchair, comes home—and soon prayers are replaced by fighting…
films.short_synopsis_html: For Anna Maria, paradise lies with Jesus, and she devotes her time to door-to-door missionary work. One day after years of absence, her husband, an Egyptian Muslim confined to a wheelchair, comes home—and soon prayers are replaced by fighting…
films.default_editorial: After Love comes Faith! The Paradise thematic trilogy heads into even more dangerous territory with the twisted middle installment’s look at extreme faith, diving forward with zero inhibitions and a positively fiendish eye for unsettling satire. One of the best films of 2012, said John Waters!

films.title: Green Porno: Starfish

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini unveils the unique mating habits of the starfish. The starfish will decide whether it will reproduce sexually, with a partner, or asexually, by itself.
films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini unveils the unique mating habits of the starfish. The starfish will decide whether it will reproduce sexually, with a partner, or asexually, by itself.
films.default_editorial: Accommodating the comedy, ferocity, and wonder of nature, the DIY style of Green Porno is open to the many facets of marine existence. The cruel reality is that not all species are equally vulnerable to predators—and as this disarming short shows, the starfish enjoys a rather charmed life.

films.title: Five Elements Ninjas

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Evil Japanese ninjas—who attack with fire, sun, wood, water, and earth—brutally slaughter the students of a noble Chinese kung fu school. The sole survivor finds a ninjitsu teacher, and with three other students, he studies how to counter ninja skills. Soon, the five will take revenge on the ninjas.
films.short_synopsis_html: Evil Japanese ninjas—who attack with fire, sun, wood, water, and earth—brutally slaughter the students of a noble Chinese kung fu school. The sole survivor finds a ninjitsu teacher, and with three other students, he studies how to counter ninja skills. Soon, the five will take revenge on the ninjas.
films.default_editorial: As the golden age of kung fu movies drew to a close, the great filmmakers at Shaw Brothers began questioning the very tenets of the martial world. Punctuated with fierce stabs of color, this brutal late-period epic from director Chang Cheh calcifies the path of vengeance into nihilistic abstraction.

films.title: Ungentle

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: An anonymous narrator talks through the various chapters of his life as a spy and a gay man in late 20th-century Britain. His vivid stories of intimacy and surveillance play out over shots of the luscious countryside, busy Central London streets, and nighttime cruising zones.
films.short_synopsis_html: An anonymous narrator talks through the various chapters of his life as a spy and a gay man in late 20th-century Britain. His vivid stories of intimacy and surveillance play out over shots of the luscious countryside, busy Central London streets, and nighttime cruising zones.
films.default_editorial: Shot on appealing 16mm film and exquisitely narrated by Ben Whishaw, this poetic short beckons us to imagine the sensitive lives and inner journeys of gay mid-20th century British spies. In a tone by turns wry and sincere, the narrator’s stories confer a poignant humanity to men who lied to survive.

films.title: The African Desperate

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: It’s MFA grad Palace Bryant’s final 24 hours in art school, and she is not going to the fucking graduation party! She needs to get back home to Chicago from Upstate New York, but that means surviving a hazy, hilarious, and hallucinatory odyssey, stumbling from academic critiques to backseat hookups.
films.short_synopsis_html: It’s MFA grad Palace Bryant’s final 24 hours in art school, and she is not going to the fucking graduation party! films.default_editorial: Chaos reigns in the riotously funny debut feature from visual artist Martine Syms. With a breakthrough performance from Diamond Stingily, this hallucinatory day-in-the-life of a Black artist is a rollicking satire of art-world pretensions and a rowdy portrayal of sex and drugs in the Internet age.

films.title: Altman

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Hollywood stars, including Bruce Willis, Robin Williams, and Lily Tomlin, look back on the life and work of filmmaker Robert Altman. While refusing to bow down to Hollywood’s conventions, or its executives, Altman’s unique style of filmmaking earned him worldwide praise and scathing criticism.
films.short_synopsis_html: Hollywood stars, including Bruce Willis, Robin Williams, and Lily Tomlin, look back on the life and work of filmmaker Robert Altman. While refusing to bow down to Hollywood’s conventions, or its executives, Altman’s unique style of filmmaking earned him worldwide praise and scathing criticism.
films.default_editorial: A loving portrait of an American maverick, Ron Mann’s in-depth documentary pays tribute to the boundless creative mind of Robert Altman. From home movies to never-before-seen promotion materials, revelatory archival footage captures a filmmaker who never ceased to surprise, whether on or off set.
films.default_editorial_html: A loving portrait of an American maverick, Ron Mann’s in-depth documentary pays tribute to the boundless creative mind of Robert Altman. From home movies to never-before-seen promotion materials, revelatory archival footage captures a filmmaker who never ceased to surprise, whether on or off set.

films.title: Shrooms

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In a forest just outside Lisbon, Dan, a young Venezuelan man, forages for magic mushrooms. Back in the city, he prepares the mushrooms before distributing them across Lisbon to those who need them the most—using carrier pigeons as his secret delivery service.
films.short_synopsis_html: In a forest just outside Lisbon, Dan, a young Venezuelan man, forages for magic mushrooms. Back in the city, he prepares the mushrooms before distributing them across Lisbon to those who need them the most—using carrier pigeons as his secret delivery service.
films.default_editorial: All fungi are fascinating—but some more than others. This soothing short shows that collecting, sharing, and using magic mushrooms can be delicate acts of care. Softly psychedelic images, playful in-camera effects, and intimate voice-over combine in a humble perspective on man’s place in the world.

films.title: The Anabasis of May and Fusako Shigenobu, Masao Adachi and the 27 Years Without Images
films.original_title: L'anabase de May et Fusako Shigenobu, Masao Adachi et 27 années sans images
films.title_upcase: THE ANABASIS OF MAY AND FUSAKO SHIGENOBU, MASAO ADACHI AND THE 27 YEARS WITHOUT IMAGES

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Artist Eric Baudelaire tracks the story of the Japanese Red Army through the ideological journey of two of its protagonists. Recounting this episode as the ‘anabasis’ of such radical faction, the Franco-American filmmaker captures a series of reflections that are both political and personal.
films.short_synopsis_html: Artist Eric Baudelaire tracks the story of the Japanese Red Army through the ideological journey of two of its protagonists. Recounting this episode as the ‘anabasis’ of such radical faction, the Franco-American filmmaker captures a series of reflections that are both political and personal.
films.default_editorial: Halfway between a documentary and a film-essay, Baudelaire’s film explores the intricate three-way relationship between politics, art and life. A sinuous collage that transpires a palpable tension between the private and the public, building up to a fascinating reflection on memory and its images.
films.default_editorial_html: Halfway between a documentary and a film-essay, Baudelaire’s film explores the intricate three-way relationship between politics, art and life. A sinuous collage that transpires a palpable tension between the private and the public, building up to a fascinating reflection on memory and its images.

films.title: Train Again

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: In Train Again, Peter Tscherkassky condenses the long history of railways in the movies into a rousing blast for the senses, created in heartfelt tribute to another local legend of experimental cinema, Kurt Kren (1929-1988).
films.short_synopsis_html: In Train Again, Peter Tscherkassky condenses the long history of railways in the movies into a rousing blast for the senses, created in heartfelt tribute to another local legend of experimental cinema, Kurt Kren (1929-1988).
films.default_editorial: Set to the relentless industrial rumble of train tracks and film leader, the latest film from the Austrian master of the avant-garde mounts a frenetic, flash-framed tribute to early cinema’s love affair with trains. All aboard a phantasmagoric journey into the flickering mechanics of moving images!

films.title: Medicine for Melancholy

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In a rapidly gentrifying San Francisco, a one-night stand between two bohemians, Micah and Jo’, spins off into a woozy daylong affair. Their day is filled with tenderness, friction, and intellectual sparring as they explore their relationships with each other, the city, and their own Blackness.
films.short_synopsis_html: In a rapidly gentrifying San Francisco, a one-night stand between two bohemians, Micah and Jo’, spins off into a woozy daylong affair. Their day is filled with tenderness, friction, and intellectual sparring as they explore their relationships with each other, the city, and their own Blackness.
films.default_editorial: More than a calling card for the Oscar®-winning Moonlight, Barry Jenkins’ feature debut heralded the arrival of a deeply impassioned vision. A yearning portrait of modern Blackness in San Francisco, Medicine for Melancholy is a captivatingly authentic tale of hesitant love and urban malaise.

films.title: Come Drink with Me

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: After kidnapping a general’s son, a gang is trailed by feared swordsman, Golden Swallow. What they don’t realize is that Golden Swallow is a woman, and the hostage is her brother. She is joined in her pursuit by Drunken Cat, a mischievous local beggar who may hold the key to her brother’s salvation.
films.short_synopsis_html: After kidnapping a general’s son, a gang is trailed by feared swordsman, Golden Swallow. She is joined in her pursuit by Drunken Cat, a mischievous local beggar who may hold the key to her brother’s salvation.
films.default_editorial: With an iconic turn from Cheng Pei-Pei (Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon), this female-centric masterwork kickstarted the wuxia resurgence of the 1960s. Making astonishing use of confined spaces, director King Hu fashions a cinema of movement impelled by the balletic virtuosity of his leading lady.

films.title: The Cut

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: One night in 1915, the Turkish police round up all the Armenian men in the city, including Nazaret, who is separated from his family. Years later, after surviving the horrors of the genocide, he hears that his twin daughters may also still be alive, and travels the globe in search of them.
films.short_synopsis_html: One night in 1915, the Turkish police round up all the Armenian men in the city, including Nazaret, who is separated from his family. Years later, after surviving the horrors of the genocide, he hears that his twin daughters may also still be alive, and travels the globe in search of them.
films.default_editorial: Turkish-German director Fatih Akın’s skill and sensitivity for capturing the tensions between the East and the West made him a true festival favourite. In The Cut he delivers an impressively assured take on a tragic historical episode—an epic tale of survival nodding to the westerns of John Ford.

films.short_synopsis: Kate has been absent from high school for a week due to a broken foot. Upon returning, she learns her clique of girlfriends has devised a secret plan with arsenic—codenamed “Lick the Star”—to make the boys weak.
films.short_synopsis_html: Kate has been absent from high school for a week due to a broken foot. Upon returning, she learns her clique of girlfriends has devised a secret plan with arsenic—codenamed “Lick the Star”—to make the boys weak.
films.default_editorial: Before The Virgin Suicides and Priscilla, Sofia Coppola had already transformed onscreen portrayals of girlhood and female friendship in her first directorial outing. Ultra-cool 1990s outfits, a killer soundtrack, and dreamy 16mm imagery make this audacious short an instant classic of teenage ennui.

films.title: Please Baby Please

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: After witnessing a murder on Manhattan’s gritty streets, a bohemian couple become the dangerous obsession of a greaser gang. Fear transforms into thrill and lust as the wife becomes infatuated with the gang’s rough exterior, and the husband singles out a gang member as an object of affection.

Dripping with neon colors, Please Baby Please surrenders to the ecstasy of erotic liberation.

films.title: The Fortress

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Switzerland has some of the most restrictive asylum laws in all of Europe. In a Swiss reception center for asylum-seekers, 200 men, women, and children wait—some having risked their lives to be here—until the government decides their fate. The facility’s daily sorting process is examined close up.
films.short_synopsis_html: Switzerland has some of the most restrictive asylum laws in all of Europe. In a Swiss reception center for asylum-seekers, 200 men, women, and children wait—some having risked their lives to be here—until the government decides their fate. The facility’s daily sorting process is examined close up.
films.default_editorial: Chronicling undocumented immigrants and asylum-seekers who must justify their presence in affluent Switzerland, this is a stirring and compassionate documentary rendered in stunning cinematography. Winner of the Filmmakers of the Present Golden Leopard at Locarno Festival.
films.default_editorial_html: Chronicling undocumented immigrants and asylum-seekers who must justify their presence in affluent Switzerland, this is a stirring and compassionate documentary rendered in stunning cinematography. films.title: Zama

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Don Diego de Zama is an 18th-century Spanish magistrate eternally languishing in wait for a transfer from the outpost to which he has been relegated. When his last hope of departure comes to naught, Zama joins an expedition to track down Vicuña Porto, a legendary outlaw who may or may not exist.
films.short_synopsis_html: Don Diego de Zama is an 18th-century Spanish magistrate eternally languishing in wait for a transfer from the outpost to which he has been relegated. When his last hope of departure comes to naught, Zama joins an expedition to track down Vicuña Porto, a legendary outlaw who may or may not exist.
films.default_editorial: In an ingenious adaptation of the existentialist novel Zama, Argentine auteur Lucrecia Martel inserts her own incisive commentary on colonialism and masculinity. Frenzied first-person narration transforms to become a cinematic fugue state in this singular and stupefying period drama.

films.title: Chameleon Street

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: William Douglas Street Jr., a Black Michigan man tired of his dead-end job, decides to scam his way up the socioeconomic ladder. He reinvents himself again and again, expertly impersonating a magazine reporter, an Ivy League student, a lawyer, and a surgeon—while staying one step ahead of the law.
films.short_synopsis_html: William Douglas Street Jr., a Black Michigan man tired of his dead-end job, decides to scam his way up the socioeconomic ladder. He reinvents himself again and again, expertly impersonating a magazine reporter, an Ivy League student, a lawyer, and a surgeon—while staying one step ahead of the law.
films.default_editorial: Wily creativity sparks across this newly restored masterwork of Black American cinema, which won the Grand Jury Prize at Sundance in 1990. Written and directed with ferocious wit and quicksilver style by its star, Wendell B. Harris Jr., this true-to-life tale of brazen hustle is a whirlwind of fun.

films.title: Caprice

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Lucky is a young woman who embarks on an Oz-style adventure when she is swallowed up by the pages of her favorite fashion magazine, Caprice. As she enters this dreamworld, Lucky crosses the different articles of the magazine, an experience at once fascinating and frightening.
films.short_synopsis_html: Lucky is a young woman who embarks on an Oz-style adventure when she is swallowed up by the pages of her favorite fashion magazine, Caprice. With influences ranging from German expressionism to Technicolor reveries, this wonderland of fashion spreads is a sartorial thrill.

films.title: Shakedown

content_rating.label: adult
content_rating.description: Contains very strong sexual and/or violent content.

films.short_synopsis: Shakedown was a series of parties founded by and for Black women in Los Angeles featuring go-go dancing and strip shows for the city’s lesbian underground scene. In them, female clientele slipped dollar notes into lap dancers’ panties while celebrating lesbian sexuality to pulsating hip-hop beats.
films.short_synopsis_html: Shakedown was a series of parties founded by and for Black women in Los Angeles featuring go-go dancing and strip shows for the city’s lesbian underground scene. In them, female clientele slipped dollar notes into lap dancers’ panties while celebrating lesbian sexuality to pulsating hip-hop beats.
films.default_editorial: Immersing viewers in a space that put Black lesbian pleasure front and center, Shakedown is an exuberant portrait of radical hedonism and a moving, vital time capsule. Revealing interviews, beautiful DIY flyers, and spectacularly explicit performances come together in a raucous and heady mix.
films.default_editorial_html: Immersing viewers in a space that put Black lesbian pleasure front and center, Shakedown is an exuberant portrait of radical hedonism and a moving, vital time capsule. Revealing interviews, beautiful DIY flyers, and spectacularly explicit performances come together in a raucous and heady mix.

films.title: Clan of the White Lotus

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: After the chief of the White Lotus Clan kills Hung Wen-ting’s wife and brother, Hung barely escapes. Set on vengeance, Hung withdraws from the world and—with the help of his brother’s widow—learns acupuncture and embroidery to master a new martial technique that could defeat the evil leader.
films.short_synopsis_html: After the chief of the White Lotus Clan kills Hung Wen-ting’s wife and brother, Hung barely escapes. Set on vengeance, Hung withdraws from the world and—with the help of his brother’s widow—learns acupuncture and embroidery to master a new martial technique that could defeat the evil leader.
films.default_editorial: Gordon Liu would don the white hair of wizened master Pai Mei in Tarantino’s Kill Bill vol. 2, but here he’s the callow apprentice studying a female fighting style to defeat the iconic villain. Directed by King Boxer’s leading man Lo Lieh, Clan of the White Lotus is a quintessential kung fu classic.

films.title: Forest of Bliss

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A priest performs sacred rites at a shrine near the Ganges. The king of a cremation grounds sells sacred fire to mourners. A healer attends pained people. Unfolding from one sunrise to the next: an account of the grief and happiness that punctuate daily life in the holy city of Benares, India.
films.short_synopsis_html: A priest performs sacred rites at a shrine near the Ganges. The king of a cremation grounds sells sacred fire to mourners. A healer attends pained people. Unfolding from one sunrise to the next: an account of the grief and happiness that punctuate daily life in the holy city of Benares, India.
films.default_editorial: The great American ethnographic filmmaker Robert Gardner passed away in 2014, leaving behind a legacy of innovative work that connects a line between filmmakers such as Jean Rouch and Werner Herzog. This gorgeous, contemplative exploration of an Indian city ranks among his many groundbreaking films.

films.short_synopsis: A chronicle of the struggles of a young woman held captive by her father and forced into prostitution in the Bicol region of the Philippines. Her story eventually intersects with that of a farmer and his dying wife, as well as that of two treasure seekers from the city.
films.short_synopsis_html: A chronicle of the struggles of a young woman held captive by her father and forced into prostitution in the Bicol region of the Philippines. Her story eventually intersects with that of a farmer and his dying wife, as well as that of two treasure seekers from the city.
films.default_editorial: The Filipino master of slow cinema intertwines a story of impoverished treasure hunters with the tale of a drifting woman coming to terms with a damaged mind and body. Extraordinary handheld camerawork captures the minutest of details, bringing the struggles of life into stark reality.

films.title: Berlin Troika

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: During a stormy night of grave political crisis, an expert interpreter suffers a nervous breakdown. Young diplomat Konrad has to step in and interpret between the two conflicting superpower leaders, who are loudly negotiating the world’s destiny to either peaceful resolution or total annihilation.
films.short_synopsis_html: During a stormy night of grave political crisis, an expert interpreter suffers a nervous breakdown. Young diplomat Konrad has to step in and interpret between the two conflicting superpower leaders, who are loudly negotiating the world’s destiny to either peaceful resolution or total annihilation.
films.default_editorial: Over the course of eleven intense minutes, this award-winning short film acts as a ticking time bomb, imbued with cold war tension, dazzling camera angles and exquisite set design. Carried by excellent performances, this political chamber piece puts translation in the centre of the frame, literally.

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In urban Pakistan, queer individuals manage personal conflicts and the pressures of society. Drag performer Kami lives openly with his boyfriend. Jenny, a trans student, just underwent surgery. Meanwhile, Neeli has been instrumental in changing Pakistan’s constitution to recognize the third gender.
films.short_synopsis_html: In urban Pakistan, queer individuals manage personal conflicts and the pressures of society. Drag performer Kami lives openly with his boyfriend. Jenny, a trans student, just underwent surgery. Meanwhile, Neeli has been instrumental in changing Pakistan’s constitution to recognize the third gender.
films.default_editorial: Tackling the stigma and taboos related to sexuality head-on, Hide and Seek presents an honest and emotional portrayal of complex gender struggles in contemporary Pakistan. A moving and compelling study of societal power structures and the courage that enables people to rise beyond them.

content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In Boulogne-sur-Mer, the past of widowed antique shop owner Hélène comes back to haunt her when a former lover reenters her life. Meanwhile, her stepson Bernard is tormented by his own ghosts, related to his service in France’s recently ended war in Algeria.
films.short_synopsis_html: In Boulogne-sur-Mer, the past of widowed antique shop owner Hélène comes back to haunt her when a former lover reenters her life. Meanwhile, her stepson Bernard is tormented by his own ghosts, related to his service in France’s recently ended war in Algeria.
films.default_editorial: A richly nuanced drama of memory and history, this enigmatic masterpiece was Alain Resnais’s overwhelming follow-up to Last Year at Marienbad. A tale of personal and political hauntings starring the magnificent Delphine Seyrig, Muriel is as breathtakingly edited as it is emotionally devastating.

films.title: La libertad

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: Matriarchs have assembled around a backstrap loom, a pre-Hispanic technique preserved by indigenous women of Mesoamerica. Unfolding like a weaving of figures and the gestures making up this labor, the film circulates between a domestic space, an archaeological museum, and a weavers’ cooperative.
films.short_synopsis_html: Matriarchs have assembled around a backstrap loom, a pre-Hispanic technique preserved by indigenous women of Mesoamerica. Unfolding like a weaving of figures and the gestures making up this labor, the film circulates between a domestic space, an archaeological museum, and a weavers’ cooperative.
films.default_editorial: Produced at Harvard’s Sensory Ethnography Lab (Leviathan, Manakamana), La Libertad dives into a matriarchal universe and knits a rich portrait of female independence. Through the exploration of an ancestral craft, Laura Huertas Millán’s film quietly challenges our idea of freedom.

films.title: The War of the Worlds: Next Century
films.title_upcase: THE WAR OF THE WORLDS: NEXT CENTURY

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Poland, Christmastime. A band of hyperintelligent, bloodthirsty martians take over the country and enlist hapless television newscaster Iron Ide as the voice of their propaganda machine. But when Iron dares to go off message, he makes an enemy even greater than the aliens—the state itself.
films.short_synopsis_html: Poland, Christmastime. A band of hyperintelligent, bloodthirsty martians take over the country and enlist hapless television newscaster Iron Ide as the voice of their propaganda machine. But when Iron dares to go off message, he makes an enemy even greater than the aliens—the state itself.
films.default_editorial: Pulled from the Cannes competition in the same year that Poland declared martial law, Piotr Szulkin’s tale of alien invasion is a blazing satire of the media machine. Dedicated to H.G. Wells and Orson Welles, this noir-inflected sci-fi is an eerily prescient interrogation of the fake-news era.

films.title: The Here After

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: When teenager John returns to his rural hometown after serving time in prison, he finds that his crime is neither forgiven nor forgotten. The local community and students at his old high school struggle with his presence. Soon, John is being attacked by fellow pupils and strangers in shops.
films.short_synopsis_html: When teenager John returns to his rural hometown after serving time in prison, he finds that his crime is neither forgiven nor forgotten. The local community and students at his old high school struggle with his presence. Soon, John is being attacked by fellow pupils and strangers in shops.
films.default_editorial: Before The Girl with the Needle, Magnus von Horn charted rugged psychological terrains in his suspenseful debut feature. Capturing the ripples that violence sends through a community in mourning, The Here After is an intricate study of a violent mind, and a provocative meditation on murder.

films.short_synopsis: On a baking hot day in Bucharest, priest Florin Florescu arrives at a quiet home to administer the last rites to a dying woman. But not everyone is happy with the visitor and his Christian ritual.
films.short_synopsis_html: On a baking hot day in Bucharest, priest Florin Florescu arrives at a quiet home to administer the last rites to a dying woman. But not everyone is happy with the visitor and his Christian ritual.
films.default_editorial: Aiming his satirical arrow at the contradictions of religion, Radu Jude brings thorny questions of faith down to earth in this darkly ironic short. From tax forms and rush-hour traffic to customer’s woes, the daily travails of an ordinary priest are rendered amusingly, farcically transactional.

films.title: Drowning by Numbers

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A curious tale of three women of the same name, whose solidarity for one another brings about three copy-cat drownings. Their husbands are the victims and the motive is dissatisfaction. The women are confident that their crimes will not be punished because they have in tow a coroner who loves them.
films.short_synopsis_html: A curious tale of three women of the same name, whose solidarity for one another brings about three copy-cat drownings. Their husbands are the victims and the motive is dissatisfaction. The women are confident that their crimes will not be punished because they have in tow a coroner who loves them.
films.default_editorial: In another collaboration between cinematographer Sacha Vierny, composer Michael Nyman and the painstakingly attentive and avant-garde Peter Greenaway, this wryly comic, exceedingly clever mystery film forms the perfect puzzle. Intricate and elusive, a dark drama that’s still hugely playful.

films.title: B for Boy

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Amaka, a modern woman with a career, a daughter, and a loving husband, is almost forty and pregnant with their second child. Her husband’s entire family are passionately hoping that it will be a boy. But when she has a miscarriage, she takes extreme measures to keep the hope of a male heir alive.
films.short_synopsis_html: Amaka, a modern woman with a career, a daughter, and a loving husband, is almost forty and pregnant with their second child. Her husband’s entire family are passionately hoping that it will be a boy. But when she has a miscarriage, she takes extreme measures to keep the hope of a male heir alive.
films.default_editorial: With a dramatic story at its core, B for Boy balances a deeply realist and critical angle with tender and poetic directing. A great addition to Nigerian cinema, it exposes the embedded sexism of its society, and the strategies put in place to control women from its patriarchal system.
films.default_editorial_html: With a dramatic story at its core, B for Boy balances a deeply realist and critical angle with tender and poetic directing. films.title: The One-Armed Swordsman

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: At The Golden Sword school, orphan Fang Kang is scorned by his snobbish fellow students. Soon, a fight leads to him losing his arm. The depressed Fang Kang is nursed back to health by a local girl, whose half-burnt kung fu manual may help him master a new one-armed style of swordplay.
films.short_synopsis_html: At The Golden Sword school, orphan Fang Kang is scorned by his snobbish fellow students. Soon, a fight leads to him losing his arm. The depressed Fang Kang is nursed back to health by a local girl, whose half-burnt kung fu manual may help him master a new one-armed style of swordplay.
films.default_editorial: A profoundly influential wuxia classic, this opus of dismemberment and revenge made a star of its leading man Jimmy Wang Yu. Stunningly shot on studio soundstages, The One-armed Swordsman sees director Chang Cheh elevate the Shaw Brothers house style to operatic levels of artifice and abstraction.

films.short_synopsis: Twin Peaks before Twin Peaks and, at the same time, not always and entirely in the same place as Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me. An hour and a half of deleted scenes and alternate takes from the series prequel continue to tell the story of the final week of Laura Palmer’s life.
films.short_synopsis_html: Twin Peaks before Twin Peaks and, at the same time, not always and entirely in the same place as Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me. films.default_editorial: Delve deeper into the scandalous mysteries of Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me with this mesmerizing collection of outtakes from David Lynch’s febrile masterwork. At once a companion piece and an oneiric, standalone feature, The Missing Pieces enriches the dark mythologies of a pop-cultural phenomenon.

films.title: Mammas: Oil Beetle

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Being an orphaned oil beetle larva isn’t so tragic. Isabella Rossellini explains that the larvae simply must trick male bees into thinking they are sexy female bees.
films.short_synopsis_html: Being an orphaned oil beetle larva isn’t so tragic. Isabella Rossellini explains that the larvae simply must trick male bees into thinking they are sexy female bees.
films.default_editorial: Deception is the name of the game for these oleaginous crawlers, hoodwinking neighboring species to thrive and survive. Playing the male fool in this particular installment, Isabella Rossellini is dizzied by insect trickery and seductive pheromones, and air-humps a cardboard cutout. Enough said!

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: With her two small children in hand, a woman heads to a construction yard. She then climbs up a high crane to the very end of the boom, clutching her kids. She threatens to jump if, by that evening, she’s not provided with a flat that she can afford.
films.short_synopsis_html: With her two small children in hand, a woman heads to a construction yard. She then climbs up a high crane to the very end of the boom, clutching her kids. She threatens to jump if, by that evening, she’s not provided with a flat that she can afford.
films.default_editorial: We enter with typewriters and leave with sirens. Activist and veteran filmmaker Helke Sander has never shied from controversy, and she won the short film Golden Bear at Berlin for this eerily detached account of an incident from the fade out of the Cold War. A rarity from the Deutsche Kinemathek!

films.title: Dirty Ho

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: To hide his true nobility and kung fu prowess, Master Wang poses as a jewelry merchant. When he meets Dirty Ho, a witty con artist, Wang knows he has found the right man to help him untangle a plot to take over the throne. Wang puts Ho through brutal kung fu training to face his enemies’ treachery.
films.short_synopsis_html: To hide his true nobility and kung fu prowess, Master Wang poses as a jewelry merchant. films.default_editorial: An all-time great kung fu comedy from the virtuosic Lau Kar-leung, Dirty Ho boasts singular fight scenes that combine acrobatic elegance and zany slapstick. Facing formidable foes, all played by martial arts icons, Gordon Liu and Wong Yue make for a riotous duo of cheeky master and hapless sidekick.

films.title: Safari

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Africa. In the wild expanses, where bushbucks, impalas, zebras, gnus and other creatures graze by the thousands, they are on holiday. German and Austrian hunting tourists drive through the bush, lie in wait, stalk their prey. A vacation movie about killing, a movie about human nature.
films.short_synopsis_html: Africa. In the wild expanses, where bushbucks, impalas, zebras, gnus and other creatures graze by the thousands, they are on holiday. German and Austrian hunting tourists drive through the bush, lie in wait, stalk their prey. A vacation movie about killing, a movie about human nature.
films.default_editorial: Taking aim at hunting tourism in Africa, barbed documentary Safari places viewers in the hunters’ point-of-view with formal rigor. Following Germanic travelers as they slaughter exotic animals on hunting farms, the film underscores contradictions and racism in graphic and grotesque fashion.

films.short_synopsis: A young sailor is attracted to a mysterious mermaid performing at a carnival, but soon suspects that the girl is actually a siren who draws men to their watery deaths during the full moon.
films.short_synopsis_html: A young sailor is attracted to a mysterious mermaid performing at a carnival, but soon suspects that the girl is actually a siren who draws men to their watery deaths during the full moon.
films.default_editorial: A baby-faced Dennis Hopper makes his lead-role debut in this atmospheric “creature feature” from underground filmmaker Curtis Harrington. films.short_synopsis: Alicia feels lost. The memory of war clings to her mind in a terrifying rumble. Thrown off her land by armed conflict, she tries to build a new life at ‘La Sirga’, a rundown boarding house on the shore of a large lagoon high up in the Andes mountain range.
films.short_synopsis_html: Alicia feels lost. The memory of war clings to her mind in a terrifying rumble. Thrown off her land by armed conflict, she tries to build a new life at ‘La Sirga’, a rundown boarding house on the shore of a large lagoon high up in the Andes mountain range.
films.default_editorial: Nature—in the form of vast mountainous regions of rural Colombia—figures as a central character in concert with the beguiling non-actor Joghis Seudin Arias in this haunting drama. Moving with patient and oneiric rhythms, this is a transfixing story of a people searching for a sense of home.
