films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini examines the maternal instincts of the piping plover. The piping plover mamma is an amazing actress, who pretends to be injured to save her children.

films.short_synopsis: Sergeant Bulut dutifully maintains a solitary guard atop a remote watchtower. Night after night, Bulut scans the horizon, awaiting an enemy that never materializes—until the sudden appearance of ghostly apparitions disrupts his routine.
films.short_synopsis_html: Sergeant Bulut dutifully maintains a solitary guard atop a remote watchtower. Night after night, Bulut scans the horizon, awaiting an enemy that never materializes—until the sudden appearance of ghostly apparitions disrupts his routine.
films.default_editorial: Haunted by absences and uncanny visions, Ali Cherri’s eerie short soon slips from an atmosphere of suspense into a more surreal realm. films.short_synopsis: The music video for “Thru the Wire” by the Leningrad Cowboys. Somewhere between Alabama and Utah, sometime in the future, Nicky escapes from a prison. He searches for his girl in every bar and hotel. Meanwhile, two agents of the law pursue him.
films.short_synopsis_html: The music video for “Thru the Wire” by the Leningrad Cowboys. Somewhere between Alabama and Utah, sometime in the future, Nicky escapes from a prison. He searches for his girl in every bar and hotel. Meanwhile, two agents of the law pursue him.
films.default_editorial: Cigarette smoke hangs in the air throughout this early Leningrad Cowboys music video. Shot in high-contrast monochrome, and with the band decked out in trench coats and fedoras, the vibe is pure pulp. Kaurismäki aces the noir pastiche, while the boys lend their gravelly vocals and some sultry sax.

films.title: Pepi, Luci, Bom
films.original_title: Pepi, Luci, Bom y otras chicas del montón

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In 1980s countercultural Madrid, three women embark on wild misadventures. Pepi, a layabout, becomes an overnight success in the advertising world. Luci, a housewife, discovers her hidden masochistic side—while Bom is the lesbian punk who teaches Luci to find her pleasure in pain.
films.short_synopsis_html: In 1980s countercultural Madrid, three women embark on wild misadventures. Pepi, a layabout, becomes an overnight success in the advertising world. Luci, a housewife, discovers her hidden masochistic side—while Bom is the lesbian punk who teaches Luci to find her pleasure in pain.
films.default_editorial: Identity, sexuality, the reshaping of life through art—Pedro Almodóvar’s career preoccupations are already in plain sight in his first commercially released feature. Forget the vibrant formal poise of his mature works, Pepi, Luci, Bom is a scuzzy, punk-inflected exercise in filmmaking on the run.

films.title: The Boxer from Shantung

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Early 1900s. A young Northern Chinese man’s fearsome boxing ability allows him to muscle his way to the top of the Shanghai underworld. But when he refuses to become an assassin for the city’s leading gang, he finds life on Shanghai’s mean streets far riskier than the boxing ring.
films.short_synopsis_html: Early 1900s. A young Northern Chinese man’s fearsome boxing ability allows him to muscle his way to the top of the Shanghai underworld. But when he refuses to become an assassin for the city’s leading gang, he finds life on Shanghai’s mean streets far riskier than the boxing ring.
films.default_editorial: What good are codes of honor in an unchivalrous world? It’s the key question for director Chang Cheh in this period crime epic. With action staging by choreographer supreme Lau Kar-leung, The Boxer from Shantung builds to a pyrrhic last stand that ranks among the bloodiest battles in the Shaw canon.

films.title: The Future

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Directionless thirty-somethings Sophie and Jason will soon adopt a cat that will need constant attention. With one month of freedom left, the couple decides to live life as if the world is ending, leading to quitting their jobs and the internet, creative confusion, adultery and stopping time itself.
films.short_synopsis_html: Directionless thirty-somethings Sophie and Jason will soon adopt a cat that will need constant attention. With one month of freedom left, the couple decides to live life as if the world is ending, leading to quitting their jobs and the internet, creative confusion, adultery and stopping time itself.
films.default_editorial: A film fully realized by writer-director and star Miranda July (also an accomplished author and artist), this sophomore feature is telescopic and microscopic, balancing both the personal and universal. A hugely ambitious sci-fi-hybrid steeped in metaphor, as well a touching, human romantic drama.

films.title: Vanaja

films.short_synopsis: Vanaja, the 15 year old daughter of a financially troubled fisherman goes to work in the local landlady’s house in hopes of learning Kuchipudi dance. She does well, but when the Landlady’s son returns from the US, what begins as innocent sexual chemistry turns ugly.

films.default_editorial: Shot in India’s rural south with a cast of nonprofessionals, this beautiful drama from Rajnesh Domalpalli evokes the melodic majesty of Satyajit Ray’s immortal classic The Music Room. With its vibrant colors and dazzling dance sequences, Vanaja is an exquisitely textured portrait of village life.

films.title: Juha

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Everything changes for rural farmer Juha and his wife Marja when a sophisticated stranger is brought fatefully into their lives after his car breaks down in their village. Soon, Marja is seduced by the city slicker and runs away with him, only to find herself in a dire situation in the metropolis.
films.short_synopsis_html: Everything changes for rural farmer Juha and his wife Marja when a sophisticated stranger is brought fatefully into their lives after his car breaks down in their village. films.default_editorial: Move over The Artist, there’s a new black-and-white silent-movie pastiche in town. Given his characters’ penchant for monosyllabism, it’s surprising it took Kaurismäki so long to make a silent film. Stunningly shot by Timo Salminen, this wistful melodrama is a stylistic triumph of parodic affection.

films.title: White God

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Favoring pedigree dogs, a new law puts a severe tax on mixed breeds. Owners dump their dogs and shelters become overcrowded. Lili, 13, fights desperately to protect her pet Hagen, but her father eventually dumps the dog. However, Hagen joins a gang of stray dogs who begin a canine uprising.
films.short_synopsis_html: Favoring pedigree dogs, a new law puts a severe tax on mixed breeds. Owners dump their dogs and shelters become overcrowded. films.default_editorial: A pack of dogs run wild through the streets of Budapest in this captivating revenge parable from Kornél Mundruczó, an idiosyncratic allegory on authority, rebellion, power, and protest. Winner of the Un Certain Regard prize at the Cannes Film Festival, White God is an astonishing dystopic vision.

films.title: Polluting Paradise

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: The people of Camburnu, a village in Turkey’s Black Sea region, have relied on tea cultivation and fishing for generations. But the government has now transformed their home into a vast open-air landfill. Over five years, the garbage dump continues to expand, despite challenges from the community.
films.short_synopsis_html: The people of Camburnu, a village in Turkey’s Black Sea region, have relied on tea cultivation and fishing for generations. But the government has now transformed their home into a vast open-air landfill. Over five years, the garbage dump continues to expand, despite challenges from the community.
films.default_editorial: Set in the small village where his grandparents live, this environmental documentary from the Turkish-German auteur Fatih Akin (_Head-On, In the Fade), balances the personal and polemical. Shot over the course of 5 years, this is an informative and moving look at a filmmaker revisiting his roots.

films.title: Autobiographical Scene Number 6882

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A 30-year-old man is celebrating Midsummer’s Eve together with friends in Smögen, on the west coast of Sweden. He makes his friends follow him to a very high bridge. The group watches as he prepares to jump into the water below.

films.default_editorial: Setting the blueprint for Force Majeure and more, Ruben Östlund’s thrilling short showcases his exceptional eye for social tensions. Cleverly exploring the fallibility of groupthink and machismo in dangerous situations, this is a witty, mischievous provocation from the master satirist.

films.title: Diamond Island

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Cambodia’s Diamond Island is a sprawling, ultra-modern paradise for the rich on the river in Phnom Penh. Country boy Bora is lured to the city to work on the area’s construction. There, he discovers the exciting world of Cambodia’s privileged urban youth—with its girls, nightlife, and illusions.
films.short_synopsis_html: Cambodia’s Diamond Island is a sprawling, ultra-modern paradise for the rich on the river in Phnom Penh. Country boy Bora is lured to the city to work on the area’s construction. There, he discovers the exciting world of Cambodia’s privileged urban youth—with its girls, nightlife, and illusions.
films.default_editorial: Evoking the entrancing youth films of Hou Hsiao-hsien and Tsai Ming-liang, this lilting drama is the fiction feature debut of Return to Seoul director Davy Chou. Stylishly irradiated by a perpetual neon glow, Diamond Island is a plaintive examination of hypermodernity and adolescent disaffection.

films.title: The Milk of Sorrow

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Fausta, we are told, suffers from ‘the milk of sorrow’, a melancholy transmitted through her mother’s breast milk. For Fausta’s mother, like many in her village, was raped during the years of Peru’s bloody civil conflict in the 1980s, and Fausta still lives with the consequences of the violence.
films.short_synopsis_html: Fausta, we are told, suffers from ‘the milk of sorrow’, a melancholy transmitted through her mother’s breast milk. For Fausta’s mother, like many in her village, was raped during the years of Peru’s bloody civil conflict in the 1980s, and Fausta still lives with the consequences of the violence.
films.default_editorial: Intimate, political, and quietly sublime, The Milk of Sorrow is a beautifully shot story about female identity in war-torn Peru. Emotionally affective all along, the film earned young director Claudia Llosa the first nomination to the Academy Awards® for a Peruvian film. Plus a Golden Bear!

films.title: Bloodsuckers

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: 1928. In a glamorous German seaside resort, a local Marxist book club attempts to rally the paranoid townspeople against a ruling class of allegedly vampiric aristocrats. Meanwhile, newcomer Lyuvoschka—a penniless Soviet refugee—begins a summer romance with an eccentric young heiress.
films.short_synopsis_html: 1928. In a glamorous German seaside resort, a local Marxist book club attempts to rally the paranoid townspeople against a ruling class of allegedly vampiric aristocrats. Meanwhile, newcomer Lyuvoschka—a penniless Soviet refugee—begins a summer romance with an eccentric young heiress.
films.default_editorial: Karl Marx was being metaphorical when he described exploitative elites as vampires, but Julian Radlmaier’s surreal satire takes him at his word. Starring one of our favorite new filmmakers, Alexandre Koberidze, Bloodsuckers’ immaculate mise-en-scène is riddled with socialist thought and surplus wit.

films.title: Pino

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Rome, 1968. At the pinnacle of his career, artist Pino Pascali died in an accident. 50 years later the Pascali Museum in Apulia—where Pino was born—buys and exhibits one of his works. Old photographs by Pino Pascali—and new ones by Pino Musi—tell the story of a work of art returning to its origins.
films.short_synopsis_html: Rome, 1968. At the pinnacle of his career, artist Pino Pascali died in an accident. 50 years later the Pascali Museum in Apulia—where Pino was born—buys and exhibits one of his works. Old photographs by Pino Pascali—and new ones by Pino Musi—tell the story of a work of art returning to its origins.
films.default_editorial: The directorial debut of editor Walter Fasano (Call Me by Your Name), this unconventional documentary is a spirited portrait of Pino Pascali, an icon of postwar Italian art. Narrated by Suzanne Vega, Alma Jodorowsky, and Michele Riondino, Pino unmasks the revolutionary legacy of a forgotten artist.

films.title: In the Basement

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Whatever people no longer need, they dump in the basement. But some pursue their obsessions there, in hiding. Think brass-band music and opera arias, expensive furniture and cheap men’s jokes, sexuality and sadism, fitness and fascism, whips and dolls…
films.short_synopsis_html: Whatever people no longer need, they dump in the basement. But some pursue their obsessions there, in hiding. Think brass-band music and opera arias, expensive furniture and cheap men’s jokes, sexuality and sadism, fitness and fascism, whips and dolls…
films.default_editorial: Exploring an unseen side of Austria, provocateur Ulrich Seidl wanders into actual basements to look at the darkest desires of its inhabitants. Often hilarious and grotesque—yet somehow compassionate—this is a startling look at power dynamics, ranging from S&M to the festering seeds of fascism.

films.title: Calamari Union

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A group of men all called Frank—except for one named Pekka—have had enough of life in their working-class neighborhood, so they set off for a better existence in the magical seaside district of Eira. But the way is long, and the group face many hurdles including stray dogs and defunct streetlights.
films.short_synopsis_html: A group of men all called Frank—except for one named Pekka—have had enough of life in their working-class neighborhood, so they set off for a better existence in the magical seaside district of Eira. But the way is long, and the group face many hurdles including stray dogs and defunct streetlights.
films.default_editorial: Get ready to enter the absurdist universe of Aki Kaurismäki with this satirical cult dramedy from the master of deadpan. Starring the director himself alongside an array of rock musicians, Calamari Union evokes the cinema of Monty Python while exquisitely playing with the American gangster genre.

films.title: A Leap in the Dark

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Judge Mauro Ponticelli has lived with his sister his whole life, but as her mental heath issues worsen, he’s uncertain about how to care for her. But when his sister meets an actor who brings her out of her depression, Mauro finds himself unconsciously jealous.
films.short_synopsis_html: Judge Mauro Ponticelli has lived with his sister his whole life, but as her mental heath issues worsen, he’s uncertain about how to care for her. But when his sister meets an actor who brings her out of her depression, Mauro finds himself unconsciously jealous.
films.default_editorial: A stunning directorial comeback, Marco Bellocchio’s darkly comic marvel won Michel Piccoli and Anouk Aimée top acting prizes at Cannes. Paralleling familial dysfunction with societal ills, this acerbic exploration of monstrous masculinity dares to expose the moral rot of Italy’s legislative system.

films.title: Permanent Vacation

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: The young, alienated Aloysius Christopher Parker has no home, no school, and no job. He wanders an empty Manhattan searching for a sense of meaning, drifting in and out of strange encounters with eccentrics and vagabonds—always keeping just ahead of whatever it is that seems to be chasing him.
films.short_synopsis_html: The young, alienated Aloysius Christopher Parker has no home, no school, and no job. He wanders an empty Manhattan searching for a sense of meaning, drifting in and out of strange encounters with eccentrics and vagabonds—always keeping just ahead of whatever it is that seems to be chasing him.
films.default_editorial: Shot for just $12, 000 in grimy downtown Manhattan, Jim Jarmusch’s lo-fi, laconic debut has become an iconic example of true indie cinema. With its long takes, desolate urban setting, and interest in hip, offbeat outcasts, Permanent Vacation takes a cool and considerate look at life on the fringes.

films.title: Intimate Confessions of a Chinese Courtesan
films.title_upcase: INTIMATE CONFESSIONS OF A CHINESE COURTESAN

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: The innocent Ai Nu is sold to a brothel run by evil Madam Chun Yi, who falls in love with her at first sight. Quickly becoming the brothel’s most desirable courtesan, Ai Nu climbs the ranks in Chinese society. Meanwhile, she secretly plots bloody revenge against all who have wronged her.

films.default_editorial: Supreme studio craftsman Chor Yuen plants one foot in the arthouse, the other in the grindhouse, and delivers a transgressive masterpiece. Forget the salacious title: this breathtaking blend of sexploitation and wuxia melodrama is a ravishing critique of forced prostitution worthy of Mizoguchi.

films.title: Five Deadly Venoms

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Lizard, Centipede, Toad, Snake, and Scorpion are all disciples of the infamous School of Five Venoms. Each know a unique style of kung fu. The sixth and final pupil, Chiang Sheng, is instructed by their dying teacher to seek out the five former pupils and defeat any evil ones among them.
films.short_synopsis_html: Lizard, Centipede, Toad, Snake, and Scorpion are all disciples of the infamous School of Five Venoms. Each know a unique style of kung fu. The sixth and final pupil, Chiang Sheng, is instructed by their dying teacher to seek out the five former pupils and defeat any evil ones among them.
films.default_editorial: The Venom Mob—five masked ruffians with singular fighting styles— would appear in dozens of films at Shaw Brothers, but Five Deadly Venoms is where they first made their mark. A Tarantino favorite endlessly sampled by the Wu Tang Clan, Chang Cheh’s kung fu murder mystery is a ferocious cult classic.

films.title: Henry Fool

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Simon is a garbage man living a miserable life until he meets Henry Fool, a mysterious writer working on a major piece of literature. Henry convinces Simon to write in a journal and learns that he is a poetic prodigy. When Simon becomes a controversial sensation, Henry turns to Simon for help.
films.short_synopsis_html: Simon is a garbage man living a miserable life until he meets Henry Fool, a mysterious writer working on a major piece of literature. Henry convinces Simon to write in a journal and learns that he is a poetic prodigy. When Simon becomes a controversial sensation, Henry turns to Simon for help.
films.default_editorial: American independent filmmaker Hal Hartley culminated his bravura run of ’90s greats with this droll, bawdy epic which took the Best Screenplay award at Cannes. Starring the wondrous Parker Posey, Henry Fool is a singularly stylised fable that existentially ponders the value of an artistic life.

films.title: Trouble Every Day

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Shane and June Brown are an American couple honeymooning in Paris in an effort to nurture their new life together, a life complicated by Shane’s mysterious and frequent visits to a medical clinic where cutting edge studies of the human libido are undertaken.
films.short_synopsis_html: Shane and June Brown are an American couple honeymooning in Paris in an effort to nurture their new life together, a life complicated by Shane’s mysterious and frequent visits to a medical clinic where cutting edge studies of the human libido are undertaken.
films.default_editorial: One of the luminaries of the contemporary arthouse, Claire Denis makes her own version of a vampire tale in this elliptical, sensual film of disease and desire. Loaded with mystery and tactility, Trouble Every Day stars Béatrice Dalle and Vincent Gallo with an intense score by Tindersticks.

films.title: Hamlet Goes Business

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: When Hamlet discovers his father’s deceased body, he finds himself pulled into a power struggle as his scheming uncle attempts to secure a monopoly on the Scandinavian rubber duck industry. Will Hamlet avenge his father? Will he become the king of rubber ducks? Does any of it really matter?
films.short_synopsis_html: When Hamlet discovers his father’s deceased body, he finds himself pulled into a power struggle as his scheming uncle attempts to secure a monopoly on the Scandinavian rubber duck industry. films.default_editorial: Having already adapted Dostoyevsky for his feature debut, Aki Kaurismäki turned to Shakespeare for a radical, noir-adjacent take on the Danish play. A business-world satire shot in starkly modernist black and white, the anarchically funny Hamlet Goes Business is a hard-boiled, deadpan delight.

films.title: The Dream of Lu

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: After a suicide attempt, Lucía needs to find new meaning in her life in order to move on and face the loss of her son. She assists a therapy group for parents, finding small miracles and new ways of healing on an unexpected journey that will lead her to rediscover her place among the living.
films.short_synopsis_html: After a suicide attempt, Lucía needs to find new meaning in her life in order to move on and face the loss of her son. films.default_editorial: Told in three parts, The Dream of Lu is a film dealing with grief: a visually haunting, moving melodrama that sometimes diverts into surrealism. The second feature from Carlos Sama—who received an honorable mention at Mexico’s Morelia International Film Festival & has been compared to Kieslowski!

films.short_synopsis: After a random night raid in a local park, a young, gay writer, Ah Lan, is held for an intensive one-on-one interrogation. Unwanted memories offer glimpses of his tumultuous past. Through the night, an interrogating officer is both revolted and fascinated by Ah Lan. An awkward love story unfolds.

films.default_editorial: One of the first films from mainland China to explicitly portray queer life, Zhang Yuan’s pioneering marvel bristles with the heady push and pull between lust and repression. As the setting shifts from a cruising hotspot to an integration room, what begins as a confession soon ignites a carnal fire.

films.short_synopsis: June, 1993. Helsinki. Over 50,000 people witness the Aki Kaurismäki-formed rock group, Leningrad Cowboys, performing with 100 singers, 40 musicians, and 20 dancers from the Alexandrov Red Army Chorus and Dance Ensemble. From start to finish, the concert is a roaring success.
films.short_synopsis_html: June, 1993. Helsinki. Over 50,000 people witness the Aki Kaurismäki-formed rock group, Leningrad Cowboys, performing with 100 singers, 40 musicians, and 20 dancers from the Alexandrov Red Army Chorus and Dance Ensemble. From start to finish, the concert is a roaring success.
films.default_editorial: With two movies, a handful of shorts, and a healthy discography under their belts, there was only one thing left on the Leningrad Cowboys’ bucket list: to go on tour. Across an hour of outlandish rock ‘n’ roll covers, Aki Kaurismäki’s raucous concert film captures the band in all their loopy glory.

films.short_synopsis: 1. Find a reassuring explanation for a bout of sleeplessness: the eating of white turnips; 2. Observe the mechanisms of passion; 3. Escape inadequate ideas. It’s the story of a breakup.
films.short_synopsis_html: 1. Find a reassuring explanation for a bout of sleeplessness: the eating of white turnips; 2. Observe the mechanisms of passion; 3. Escape inadequate ideas. It’s the story of a breakup.
films.default_editorial: The authenticity of Salomé Richard’s performances is one of the main reasons for the extraordinary emotional reach of this triptych. White Turnips sees Ana trapped in a fading relationship, gradually coming to terms with the idea of letting go. A delicate and truthful chronicle of a death foretold.

films.short_synopsis: Alvin and Lance spend the summer of 1988 in a deserted, fire-damaged forest, with the monotonous task of repainting the markings on a country road. The isolated landscape becomes a place of misadventure as the men find themselves at odds with each other and the women they left behind.
films.short_synopsis_html: Alvin and Lance spend the summer of 1988 in a deserted, fire-damaged forest, with the monotonous task of repainting the markings on a country road. The isolated landscape becomes a place of misadventure as the men find themselves at odds with each other and the women they left behind.
films.default_editorial: Before his blockbuster Halloween reboot, David Gordon Green revitalized another beloved genre with an atypical buddy movie. Showcasing his skill with broad comedy, this warm film fuses that wit with the intimacy of the director’s earlier, sensitive character studies like George Washington.

films.title: Lady

films.short_synopsis: An unnamed woman in a red wig welcomes a documentary crew into her New York apartment. The crew captures her everyday life, as she fights with her boyfriend and gossips with her friend. These scenes alternate with black-and-white footage of a woman in a red wig escaping a suburban existence.

films.default_editorial: Anchored by a magnetic central performance, this free-form short captures both the thrill and isolation of New York City life. Ira Sachs borrows from cinéma vérité and TV melodrama to craft an intimate and intriguing portrait of a woman grappling with her own uncertain sexuality and gender identity.

films.short_synopsis: The Alps is a secret society including a nurse, a gym coach, a gymnast and a paramedic. They offer a unique service: the recently bereaved can hire them to act as surrogates for the deceased loved ones—wearing their clothes, adopting their mannerisms, etc.—in order to help them adjust to their loss.
films.short_synopsis_html: The Alps is a secret society including a nurse, a gym coach, a gymnast and a paramedic. They offer a unique service: the recently bereaved can hire them to act as surrogates for the deceased loved ones—wearing their clothes, adopting their mannerisms, etc.—in order to help them adjust to their loss.
films.default_editorial: Yorgos Lanthimos followed the Oscar®-nominated success of Dogtooth with this disquieting wonder centered on a group offering counseling services to the recently bereaved. Doubling down on the earlier film’s ritualistic interrogations of role-play, Alps is a mordantly funny, absurdist provocation.

films.short_synopsis: The men work in the foundry day and night. Finally, they get hungry. They eat lunch while watching the Lumière brothers’ film, Workers Leaving the Lumière Factory, in the foundry’s cinema.
films.short_synopsis_html: The men work in the foundry day and night. Finally, they get hungry. They eat lunch while watching the Lumière brothers’ film, Workers Leaving the Lumière Factory, in the foundry’s cinema.
films.default_editorial: Aki Kaurismäki sure knows how to pick a face, stuffing this amuse-bouche with a good half-dozen leathered Finnish mugs. Opening a dialogue with the Lumière brothers’ factory film (one of the first motion pictures ever made), The Foundry may be brief, but it packs quite the meta-cinematic punch.

films.title: Bolero

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Fran has returned to his hometown in the Pyrenees, where his mother, sister, and many ghosts from his past live. Fran tries to immerse himself in the world he left to become a dancer, but nothing goes as planned. So he starts dancing, leading him and the whole village to a joyfully chaotic climax.
films.short_synopsis_html: Fran has returned to his hometown in the Pyrenees, where his mother, sister, and many ghosts from his past live. Fran tries to immerse himself in the world he left to become a dancer, but nothing goes as planned. So he starts dancing, leading him and the whole village to a joyfully chaotic climax.
films.default_editorial: Under the spell of dance, a drab public toilet transforms into an altar of ecstatic, revolutionary desire in Nans Laborde-Jourdà’s kinetic short, winner of the Queer Palm at Cannes. Using Maurice Ravel’s best-known composition as a call for erotic and personal liberation, Boléro lets the body talk.

films.title: The Pillow Book

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: As a child in Kyoto in the 1970s, Nagiko’s calligrapher father used her body to write a birthday message in paint. Now grown up and living in Hong Kong, she seeks a lover who will use her body as a blank canvas. English translator Jerome reverses roles and becomes the subject of her penmanship.
films.short_synopsis_html: As a child in Kyoto in the 1970s, Nagiko’s calligrapher father used her body to write a birthday message in paint. films.default_editorial: Adorning the screen with words as well as images, Peter Greenaway expands our conception of narrative cinema in this mysterious tale—one of his most sensual films. Gossamer textures evocative of paper and skin layer across this sexy study of artistic expression, starring a young Ewan McGregor!

films.title: Night Moves

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Three radical environmental activists work together to execute the most intense protest of their lives: to blow up an Oregon hydroelectric dam—the very source and symbol of the resource-devouring industrial culture they despise. But their act of eco-terror plunges them into a moral maelstrom.
films.short_synopsis_html: Three radical environmental activists work together to execute the most intense protest of their lives: to blow up an Oregon hydroelectric dam—the very source and symbol of the resource-devouring industrial culture they despise. But their act of eco-terror plunges them into a moral maelstrom.
films.default_editorial: An eco-thriller made by delicate and observant director Kelly Reichardt may have been a too unusual mix of genre and sensibility upon the film’s release. In retrospect, this haunting character study forgoes genre twists for simmering tension—emboldened by its astonishing cast led by Jesse Eisenberg.

films.title: Century of Birthing

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: An artist struggles to finish his work. A storyline about a cult plays in his head: Fundamentalism will destroy the world. The artist’s muse is endangered by his process. Will he redeem her, in the end?
films.short_synopsis_html: An artist struggles to finish his work. A storyline about a cult plays in his head: Fundamentalism will destroy the world. The artist’s muse is endangered by his process. Will he redeem her, in the end?
films.default_editorial: Like some of the best 19th-century novelists, Lav Diaz is a genius at interweaving multiple stories to create a truly expanded canvas of characters, landscapes and social and political struggle. In this masterpiece, three strands oppose each other and then, in an impressive arc, fall into parallel.

films.short_synopsis: The odyssey of one man from his village to the city and back; more, it’s his journey from a state of absolute innocence to knowledge, disillusionment, guilt.

films.title: Crippled Avengers

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: After the death of his wife, warlord Tin-tao turns evil and fearsomely reigns over a town with the help of his sadistic son. Four victims of Tin-tao’s rage—all physically disabled by his punishments—seek the help of a wise kung fu master as they train to eliminate the tyrant for good.
films.short_synopsis_html: After the death of his wife, warlord Tin-tao turns evil and fearsomely reigns over a town with the help of his sadistic son. Four victims of Tin-tao’s rage—all physically disabled by his punishments—seek the help of a wise kung fu master as they train to eliminate the tyrant for good.
films.default_editorial: Disabled heroes are a time-honored wuxia tradition, attesting to the power of kung fu dedication in overcoming physical adversity. Reuniting most of the Venom Mob, Chang Cheh stages some of his greatest dust-ups, while the gang weaponise their respective infirmities for a barnstorming battle royale.

films.title: The Marshal's Two Executions

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Two different views of the execution of Romanian wartime dictator Ion Antonescu confront one another. On one side is silent footage recorded in 1946 by cameraman Ovidiu Gologan, and on the other side are scenes from a biographical film shot five decades later by director Sergiu Nicolaescu.
films.short_synopsis_html: Two different views of the execution of Romanian wartime dictator Ion Antonescu confront one another. On one side is silent footage recorded in 1946 by cameraman Ovidiu Gologan, and on the other side are scenes from a biographical film shot five decades later by director Sergiu Nicolaescu.
films.default_editorial: The pendulum of ideology keeps on swinging in Radu Jude’s short, inspired by Sergei Eisenstein’s dialectical montage. Interweaving first-hand footage with a fictional retelling of a famous execution, this visual séance of Romania’s past tackles cinema’s complicity in obscuring historical truths.

films.title: Wittgenstein

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: The life story of Ludwig Wittgenstein, one of the greatest philosophers of his time, is revealed in a series of sketches. A child prodigy who became a professor at Cambridge, Wittgenstein spent his life distancing himself from his privileged upbringing while coming to terms with his homosexuality.
films.short_synopsis_html: The life story of Ludwig Wittgenstein, one of the greatest philosophers of his time, is revealed in a series of sketches. A child prodigy who became a professor at Cambridge, Wittgenstein spent his life distancing himself from his privileged upbringing while coming to terms with his homosexuality.
films.default_editorial: When Derek Jarman was dared to film a script about a queer philosopher without showing a single buttock, he refrained from ogling sumptuous bottoms but maintained a mischievous outlook. After Wittgenstein’s own aphorisms, cleverness frolics with silliness in this delightfully offbeat biopic.

films.short_synopsis_html: Every summer for the last five years, Živan, a punk rocker and a poet, has organized a punk festival in his native village outside of Belgrade in Serbia.He always lost money on it, but his dreams are focused on changing the way the villagers think.
films.default_editorial: Ognjen Glavonić’s documentary adroitly chronicles its protagonist’s Quixotic pursuit of his dream, an against-the-odds realization of a big ambition. A touching tribute to one man’s beautifully boundless enthusiasm, and a marvellous film.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini takes a close look at the sex life of a Semibalanus balanoides, a barnacle. With a shapeless body stuck to a rock, the male barnacle needs to develop a long, long penis to reach inside a female barnacle.
films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini takes a close look at the sex life of a Semibalanus balanoides, a barnacle. With a shapeless body stuck to a rock, the male barnacle needs to develop a long, long penis to reach inside a female barnacle.
films.default_editorial: Rossellini’s haunting investigation of the porous self in David Lynch’s Blue Velvet finds a peculiar echo in the life cycle of this arthropod, with one creature quite literally dissolving into its mate. The star’s jokingly suggestive performance seems to ask: could this be the height of eroticism?

films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini examines the maternal instincts of the wasp. Wasp mammas provide nourishment to their babies by paralyzing caterpillars and burying them alive with their wasp eggs.
films.default_editorial: Isabella Rossellini’s refrigerator is on the fritz and the food inside is spoiled. What is a mother to do? Dreaming of a different existence, the plucky actor enjoys the sexy slink and villainous venom of one stinging insect, as well as the casual violence it enacts on an inferior, larval wobbler.

films.title: Berberian Sound Studio

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Rome, 1976. A naïve British sound engineer named Gilderoy arrives to work on the post-synchronized soundtrack of an Italian horror film. As the line between film and reality blurs, he has to confront his own demons to stay afloat in an environment ruled by exploitation—both on and off-screen.
films.short_synopsis_html: Rome, 1976. A naïve British sound engineer named Gilderoy arrives to work on the post-synchronized soundtrack of an Italian horror film. As the line between film and reality blurs, he has to confront his own demons to stay afloat in an environment ruled by exploitation—both on and off-screen.
films.default_editorial: British director Peter Strickland has always been fascinated with the cinematic possibilities of sound, and would literalize said obsession with this nightmarish homage to 1970s giallo. Starring Toby Jones as a shy sound engineer, Berberian Sound Studio is a stunningly original, modern cult classic.

films.title: Daddy Longlegs

films.short_synopsis: A swan song to excuses and responsibilities, to fatherhood and self-created experiences, and to what it’s like to be truly torn between being a child and being an adult.

films.short_synopsis: Narrated by Bing Crosby, this Cinerama project screens scenes of landscapes, cities, peoples, and entertainments of the Soviet Union. films.short_synopsis_html: Narrated by Bing Crosby, this Cinerama project screens scenes of landscapes, cities, peoples, and entertainments of the Soviet Union. films.default_editorial: Shot by the leading Soviet filmmakers of the time over an eight-year period, Cinerama’s Russian Adventure is a strange document from a peculiar time in U.S. history. Presenting a peaceful portrait of the Soviet state, the film is a magical phenomenon that makes the best of its wide-screen format.

films.title: Within Our Gates

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Sylvia Landry, a teacher at a school for impoverished black children in the Deep South, takes a fundraising trip to Boston upon learning that the institution is nearly bankrupt. There she meets Dr. Vivian, who travels back south with Sylvia after falling in love with her.
films.short_synopsis_html: Sylvia Landry, a teacher at a school for impoverished black children in the Deep South, takes a fundraising trip to Boston upon learning that the institution is nearly bankrupt. There she meets Dr. Vivian, who travels back south with Sylvia after falling in love with her.
films.default_editorial: One of the earliest surviving works of African-American filmmaking, Oscar Micheaux’s remarkable drama offers a vivid tapestry of the intricacies of the Black experience. A pioneering independent director, Micheaux’s mesmerizing vision acts as a gut-punching indictment of systemic racism in America.

films.title: Un Film Dramatique

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: For four years Éric Baudelaire regularly met with students from the film group at Dora Maar middle school in Saint-Denis. Time for them to grow together, time to find the form of a film in which they would be the true subjects: its characters, its authors and its promise.
films.short_synopsis_html: For four years Éric Baudelaire regularly met with students from the film group at Dora Maar middle school in Saint-Denis. Time for them to grow together, time to find the form of a film in which they would be the true subjects: its characters, its authors and its promise.
films.default_editorial: In a beautiful act of collective creation, Eric Baudelaire shares the director’s chair with twenty schoolchildren in Un film dramatique. The result? A kaleidoscope of spontaneous self-representation, an ode to both subjectivity and collaboration movingly exploring the possibilities of cinema.

films.title: Prospero's Books

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Prospero is a magician who gets to keep only a small fragment of his enormous library when he is exiled with his daughter to an enchanted island. As Prospero describes the books he loves, visions begin to unfold. However, problems arise when Prospero’s daughter falls in love with the wrong man.
films.short_synopsis_html: Prospero is a magician who gets to keep only a small fragment of his enormous library when he is exiled with his daughter to an enchanted island. As Prospero describes the books he loves, visions begin to unfold. However, problems arise when Prospero’s daughter falls in love with the wrong man.
films.default_editorial: Spurred on by star John Gielgud and brought to life by Peter Greenaway, this is Shakespeare’s The Tempest interpreted as pure avant-garde cinema: an intense, opulent mash-up of different art forms and formal techniques shot through with baroque textures and vibrant colors. Greenaway, take a bow.

films.title: Green Porno: Dragonfly

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Seeing through the multidimensional eyes of the dragonfly, Isabella Rossellini examines the insect’s disturbing mating habits. Spotting his female mate, the male dragonfly readies to grab her by the neck.
films.short_synopsis_html: Seeing through the multidimensional eyes of the dragonfly, Isabella Rossellini examines the insect’s disturbing mating habits. Spotting his female mate, the male dragonfly readies to grab her by the neck.
films.default_editorial: In anatomising the dragonfly, Isabella Rossellini’s description of its slender body and delicate wings suggests a gentlemanly elegance. But looks can be deceiving. A creature of aggressive carnal appetites, its coercive mating rituals are echoed in the star’s forceful, percussive vocal performance.

films.title: Green Porno: Firefly

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Isabella Rossellini uncovers the nocturnal mating habits of the firefly. With its backside illuminated, the firefly takes flight for a treacherous evening of courtship.
films.short_synopsis_html: Isabella Rossellini uncovers the nocturnal mating habits of the firefly. With its backside illuminated, the firefly takes flight for a treacherous evening of courtship.
films.default_editorial: There’s a sense of urgency to this episode of Green Porno, as Rossellini whizzes through the perils of firefly foreplay in just 45 seconds. Danger lurks around every corner for the luminescent lampyridae, with little indication whether a distant flash pattern is emanating from friend or foe.

films.title: Skate Story: Shortplay Depth I

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In the underworld, demons do not sleep. The moon keeps them awake. Most avoid the harsh moonlight and catch what little rest they can. One demon decides to skate through the underworld to reach the moon. This demon will eat the moon and free itself.
films.short_synopsis_html: In the underworld, demons do not sleep. The moon keeps them awake. Most avoid the harsh moonlight and catch what little rest they can. One demon decides to skate through the underworld to reach the moon. This demon will eat the moon and free itself.
films.default_editorial: Electrified by a celestial score, aesthetic innovation glints against chasmic darkness in Sam Eng’s ambitious Skate Story. In a dazzling demo of the game’s first chapter, the player’s lunar-level determination coruscates in an astral quest to surpass limitations and deal damage to supernal power.

films.title: Shirin

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A film adaptation of “Khosrow and Shirin”, a 12th-century Persian tale, is shown to an audience of more than 110 celebrated actresses, all Iranian except for one from France. Though the film is invisible, the faces of the women watching the show tell the story as they gaze upon the heroine.
films.short_synopsis_html: A film adaptation of “Khosrow and Shirin”, a 12th-century Persian tale, is shown to an audience of more than 110 celebrated actresses, all Iranian except for one from France. Though the film is invisible, the faces of the women watching the show tell the story as they gaze upon the heroine.
films.default_editorial: The final film in Kiarostami’s experimental video phase, Shirin is the story of Iran’s social oppression of women told purely through powerful reaction shots of famous actors as they watch an unseen performance. Includes Juliette Binoche, who would later star in Kiarostami’s Certified Copy.

films.title: Simone Barbes or Virtue

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Simone, a leather-clad porn theater worker, spends her shifts bantering with her coworker and observing eccentric customers in the cinema’s lobby. Tonight, she clocks out and heads off to meet her girlfriend, a waitress at a lesbian club. Later, she’ll encounter a lonely man on the prowl.
films.short_synopsis_html: Simone, a leather-clad porn theater worker, spends her shifts bantering with her coworker and observing eccentric customers in the cinema’s lobby. Tonight, she clocks out and heads off to meet her girlfriend, a waitress at a lesbian club. Later, she’ll encounter a lonely man on the prowl.
films.default_editorial: In this mercurial queer film, both gritty and sumptuous, the nighttime is the right time to explore the porous borders of social convention. In underground spaces, from the lesbian nightclub to the porn theater, lovers and strangers live out their apparent contradictions under cover of darkness.

films.title: All For a Rose

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: It’s Elena’s first day working in a bar in a northern Italian town. She meets many different people, all of whom have a different story to tell, either in words but also through simple gestures and actions.
films.short_synopsis_html: It’s Elena’s first day working in a bar in a northern Italian town. She meets many different people, all of whom have a different story to tell, either in words but also through simple gestures and actions.
films.default_editorial: A coveted present for some and a reminder of regrets for others, the lovely red rose is rich with meaning in Marco Bellocchio’s multi-generational portrait of Bobbio, Italy. Contrasting the idealism of youth with mid-life discontent, this magnetic short crafts a sweet bouquet of human experiences.

films.title: Perceval

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Filled with wonder at the sight of shining armor of a group of knights he has mistaken for angels, naive Perceval immediately solves the mystery of his destiny: he will become one of King Arthur’s knights. Valiant astride his horse, he rides from one ordeal to another, obsessed with a dream.
films.short_synopsis_html: Filled with wonder at the sight of shining armor of a group of knights he has mistaken for angels, naive Perceval immediately solves the mystery of his destiny: he will become one of King Arthur’s knights. Valiant astride his horse, he rides from one ordeal to another, obsessed with a dream.
films.default_editorial: In many ways a departure for Rohmer, Perceval is a colorful, period-drama retelling of Chrétien de Troyes’s 12th-century Arthurian romance. The stylized splendor of the sets; strange, mythic cadences of speech; and flourishes of dry, Rohmerian humor vividly transpose the Medieval to the present day.

films.title: The Wandering Soap Opera

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In an alternate Chile, reality does not exist but rather is an ensemble of soap operas. A series of telenovela episodes sees actors—self-aware stars playing archetypal soap figures, including adulterers, femme fatales, and more—in increasingly absurd and fantastical situations.
films.short_synopsis_html: In an alternate Chile, reality does not exist but rather is an ensemble of soap operas. A series of telenovela episodes sees actors—self-aware stars playing archetypal soap figures, including adulterers, femme fatales, and more—in increasingly absurd and fantastical situations.
films.default_editorial: Despite dying in 2011, Raúl Ruiz continues to make cinematic mischief. This comic and surreal pastiche of telenovelas was made during a fertile workshop Ruiz ran in 1990. Finished and restored by his wife and editor, Valeria Sarmiento, TV melodrama collides Ruiz’s fabulism and the era of Twin Peaks.

films.title: The Miu Miu Affaire

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: A small town in Argentina, Trenque Lauquen, invites an Italian fashion house to show its latest collection. After an elaborate welcome ceremony and an initial photo shoot, the fashion house’s model vanishes, and a team of local police and consultants, including a clairvoyant, investigates.
films.short_synopsis_html: A small town in Argentina, Trenque Lauquen, invites an Italian fashion house to show its latest collection. After an elaborate welcome ceremony and an initial photo shoot, the fashion house’s model vanishes, and a team of local police and consultants, including a clairvoyant, investigates.
films.default_editorial: Director Laura Citarella returns to the eerie setting of her offbeat mystery Trenque Lauquen for this playful, sartorially inclined short. Strange dialogue, absurdist situations, and eccentric characters abound as common sense meets unexplained phenomena—and tantalizing fashion garments.

films.title: Lemon Tree

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: At a Halloween carnival, a young father steals a magician’s rabbit to impress his ten-year-old son. The thrill of the petty theft quickly dissolves when the young boy is tasked with getting himself, his father, and his new pet home safe.
films.short_synopsis_html: At a Halloween carnival, a young father steals a magician’s rabbit to impress his ten-year-old son. The thrill of the petty theft quickly dissolves when the young boy is tasked with getting himself, his father, and his new pet home safe.
films.default_editorial: All the irresistible charms of Americana sparkle in this bold debut from New York filmmaker Rachel Walden. Navigating luck, risk, and small scares on a whiplash of a road trip, a man and his curious child bond in a film propelled by beautifully grungy 16mm imagery and immersively frenetic editing.

films.title: Patti Smith: Dream of Life

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Capturing both Patti Smith’s charged live performances and her informal interactions with friends and collaborators including Philip Glass, this documentary is also a touching tale of survival, detailing as it does the artist’s recovery from the unexpected deaths of her husband and her brother.
films.short_synopsis_html: Capturing both Patti Smith’s charged live performances and her informal interactions with friends and collaborators including Philip Glass, this documentary is also a touching tale of survival, detailing as it does the artist’s recovery from the unexpected deaths of her husband and her brother.
films.default_editorial: This all-encompassing, award-winning documentary gives us a chance to discover the music icon Patti Smith behind closed doors. A very special portrait of a very special artist, this appropriately unconventional film was shot over 11 years and offers a vivid, often off-the-cuff insight into a legend.

films.title: Life Is Not a Competition, But I'm Winning
films.original_title: Life Is Not a Competition, But I'm Winning
films.title_upcase: LIFE IS NOT A COMPETITION, BUT I'M WINNING

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: If history is written by the victors, where does that leave those who were never allowed to be part of the game? A collective of queer athletes enters the Olympic Stadium in Athens and sets out to honour those who were excluded from standing on the winners’ podium.
films.short_synopsis_html: If history is written by the victors, where does that leave those who were never allowed to be part of the game? A collective of queer athletes enters the Olympic Stadium in Athens and sets out to honour those who were excluded from standing on the winners’ podium.
films.default_editorial: With the Olympics underway, this hybrid documentary from filmmaker Julia Fuhr Mann takes aim at the rigid gender boundaries of competitive sports. Weaving a dynamic tapestry of archival footage and personal testimony, Life Is Not a Competition is a rallying cri de coeur for inclusivity and progress.
films.default_editorial_html: With the Olympics underway, this hybrid documentary from filmmaker Julia Fuhr Mann takes aim at the rigid gender boundaries of competitive sports. Weaving a dynamic tapestry of archival footage and personal testimony, Life Is Not a Competition is a rallying cri de coeur for inclusivity and progress.

films.title: Queens of the Qing Dynasty

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Star, a suicidal teen now too old for foster care, develops a candid rapport with An, a student from Shanghai assigned to watch over her in the hospital. A nightly exchange of secrets, text messages and possessions quickly expands the boundaries of their relationship, altering their inner chemistry.
films.short_synopsis_html: Star, a suicidal teen now too old for foster care, develops a candid rapport with An, a student from Shanghai assigned to watch over her in the hospital. A nightly exchange of secrets, text messages and possessions quickly expands the boundaries of their relationship, altering their inner chemistry.
films.default_editorial: Countering the iciness of the Canadian healthcare system with love, Ashley McKenzie’s offbeat tale of friendship embraces the turmoil—and the beauty—of neurodiversity and gender nonconformity. Along with the magnetic performers, the ethereal score crafts a potent alchemy of emotions and sensations.

films.title: James White

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: James White is a troubled twenty something trying to stay afloat in a frenzied New York City. As he retreats further into a hedonistic lifestyle, his mother’s battle with a serious illness faces a series of setbacks that force him to assume more responsibility.
films.short_synopsis_html: James White is a troubled twenty something trying to stay afloat in a frenzied New York City. As he retreats further into a hedonistic lifestyle, his mother’s battle with a serious illness faces a series of setbacks that force him to assume more responsibility.
films.default_editorial: In one of the most impressive of recent NYC indies—and a debut, no less—Josh Mond delicately constructs a low-key, character-driven drama exploring the bond between a mother & son, the former’s illness and the latter’s self-destruction. A hard-hitting, moving, and superbly acted first feature.

films.title: Thursday Till Sunday

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Teenage girl Lucía and her family embark on a four-day road trip to the beaches of northern Chile. However, this will be their last holiday as a family. Their car journey that starts cheerfully gradually becomes melancholic as Lucía realizes that her parents might be splitting up.
films.short_synopsis_html: Teenage girl Lucía and her family embark on a four-day road trip to the beaches of northern Chile. However, this will be their last holiday as a family. films.default_editorial: What does adulthood look like to children? In her first film, Dominga Sotomayor plays games with perspective while delivering a sharp and sensitive coming-of-age tale, as a family road trip becomes Scenes From a Marriage, viewed from the back seat. Winner of the prestigious Tiger Award at Rotterdam.

films.title: Letters to Max

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A record of the epistolary encounter between French artist and filmmaker Eric Baudelaire and Maxim Gvinjia, former Foreign Minister of the breakaway Caucasian state of Abkhazia, Letters to Max is both a chronicle of a developing friendship and an ingenious and unusual essay film.
films.short_synopsis_html: A record of the epistolary encounter between French artist and filmmaker Eric Baudelaire and Maxim Gvinjia, former Foreign Minister of the breakaway Caucasian state of Abkhazia, Letters to Max is both a chronicle of a developing friendship and an ingenious and unusual essay film.
films.default_editorial: Eric Baudelaire’s rich and speculative essay film is a moving meditation on nationhood, which also traces the emergence of an unlikely friendship. With echoes of Chris Marker’s Letter from Siberia, this 2014 festival hit explores the unexplorable through a chain of correspondence.

films.title: Queen of Earth

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Catherine absconds to the sun-soaked serenity of her best friend Virginia’s lakeside cabin, quivering with anxiety and seeking refuge from the haunting memories of the past year. But as their painful pasts come slithering into the already-uncomfortable present, their nerves become intertwined.
films.short_synopsis_html: Catherine absconds to the sun-soaked serenity of her best friend Virginia’s lakeside cabin, quivering with anxiety and seeking refuge from the haunting memories of the past year. But as their painful pasts come slithering into the already-uncomfortable present, their nerves become intertwined.
films.default_editorial: Calling upon the tradition of the psychological chamber thriller, Queen of Earth unites an astonishing Elisabeth Moss with Katherine Waterston to burrow deep into the complicated identities of two disaffected women. A fiery exploration of the iron grip emotions—both interior and exterior—have on us.

films.title: In the Name of Christ

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In a small village in West Africa, a pig-herd decides to save his people after nearly drowning, presenting himself as the cousin of Christ. Somewhat crazy and a bit of a thief, he rules as master and pushes his convictions to the limit, going as far as having himself crucified like Christ.
films.short_synopsis_html: In a small village in West Africa, a pig-herd decides to save his people after nearly drowning, presenting himself as the cousin of Christ. Somewhat crazy and a bit of a thief, he rules as master and pushes his convictions to the limit, going as far as having himself crucified like Christ.
films.default_editorial: A classic of African cinema, Ivory Coast filmmaker Roger Gnoan M’Bala came to international attention for this enticing, subversive social satire. Scathing in its comedy, In the Name of Christ takes aim at the theatre and—even more ambitiously—the colonial enterprise of religion in West Africa.

films.title: Casa Roshell

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Club Roshell is a space in Mexico founded by the trans activist Roshell Terranova. A small, intimate room with a stage sets the scene for performances, workshops, and lip-syncs. For its members, Casa Roshell is somewhere where they can assume an alternative gender role and explore their identity.
films.short_synopsis_html: Club Roshell is a space in Mexico founded by the trans activist Roshell Terranova. A small, intimate room with a stage sets the scene for performances, workshops, and lip-syncs. For its members, Casa Roshell is somewhere where they can assume an alternative gender role and explore their identity.
films.default_editorial: Casa Roshell, a vital trans-led club in Mexico City, tears up the gender rulebook with vivacious aplomb. Echoing the liberating atmosphere of the idiosyncratic venue, Camila José Donoso’s roving camera allows people to be who they want to be. A dreamy celebration of identity, an oasis of freedom.

films.title: Light Years

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Manuel Abramovich offers an intimate look at Lucrecia Martel during the making of her fourth feature, Zama. This film depicts the mysterious, delirious, playful, and frustrating stages of filmmaking, while showcasing Martel’s transcendental tendencies and complex collaboration with her subject.
films.short_synopsis_html: Manuel Abramovich offers an intimate look at Lucrecia Martel during the making of her fourth feature, Zama. This film depicts the mysterious, delirious, playful, and frustrating stages of filmmaking, while showcasing Martel’s transcendental tendencies and complex collaboration with her subject.
films.default_editorial: In a careful dance with its hesitant subject, this revelatory documentary takes us behind the scenes of Zama, where Lucrecia Martel dotes on llamas and horses and directs her men. Making an anti-epic about a mediocre officer, she emerges as his mirror image: a woman of good humor, above all else.

films.title: Le Moulin
films.original_title: Ri yao ri shih san pu zhe

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Poetry, literature, painting and old film clips converge in this lyrical, unusually designed film essay about Le Moulin, the Taiwanese poets’ collective which protested in the 1930s against the cultural superiority of the Japanese occupier and the domination of realism in poetry.
films.short_synopsis_html: Poetry, literature, painting and old film clips converge in this lyrical, unusually designed film essay about Le Moulin, the Taiwanese poets’ collective which protested in the 1930s against the cultural superiority of the Japanese occupier and the domination of realism in poetry.
films.default_editorial: With remarkable variety of form and a graceful touch, this expansive yet tremendously sensitive debut by Huang Ya-li is an epic and detailed immersion into a remarkable group of writers in Taiwan. Spanning three decades of political turmoil and war, we movingly watch their struggle to create art.
films.default_editorial_html: With remarkable variety of form and a graceful touch, this expansive yet tremendously sensitive debut by Huang Ya-li is an epic and detailed immersion into a remarkable group of writers in Taiwan. Spanning three decades of political turmoil and war, we movingly watch their struggle to create art.

films.title: Too Late for Tears

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Through a fluke circumstance a ruthless woman stumbles across a suitcase filled with $60,000, and she is determined to hold onto it even it if means murder.

films.default_editorial: A slick and nasty take on the classic noir theme of an ordinary couple dragged into crime and perversion, Too Late For Tears hums with heat and passion. Byron Haskin’s film features femme fatale extraordinaire Lizabeth Scott and the noir stalwart Dan Duryea (Scarlet Street).

films.title: Werewolf

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Blaise and Nessa are outcast methadone users in their small town. Each day they push a rusty lawnmower door-to-door begging to cut grass. Nessa plots an escape, while Blaise lingers closer to collapse. Tethered to one another, their getaway dreams are kept on a suffocatingly short leash.
films.short_synopsis_html: Blaise and Nessa are outcast methadone users in their small town. Each day they push a rusty lawnmower door-to-door begging to cut grass. films.default_editorial: Although her debut feature’s title might suggest a horror movie, Ashley McKenzie’s approach to the tricky subjects of addiction and codependency is no lurid spectacle. Subtly conveying character nuances through textured close-ups, this stylistically bold drama is rich in empathy and atmosphere.

films.title: Fragment 53

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Comprising interviews with seven different men of varying rank about atrocities they committed (or ordered) during the Liberian Civil War, this frank and frequently disturbing documentary examines the nature of modern violence and an essentialist concept of warfare.
films.short_synopsis_html: Comprising interviews with seven different men of varying rank about atrocities they committed (or ordered) during the Liberian Civil War, this frank and frequently disturbing documentary examines the nature of modern violence and an essentialist concept of warfare.
films.default_editorial: Reminiscent of Joshua Oppenheimer’s The Look of Silence, this celebrated first-person documentary film crucially visualizes essential questions about the human capacity for war. A dark, enthralling investigation into the living history of Liberia’s bloody internal conflict.

films.title: Potiche

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Suzanne is the elegant housewife of the industrialist and iron fist Pujol. When his workers go on strike, she steps in to manage the factory and proves to be competent. However, her new role throws her back in touch with union leader Babin, a romantic fling from the past that still has sparks.
films.short_synopsis_html: Suzanne is the elegant housewife of the industrialist and iron fist Pujol. When his workers go on strike, she steps in to manage the factory and proves to be competent. However, her new role throws her back in touch with union leader Babin, a romantic fling from the past that still has sparks.
films.default_editorial: François Ozon dives into delightful satire with this pastiche of 70s bourgeois chauvinism which evolves into a burlesque comedy of female empowerment! With Catherine Deneuve and Gérard Depardieu playing attracted opposites, Potiche indulges in a hilarious camp portrait of class conflict mayhem.

films.title: You Are Here

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A fantasy about a reclusive woman who searches for meaning in the mysterious documents that keep appearing to her, turning her home into an archive. As realities collapse and intersect around here, she must make a final choice: is she a free agent, or just a tool of the archive?
films.short_synopsis_html: A fantasy about a reclusive woman who searches for meaning in the mysterious documents that keep appearing to her, turning her home into an archive. As realities collapse and intersect around here, she must make a final choice: is she a free agent, or just a tool of the archive?
films.default_editorial: Daniel Cockburn’s auspicious debut is one of the smartest and most ambitious of the decade, marking the Canadian video artist as a true emerging talent in cinema. A dazzlingly puzzling exploration of detection and consciousness, its clever approach has drawn comparisons to Borges and Inception.

films.title: Daydreaming So Vividly About Our Spanish Holidays

content_rating.label: caution

films.short_synopsis: Driven by their desire for light and warmth, sun-starved British teenagers take a trip to the Balearic Islands. They must absorb the sun and store it in their bodies to take it back to their cloud-covered kingdom.
films.short_synopsis_html: Driven by their desire for light and warmth, sun-starved British teenagers take a trip to the Balearic Islands. They must absorb the sun and store it in their bodies to take it back to their cloud-covered kingdom.
films.default_editorial: How to Have Sex is one version of teens on tour: Christian Aviles’s ambitious short about Britons’ devotion to the sun is another. With affectionate humor, the newcomer spins a speculative mythology out of that phenomenon on luminous 16mm stock, and makes the world sparkle in this miniature satire.

films.title: Models

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Vivian, Lisa, Tanja. Three models, three girlfriends, three rivals. Constantly searching to advance their careers, find the right man, and achieve the ideal body, the three girls move from one casting call to another, wait in vain for bookings, and spend their nights going from disco to disco.
films.short_synopsis_html: Vivian, Lisa, Tanja. Three models, three girlfriends, three rivals. Constantly searching to advance their careers, find the right man, and achieve the ideal body, the three girls move from one casting call to another, wait in vain for bookings, and spend their nights going from disco to disco.
films.default_editorial: Fashioned with more grit than glamor, Ulrich Seidl’s provocative portrait of aspiring models in 1990s Vienna rips apart the glossy magazines spreads to reveal a hollow core. Taking the perspective of a mirror, the camera stands witness to an image-obsessed industry festering with predatory men.

films.title: Don't Expect Too Much

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Nicholas Ray’s widow, Susan, examines her late husband’s stormy romance with Hollywood, his self-imposed exile in Europe, and his eventual return to America where he began work on the wildly experimental magnum opus, We Can’t Go Home Again, that would become his final cinematic testament.
films.short_synopsis_html: Nicholas Ray’s widow, Susan, examines her late husband’s stormy romance with Hollywood, his self-imposed exile in Europe, and his eventual return to America where he began work on the wildly experimental magnum opus, We Can’t Go Home Again, that would become his final cinematic testament.
films.default_editorial: A personal, intimate documentary from Susan Ray, Don’t Expect Too Much tells the inside story on one of Hollywood’s greatest and most iconic directors: the inimitable auteur Nicholas Ray. Full of juicy revelations, it also features a roster of talking heads including Jim Jarmusch and Victor Erice!

films.title: Phases of Matter

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Doctors, workers, and inanimate residents of Istanbul’s state-run Cerrahpasa Hospital form a parallel world of their own. As the camera passes through the hospital’s darkened corridors, it moves from the operating room to the morgue, between life and other states, the real and the virtual.
films.short_synopsis_html: Doctors, workers, and inanimate residents of Istanbul’s state-run Cerrahpasa Hospital form a parallel world of their own. As the camera passes through the hospital’s darkened corridors, it moves from the operating room to the morgue, between life and other states, the real and the virtual.
films.default_editorial: Deniz Tortum’s acclaimed experimental feature is an uncanny record of a hospital’s daily life, with unmatched insight into the workings of the healthcare system. This evocative documentary is reminiscent of both the essayistic style of Frederick Wiseman and the morbid universe of Lars von Trier.

films.title: Rocky VI

films.short_synopsis: Touching down in Helsinki, the all-star American boxer Rocky defends the Free World by fighting against a gigantic opponent from Siberia named Igor. Will Rocky finally meet his match?
films.short_synopsis_html: Touching down in Helsinki, the all-star American boxer Rocky defends the Free World by fighting against a gigantic opponent from Siberia named Igor. Will Rocky finally meet his match?
films.default_editorial: Liberally reinterpreting Sly Stallone’s inspiring underdog story, Aki Kaurismäki takes his typical deadpan humour to a whole other level with this exuberant 80s short-film satire. Relentless glam-rock guitar riffs soundtrack this pain-and-gain parody—outrageous, outlandish, and a little bit sad!

films.title: The Great Wall

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: The Great Wall moves across fortified landscapes, pausing with those whose lives are framed by borders. Moving inward toward the seat of power, the film holds the European project up to a dazzling light, refracted through Kafka’s mysterious text; ultimately questioning the nature of power.
films.short_synopsis_html: The Great Wall moves across fortified landscapes, pausing with those whose lives are framed by borders. Moving inward toward the seat of power, the film holds the European project up to a dazzling light, refracted through Kafka’s mysterious text; ultimately questioning the nature of power.
films.default_editorial: Moving between both sides of southern Europe’s political border, this riveting documentary audaciously looks the migration crisis in the eye. An indictment of the powerful and the walls they erect, the film surfaces the resonance of Kafka’s universe and its timelessness in the current moment.
