films.title: Ga-ga: Glory to the Heroes

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Scope, a prisoner on a behemoth space station, is chosen to ‘volunteer’ to explore far-away planets. Landing on planet Australia-458, Scope finds that his freedom comes with a high price—his violent demise will be broadcast live for the viewing pleasure of Australia-458’s inhabitants.
films.short_synopsis_html: Scope, a prisoner on a behemoth space station, is chosen to ‘volunteer’ to explore far-away planets. Landing on planet Australia-458, Scope finds that his freedom comes with a high price—his violent demise will be broadcast live for the viewing pleasure of Australia-458’s inhabitants.
films.default_editorial: Taking inspiration from Pasolini’s La Ricotta, Piotr Szulkin closes his “Apocalyptic Tetralogy” with an anarchic riff on the Passion of Christ. The funniest of the four films, Ga-Ga: Glory to the Heroes is a rich sci-fi allegory that puts the European colonial project in its satirical crosshairs.

films.title: Something, Anything

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In the wake of a life-altering tragedy, Peggy, a seemingly typical Southern newlywed, confronts a profound spiritual crisis and sets out on a quest to discover a higher purpose. Without knowing what she seeks, Peggy jeopardizes her marriage, career, and friendships to find fulfilment.
films.short_synopsis_html: In the wake of a life-altering tragedy, Peggy, a seemingly typical Southern newlywed, confronts a profound spiritual crisis and sets out on a quest to discover a higher purpose. Without knowing what she seeks, Peggy jeopardizes her marriage, career, and friendships to find fulfilment.
films.default_editorial: A terrific Tennessee drama of a spiritual awakening in times of crisis, Something, Anything is Paul Harrill’s understated yet empowering entry into feature filmmaking. An independent with a heart, this is a film about the promises of transformation: when everything you wanted suddenly falls apart.

films.title: Signal 8

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: They said a storm is coming this way but we’re still waiting. Lives carry on in Hong Kong as traces of civic upkeep morph into sites of remembrance. Decorative structures mimic nature then occasionally malfunction—transforming common spectacle to warning signs.
films.short_synopsis_html: They said a storm is coming this way but we’re still waiting. Lives carry on in Hong Kong as traces of civic upkeep morph into sites of remembrance. Decorative structures mimic nature then occasionally malfunction—transforming common spectacle to warning signs.
films.default_editorial: Disconnected from the flow of daily life, Simon Liu’s incursion into the alienation of Hong Kong is an enigmatic symphony of the city’s discordance and fury. Something belies the trance cast by this tapestry of 16mm images—is it unrest or is it complacency? Or is it already too late?

films.title: The Blue Door

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Antoine returns to his motherland after a very long time to attend his mother’s funeral. His daughter Marie-Ange calls him and asks for a story. He starts telling her a tale he was told as a child…
films.short_synopsis_html: Antoine returns to his motherland after a very long time to attend his mother’s funeral. His daughter Marie-Ange calls him and asks for a story. He starts telling her a tale he was told as a child…
films.default_editorial: The culture and landscape of Corsica act as the backdrop for this short film which balances tender family drama and fantasy storytelling. Through its inventive interweaving of different narrative layers, The Blue Door delicately travels between the present and the past, between reality and fiction.

films.title: Black Sun

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Like the black sun of an eclipse, Antonia is a lyrical singer of exuberant and dark beauty. Recovering from a suicide attempt in a rehabilitation institution, all her family ties are irreparably broken. But her sister remains deeply affected by what happened. May they reunite once again?
films.short_synopsis_html: Like the black sun of an eclipse, Antonia is a lyrical singer of exuberant and dark beauty. Recovering from a suicide attempt in a rehabilitation institution, all her family ties are irreparably broken. But her sister remains deeply affected by what happened. May they reunite once again?
films.default_editorial: The work of Colombian-French artist Laura Huertas Millán moves gently across disciplines, defying categorization. One of her self-termed “ethnographic fictions,” Black Sun is a mysterious and immersive inquiry into despair, family bonds, and the power of female resilience.

films.title: Fruits of Passion

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In 1920s Shanghai, unbridled lust and excessive excess dominate the sexual life of the rich. The noble Sir Stephen trains his submissive, young lover O in a brothel. Caught in a whirlpool of pleasure, O longs for ever harder and more exciting punishment.
films.short_synopsis_html: In 1920s Shanghai, unbridled lust and excessive excess dominate the sexual life of the rich. The noble Sir Stephen trains his submissive, young lover O in a brothel. Caught in a whirlpool of pleasure, O longs for ever harder and more exciting punishment.
films.default_editorial: Japanese avant-garde filmmaker Shūji Terayama is known for his visually striking and highly provocative works, from which Fruits of Passion is one of the most controversial. Presented at the Directors’ Fortnight in 1981, this is a sexually abrasive and disturbingly powerful tale.

films.title: Blood of My Blood

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: During the Inquisition period, Federico witnesses the harrowing trial of Benedetta, an alluring nun accused of seducing and driving his brother to suicide. Centuries later, in the same convent prison, a vampiric old man hides within the convent’s abandoned walls until facing eviction.
films.short_synopsis_html: During the Inquisition period, Federico witnesses the harrowing trial of Benedetta, an alluring nun accused of seducing and driving his brother to suicide. Centuries later, in the same convent prison, a vampiric old man hides within the convent’s abandoned walls until facing eviction.
films.default_editorial: Winner of the FIPRESCI award, this haunting portmanteau from director Marco Bellocchio is a shrewd social commentary steeped in striking gothic imagery. Set in a convent-prison, the film shifts from past to present, crafting a story that is a love letter to Italy’s past and a critique of its stasis.

films.title: Parador Húngaro

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: The story of a friendship spanning generations and boundaries: a Hungarian soldier escapes to the West in the ’50s. The son of a U.S. soldier runs to the East in the ’90s. Their paths cross in Bogotá, Colombia, and they become friends by sharing memories of the same land but of very different times.
films.short_synopsis_html: The story of a friendship spanning generations and boundaries: a Hungarian soldier escapes to the West in the ’50s. The son of a U.S. soldier runs to the East in the ’90s. Their paths cross in Bogotá, Colombia, and they become friends by sharing memories of the same land but of very different times.
films.default_editorial: This traveling documentary relates a friendship across countries and nations that speaks of history, curiosity, and the broad and wildly subjective concept of home. Between Hungary, the United States, and Colombia, an amalgam of various memories form the basis for a touching cinematic dialogue.

films.title: Legendary Weapons of China

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: The Qing court is sending kung fu fighters to combat gun-wielding foreigners, and clan leader Lei Kung is appalled by this senseless slaughter. His dissent puts him on the path of deadly masters who want him silenced. His only chance for survival lies in a secret arsenal of bizarre, deadly weapons.
films.short_synopsis_html: The Qing court is sending kung fu fighters to combat gun-wielding foreigners, and clan leader Lei Kung is appalled by this senseless slaughter. His dissent puts him on the path of deadly masters who want him silenced. His only chance for survival lies in a secret arsenal of bizarre, deadly weapons.
films.default_editorial: You can always rely on Lau Kar-leung to make good on a film title loaded with so much promise. The Shaw Brothers maestro writes, directs, and stars in this gloriously entertaining blend of wuxia and kung fu. Rolled out for the grand finale, those weapons prove as plentiful as they are legendary.

films.title: Emerald Cities

films.short_synopsis: In a near-future 1980s, a small desert town’s Santa Claus goes to the big city in search of his wayward daughter. On that simple premise hangs this delirious punk rock collage of Cold War fears, suburban encroachment, and magic mushroom sandwiches.
films.short_synopsis_html: In a near-future 1980s, a small desert town’s Santa Claus goes to the big city in search of his wayward daughter. On that simple premise hangs this delirious punk rock collage of Cold War fears, suburban encroachment, and magic mushroom sandwiches.
films.default_editorial: A no-budget 80s dystopian film about an existential, drunken mall Santa? Count us in. This ultra-dark American comedy, which predates Repo Man but shares its tone, is infused with end-of-the-world anxieties about total nuclear annihilation and is tuned to the sounds of Flipper and The Mutants.

films.title: Crayons of Askalan

films.short_synopsis: Zuhdi Al Adawi, a Palestinian artist imprisoned in Israel, uses his art as his means of expression and is helped by the rest of the community and his own family to accomplish his artwork.
films.short_synopsis_html: Zuhdi Al Adawi, a Palestinian artist imprisoned in Israel, uses his art as his means of expression and is helped by the rest of the community and his own family to accomplish his artwork.
films.default_editorial: Imprisoned (for 15 years) at the age of 15, Palestinian artist Zuhdi Al Adawi is profiled in this impressive documentary. A bold, creative combination of re-enactment, dramatisation, and the artist’s own crayon drawings that together represent how artistic expression is used as a form of resistance.

films.short_synopsis: Diana’s husband returns home one night with big news: he has taken on a second wife and expects Diana to live in harmony with this new situation. So, Diana does what is least expected—she decides to take her life into her own hands.
films.short_synopsis_html: Diana’s husband returns home one night with big news: he has taken on a second wife and expects Diana to live in harmony with this new situation. So, Diana does what is least expected—she decides to take her life into her own hands.
films.default_editorial: Premiering at the Toronto film festival, Kamila Andini’s heartbreaking short examines the power structures that exist between men and women within marriage, family, and society at large. Melding melodrama with intimate dialogue, Sendiri Diana Sendiri is an astutely rendered Indonesian miniature.

films.short_synopsis: Bai Yide is a young man living alone. He works at a bookstore and derives sexual pleasure by stealing and wearing women’s underwear. One day, he receives a DVD in which his activities have been recorded and he becomes anxious.
films.short_synopsis_html: Bai Yide is a young man living alone. He works at a bookstore and derives sexual pleasure by stealing and wearing women’s underwear. One day, he receives a DVD in which his activities have been recorded and he becomes anxious.
films.default_editorial: Three alluring, disparate characters shape this elliptical story, which faces the many complexities of sexuality amongst alienated youth in contemporary Taiwan. Director Chu Hsien-che’s approach is considerate and acutely stylized in its brave confrontation of challenging subject matter.

films.title: Two Shots Fired

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Mariano, 16, inexplicably and without warning, shoots himself twice and improbably survives. Then, life goes on. His brother pursues a romance with a girl working at a fast-food joint, his mother takes off on a trip with a stranger, and Mariano recruits a woman to join his medieval wind ensemble.
films.short_synopsis_html: Mariano, 16, inexplicably and without warning, shoots himself twice and improbably survives. Then, life goes on. His brother pursues a romance with a girl working at a fast-food joint, his mother takes off on a trip with a stranger, and Mariano recruits a woman to join his medieval wind ensemble.
films.default_editorial: Martín﻿ Rejtman’s comeback 11 years after The Magic Gloves did not disappoint. Taking a suicide attempt as the starting point and surprising us at every turn, the film is a fascinating and subversive exercise in comedy: its sophisticated storytelling, dark humor and deadpan beauty are just genius.

films.title: An Appropriated Self-Portrait

content_rating.label: adult
content_rating.description: Contains very strong sexual and/or violent content.

films.short_synopsis: A filmmaker creates a character from fragments of her favorite international cinema stars and then presents a non-linear story of her own life. As she recycles excerpts from over 180 movies—including Paris, Texas and Buffalo ’66—the filmmaker reflects upon her identity and memory.
films.short_synopsis_html: A filmmaker creates a character from fragments of her favorite international cinema stars and then presents a non-linear story of her own life. As she recycles excerpts from over 180 movies—including Paris, Texas and Buffalo ’66—the filmmaker reflects upon her identity and memory.
films.default_editorial: The simple premise of this unique, female self-portrait—a search for one’s self through faces, dialogue, and images from films—becomes a complex exploration of identity and its construction through others. This work is a mesmerizing, empathetic kaleidoscope of cinematic appropriation.

films.title: Mekong Hotel
films.original_title: แม่โขงโฮเต็ล

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A quiet hotel overlooking the vast Mekong River in northeast Thailand accommodates both living and undead guests. Its patrons hang around together on the veranda, listen to or play guitar, and rehearse for a film about the relationship between a vampire-like woman and her daughter.
films.short_synopsis_html: A quiet hotel overlooking the vast Mekong River in northeast Thailand accommodates both living and undead guests. Its patrons hang around together on the veranda, listen to or play guitar, and rehearse for a film about the relationship between a vampire-like woman and her daughter.
films.default_editorial: Two years after his Palme d’Or win for Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives, Apichatpong Weerasethakul returned with this haunting docu-fiction hybrid. Reposeful in its liminal tranquility, Mekong Hotel is a poignant, folkloric reflection on memory, loss, and spiritual transcendence.

films.title: Papirosen

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Argentine director Gastón Solnicki focuses on four generations of his wildly volatile Jewish family haunted by a war rarely spoken of. Ten years of modern footage is folded into a huge archive of 8mm and VHS home videos, unveiling more than half a century of Solnicki’s singular family history.
films.short_synopsis_html: Argentine director Gastón Solnicki focuses on four generations of his wildly volatile Jewish family haunted by a war rarely spoken of. Ten years of modern footage is folded into a huge archive of 8mm and VHS home videos, unveiling more than half a century of Solnicki’s singular family history.
films.default_editorial: An inquiry into the pervasive memory of World War II and its many effects on Jewish identity,  Papirosen finds the uniquely talented Gastón Solnicki avoiding the usual faults of self-portraits. The result is a graceful consideration of post-war Jewish identity and the collective memory of a family.

The result is a graceful consideration of post-war Jewish identity and the collective memory of a family.

films.title: All These Sleepless Nights

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A new era is coming, and Warsaw stands uncomfortably at its edge. Art school classmates Kris and Michal, on the precipice of their own coming of age, restlessly roam the streets in search of living forever inside the beautiful moment. Floating from party to party, romance and sex hang in the air.
films.short_synopsis_html: A new era is coming, and Warsaw stands uncomfortably at its edge. Art school classmates Kris and Michal, on the precipice of their own coming of age, restlessly roam the streets in search of living forever inside the beautiful moment. Floating from party to party, romance and sex hang in the air.
films.default_editorial: An intimate glimpse into the party scene in Warsaw, Michal Marczak’s Sundance prizewinner boldly blends fiction and documentary. Reminiscent of Terence Malick’s signature style, the Steadicam-based cinematography lends a touching ephemerality to the intense passions and contradictions of youth.

films.title: Granny's Dancing on the Table

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Eini, 13 years old, grows up isolated from society with her violent father, a man afraid of the world. The brutality that Eini is exposed to pushes her to almost lose her sense of self but through her invincible fantasy, she creates a world within, from which she can draw strength to survive.
films.short_synopsis_html: Eini, 13 years old, grows up isolated from society with her violent father, a man afraid of the world. The brutality that Eini is exposed to pushes her to almost lose her sense of self but through her invincible fantasy, she creates a world within, from which she can draw strength to survive.
films.default_editorial: A brutal case of domestic abuse lies at the core of this story of female empowerment, seen through the eyes of a teenager and through chilling, atmospheric imagery. The young girl’s memories and thoughts are represented through animation sequences, all the more haunting by their abstraction.

films.title: The Ghost That Never Returns

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: This existential drama disguised as a saga about the proletarian struggle presents a lonely and insecure individual who is challenged to act more heroically than he is prepared to, but who constantly questions his confidence and loyalties.
films.short_synopsis_html: This existential drama disguised as a saga about the proletarian struggle presents a lonely and insecure individual who is challenged to act more heroically than he is prepared to, but who constantly questions his confidence and loyalties.
films.default_editorial: The late 1920s was when silent cinema began to perfect its art—formally audacious, emotionally rich, ambitious films like Sunrise & 7th Heaven—before sound seemed to roll innovation back. Here, the sublime style of under-known auteur Abram Room showcases Soviet silent cinema at its absolute peak.

films.title: The Bloodiest

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In a futuristic Cameroon, Majolie and Chouchou are sex workers frequented by the political class—a corrupt and sex-obsessed crop of powerful men. When one of their influential clients dies under compromising circumstances, Majolie and Chouchou do all they can to dispose of the body.
films.short_synopsis_html: In a futuristic Cameroon, Majolie and Chouchou are sex workers frequented by the political class—a corrupt and sex-obsessed crop of powerful men. When one of their influential clients dies under compromising circumstances, Majolie and Chouchou do all they can to dispose of the body.
films.default_editorial: In this blazingly feminist masterwork of Afrofuturism, Cameroonian iconoclast Jean-Pierre Bekolo places fearless sex workers at the vanguard of a revolution. Coating its social commentary in stylish genre thrills, The Bloodiest unmasks corrupt politicians as the real vampires hiding in plain sight.

films.title: Rouge
films.original_title: Rouge, le portrait mensonger de Bertrand Bonello

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A famous filmmaker works on his next film, which will focus on monstrosity. He is obsessed by the idea of finding a painting that will be central to the film and will crystallize all the power and beauty of monsters.
films.short_synopsis_html: A famous filmmaker works on his next film, which will focus on monstrosity. He is obsessed by the idea of finding a painting that will be central to the film and will crystallize all the power and beauty of monsters.
films.default_editorial: Wander through Paris’s mesmerizing museums with Bertrand Bonello in this never-before-seen version of Antoine Barraud’s Le dos rouge. There, the French filmmaker roams in search of monstrosity, and shares the screen with some of France’s finest actors, including Jeanne Balibar and Alex Descas.
films.default_editorial_html: Wander through Paris’s mesmerizing museums with Bertrand Bonello in this never-before-seen version of Antoine Barraud’s Le dos rouge. films.title: Manufraktur

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: Using found footage from commercials showing mainly women’s legs and cars, a tangled network of movements is woven, broken out of the found footage, and compiled anew. Discharged from all its semantic burden, what remains is a self-sufficient swarm of splinters, fleeting vectors of lost direction.
films.short_synopsis_html: Using found footage from commercials showing mainly women’s legs and cars, a tangled network of movements is woven, broken out of the found footage, and compiled anew. Discharged from all its semantic burden, what remains is a self-sufficient swarm of splinters, fleeting vectors of lost direction.
films.default_editorial: A playful interrogation of the materiality of celluloid, Peter Tscherkassky’s Manufraktur explores the tension between an image and the film on which it is captured. The avant-garde filmmaker’s architectural fascination stands out from the film’s temporal, sonic, and material manipulations.
films.default_editorial_html: A playful interrogation of the materiality of celluloid, Peter Tscherkassky’s Manufraktur explores the tension between an image and the film on which it is captured. films.title: Taxibol

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Driving around Cuba’s streets, Lav Diaz—the famous Filipino director—and Gustavo Flecha—a talkative Cuban taxi driver—find themselves discussing politics, migration, social conditions, and love. Touching on many personal stories and experiences, the duo creates portraits of their own countries.
films.short_synopsis_html: Driving around Cuba’s streets, Lav Diaz—the famous Filipino director—and Gustavo Flecha—a talkative Cuban taxi driver—find themselves discussing politics, migration, social conditions, and love. Touching on many personal stories and experiences, the duo creates portraits of their own countries.
films.default_editorial: Featuring Lav Diaz at his most candid, Tommaso Santambrogio’s formally inventive film unfolds like a cinematic sleight of hand. What begins as a fly-on-the-wall documentary dreamily shifts into a fictional narrative of guilt and solitude, shot in Ernest Hemingway’s grand former residence in Havana.

films.title: Here

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: After the sudden death of his wife, He Zhiyuan loses the will to speak and is sent to Island Hospital. While He adjusts to life within, he is selected for an experimental treatment, forcing him to confront the devastating truth behind his past, present, and future.
films.short_synopsis_html: After the sudden death of his wife, He Zhiyuan loses the will to speak and is sent to Island Hospital. While He adjusts to life within, he is selected for an experimental treatment, forcing him to confront the devastating truth behind his past, present, and future.
films.default_editorial: Inspired by conceptual art and anti-psychiatry, Ho Tzu Nyen’s debut feature blends a clinical documentary style with an innovative plot of alternative therapies. Selected for Directors’ Fortnight at Cannes in 2009, Here still stuns as an astounding dose of historical reenactment and reckoning.

films.title: The Best of Cinerama

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Comprised of all the greatest thrills of Cinerama, from the breathtaking roller coaster ride to the visit of La Scala for Aida. Made up of over 20 such exciting highlights, the film is not only an historic compilation, but also a stand-alone “thrill-a-minute” experience.
films.short_synopsis_html: Comprised of all the greatest thrills of Cinerama, from the breathtaking roller coaster ride to the visit of La Scala for Aida. Made up of over 20 such exciting highlights, the film is not only an historic compilation, but also a stand-alone “thrill-a-minute” experience.
films.default_editorial: The ancestor of 3D, Cinerama was a way of screening films that utilized three synchronised projectors, each projecting one-third of the picture on a wide, curving screen. This is Cinerama is an eye-opening insight into a specific time when cinema also represented a way to travel and see the world.

This is Cinerama is an eye-opening insight into a specific time when cinema also represented a way to travel and see the world.

films.title: Howl

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: San Francisco, mid ’50s. Poet Allen Ginsberg lives with fellow writers Jack Kerouac and Neal Cassady. He is about to publish Howl, an electrifying poem which will make him a cultural icon and define the soon-to-be Beat Generation. But soon after its release, Ginsberg is put on trial for obscenity.
films.short_synopsis_html: San Francisco, mid ’50s. Poet Allen Ginsberg lives with fellow writers Jack Kerouac and Neal Cassady. He is about to publish Howl, an electrifying poem which will make him a cultural icon and define the soon-to-be Beat Generation. But soon after its release, Ginsberg is put on trial for obscenity.
films.default_editorial: Poetic revolutions and societal transgressions course throughout this hybrid biopic of the iconic Allen Ginsberg. Mixing courtroom drama, found footage, and swirling animation, LGBTQ+ duo Rob Epstein and Jeffrey Friedman channel a jazzy, Beatnik energy into an exhilarating homage to the epic Howl.

films.title: Mr. Kaplan

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: After fleeing Europe for Uruguay during WWII, Jacob Kaplan built a quiet life. Now 76, he begins to question his worth. After learning of a mysterious German prowling the shores of a nearby beach, he becomes convinced that he’s found a Nazi in hiding and plans to expose him.
films.short_synopsis_html: After fleeing Europe for Uruguay during WWII, Jacob Kaplan built a quiet life. Now 76, he begins to question his worth. After learning of a mysterious German prowling the shores of a nearby beach, he becomes convinced that he’s found a Nazi in hiding and plans to expose him.
films.default_editorial: A kidnapping plot goes from bad to worse in this riotous caper from Uruguay’s Álvaro Brechner: a fun-loving, crowd-pleasing black comedy. Balancing the serious with slapstick, this two-hander is nonetheless brought to life by a large ensemble of quirky characters and curmudgeons.

films.title: Coma

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Amidst a period of unprecedented world events, an eighteen-year-old girl’s life is placed on hold. Isolated in her bedroom, she falls under the spell of the mysterious vlogger Patricia Coma. As time carries on, the lines between her dreams, fears, hopes, and reality begin to blur into one another.
films.short_synopsis_html: Amidst a period of unprecedented world events, an eighteen-year-old girl’s life is placed on hold. Isolated in her bedroom, she falls under the spell of the mysterious vlogger Patricia Coma. As time carries on, the lines between her dreams, fears, hopes, and reality begin to blur into one another.
films.default_editorial: A punk spirit pervades this endearingly DIY film, which gleefully blends animation, horror, and essay-film tropes into an unpredictable mix. Thrillingly inventive and bursting with hope, Coma addresses with poignancy and frankness the anxieties of a young generation facing an uncertain future.

films.title: Four Unloved Women, Adrift on a Purposeless Sea, Experience the Ecstasy of Dissection
films.original_title: Four Unloved Women, Adrift on a Purposeless Sea, Experience the Ecstasy of Dissection
films.title_upcase: FOUR UNLOVED WOMEN, ADRIFT ON A PURPOSELESS SEA, EXPERIENCE THE ECSTASY OF DISSECTION

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Long live the new flesh. Surgery is the new sex. These Cronenbergian epigrams come together in a tableau that reimagines the ecstasy and eroticism of Renaissance sculpture for the future. Or is it already the present?
films.short_synopsis_html: Long live the new flesh. Surgery is the new sex. These Cronenbergian epigrams come together in a tableau that reimagines the ecstasy and eroticism of Renaissance sculpture for the future. Or is it already the present?
films.default_editorial: No stranger to the sensual and medical contours of the body, horror icon David Cronenberg turns to 18th-century wax cadavers as his new muses for this poetic short. Sonically caressed by a chorus of pleasurable sighs, these anatomical Venuses are both alluring and uncanny in their voluptuousness.
films.default_editorial_html: No stranger to the sensual and medical contours of the body, horror icon David Cronenberg turns to 18th-century wax cadavers as his new muses for this poetic short. films.title: We Can't Go Home Again

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Retired from Hollywood, Nicholas Ray is teaching in upstate New York, schooling lively students on the process of making a feature collaboratively. Together they experiment with narrative and multiple images, and in front of the camera, the group reflect on politics, identity, and filmmaking.
films.short_synopsis_html: Retired from Hollywood, Nicholas Ray is teaching in upstate New York, schooling lively students on the process of making a feature collaboratively. Together they experiment with narrative and multiple images, and in front of the camera, the group reflect on politics, identity, and filmmaking.
films.default_editorial: Not one to be dulled by age, Nicholas Ray (the maverick behind Johnny Guitar and Rebel Without a Cause) came to Cannes in 1973 with a cut of his most experimental film yet, a radical, impassioned journey into American chaos. This avant-garde swansong is now open to all, restored in HD!

films.title: Immoral Tales

content_rating.label: adult
content_rating.description: Contains very strong sexual and/or violent content.

films.short_synopsis: Four erotic stories revolving around taboos—virginity, female masturbation, bloodlust, and incest—take place, each one delving further back in time. Spanning humanity’s history, the tales cover Italian noblewoman Lucrezia Borgia, Hungarian serial killer Erzsébet Báthory, and present-day teenagers.
films.short_synopsis_html: Four erotic stories revolving around taboos—virginity, female masturbation, bloodlust, and incest—take place, each one delving further back in time. films.default_editorial: A hit in France but problematic for the UK censors, this anthology film from Walerian Borowczyk opened a new chapter in the Polish iconoclast’s studies of the flesh. A headily stylised examination of female eroticism and sexual taboos, Immoral Tales is an atmospheric masterclass in suggestion.

films.title: Autobiografia di una Borsetta

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: The painterly clouds of a Tuscan sky hover above Maremma’s rolling landscape. On a rock sits a handbag. A white Miu Miu Wander bag. Upon close inspection, though, we see it’s dirty, beaten up, weathered with time. What has this handbag been through? And how did it end up here, alone?
films.short_synopsis_html: The painterly clouds of a Tuscan sky hover above Maremma’s rolling landscape. On a rock sits a handbag. A white Miu Miu Wander bag. Upon close inspection, though, we see it’s dirty, beaten up, weathered with time. What has this handbag been through? And how did it end up here, alone?
films.default_editorial: Returning to the whimsical love for fashion that shone in Caprice, Joanna Hogg finds an improbable protagonist in a designer handbag in this short film. Complemented by lavishly tactile, immersive imagery, the luxury item speaks with wry humor not only to the fickleness of trends, but fate itself.

films.title: The Beast

content_rating.label: adult
content_rating.description: Contains very strong sexual and/or violent content.

films.short_synopsis: The head of a failing French family thinks that fate has smiled down on him when the daughter of a wealthy man agrees to be married to his son. The daughter and her aunt then travel out to the French countryside to meet with the family, unaware that a mysterious ‘beast’ is stalking the vicinity.
films.short_synopsis_html: The head of a failing French family thinks that fate has smiled down on him when the daughter of a wealthy man agrees to be married to his son. The daughter and her aunt then travel out to the French countryside to meet with the family, unaware that a mysterious ‘beast’ is stalking the vicinity.
films.default_editorial: Walerian Borowczyk leaves political correctness at the door with this mischievously amoral erotic fable. A withering indictment of sensual repression and social mores, The Beast draws on the traditions of surrealism and French farce for an uninhibited examination of sexual appetites running wild.

films.title: Hail

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Fresh out of a Melbourne prison, Dan reunites with the love of his life, Leanne. Together, they are a fierce, passionate, and tender couple—and Dan soon resolves to go straight. But when Leanne’s mysterious old criminal friend appears with a proposal, Dan is lured back to a life of crime.
films.short_synopsis_html: Fresh out of a Melbourne prison, Dan reunites with the love of his life, Leanne. But when Leanne’s mysterious old criminal friend appears with a proposal, Dan is lured back to a life of crime.
films.default_editorial: With striking visuals and cinematic prowess, Hail draws the struggles of life after prison through a compelling relationship. Based on testimonies of a former inmate, this docu-drama, portraying violence and tenderness in equal measures, was received with acclaim in festivals worldwide.

films.title: The Jester

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Over a sleepless night in 1978, Francisco and Rita meet up to remember João, a recently murdered childhood friend. João had belonged to a subversive leftist group during the dictatorship, and was a film producer who had been filming an adaptation of Alexandre Herculano’s drama The Jester.
films.short_synopsis_html: Over a sleepless night in 1978, Francisco and Rita meet up to remember João, a recently murdered childhood friend. João had belonged to a subversive leftist group during the dictatorship, and was a film producer who had been filming an adaptation of Alexandre Herculano’s drama The Jester.
films.default_editorial: José Álvaro Morais theatrically transforms Alexandre Herculano’s 1843 novel before our eyes in his Golden Leopard-winning first feature. Set in the abandoned Lisboa Filmes film studio, The Jester imaginatively ruminates on national identity, engaging with entire centuries of Portuguese history.

films.title: Storm Children, Book One
films.original_title: Mga Anak ng Unos, Unang Aklat

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: The Philippines is the most storm-battered country in the world. In 2013 Typhoon Yolanda, considered the strongest storm in history, struck the Philippines, leaving in its path apocalyptic devastation. A few months later, Lav Diaz visited Tacloban Island to film children lives in the aftermath.

In 2013 Typhoon Yolanda, considered the strongest storm in history, struck the Philippines, leaving in its path apocalyptic devastation. A few months later, Lav Diaz visited Tacloban Island to film children lives in the aftermath.
films.default_editorial: Lav Diaz’s majestically patient storytelling invests his infrequent documentaries with unusual concentration and power. The historical and psychic devastation of his epic dramas here becomes bracingly physical when focused on the detritus and poignant survival of children after Typhoon Yolanda.
films.default_editorial_html: Lav Diaz’s majestically patient storytelling invests his infrequent documentaries with unusual concentration and power. The historical and psychic devastation of his epic dramas here becomes bracingly physical when focused on the detritus and poignant survival of children after Typhoon Yolanda.

films.title: The Endless Film

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A parallel film history crafted from the fragmented remains of never-completed Argentine feature films. Stories and images that were once considered unsuccessful now take on a new meaning. Inert images and sounds never heard before are finally opened up for fresh discovery.
films.short_synopsis_html: A parallel film history crafted from the fragmented remains of never-completed Argentine feature films. Stories and images that were once considered unsuccessful now take on a new meaning. Inert images and sounds never heard before are finally opened up for fresh discovery.
films.default_editorial: Leandro Listorti’s debut is a sublime experiment: a film resurrecting cinematic ghosts, injecting life into projects that never saw the light. Made out of unfinished Argentinian movies, this entrancing patchwork of fragmented narratives is an ode to the infinite possibilities of storytelling.
films.default_editorial_html: Leandro Listorti’s debut is a sublime experiment: a film resurrecting cinematic ghosts, injecting life into projects that never saw the light. Made out of unfinished Argentinian movies, this entrancing patchwork of fragmented narratives is an ode to the infinite possibilities of storytelling.

films.title: Guilty Bystander

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In New York City, ex-cop Max Thursday, now the house detective at a scuzzy hotel in an even scuzzier part of town, exists in an alcoholic haze until his ex-wife appears with news of his son’s disappearance. So, Thursday stumbles through the city’s sleazy underworld searching for his kidnapped son.
films.short_synopsis_html: In New York City, ex-cop Max Thursday, now the house detective at a scuzzy hotel in an even scuzzier part of town, exists in an alcoholic haze until his ex-wife appears with news of his son’s disappearance. So, Thursday stumbles through the city’s sleazy underworld searching for his kidnapped son.
films.default_editorial: Not as well known as he should be, Joseph Lerner directed four noir features between 1947 and 1951. One of these is Guilty Bystander: a booze-soaked and paranoia-inflected independent feature shot entirely on location in the never-grubbier streets of New York City.

films.title: An Anthropological Television Myth

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: The recent history of Sicily is transformed into a kaleidoscopic disarray of images that rob television of its mythmaking potential. The film consists of scenes shot by a regional television station in the town of Catania between 1991 and 1994—an era of important political change.
films.short_synopsis_html: The recent history of Sicily is transformed into a kaleidoscopic disarray of images that rob television of its mythmaking potential. The film consists of scenes shot by a regional television station in the town of Catania between 1991 and 1994—an era of important political change.
films.default_editorial: A great example of how seemingly mundane footage can be reused to create a work of social importance, this exercise in visual history-telling uses a medium representative of popular culture as a tool for the reading of social movements and citizen engagement in a Sicilian city.
films.default_editorial_html: A great example of how seemingly mundane footage can be reused to create a work of social importance, this exercise in visual history-telling uses a medium representative of popular culture as a tool for the reading of social movements and citizen engagement in a Sicilian city.

films.title: Anatolian Trip

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A young amateur rock band from bohemian Istanbul embarks on an impromptu tour to Anatolia—travelling in the improvisatory spirit of their music, rolling from one local encounter to the next. They hope to share their music and love with fellow countrymen, who aren’t expecting their visit.
films.short_synopsis_html: A young amateur rock band from bohemian Istanbul embarks on an impromptu tour to Anatolia—travelling in the improvisatory spirit of their music, rolling from one local encounter to the next. They hope to share their music and love with fellow countrymen, who aren’t expecting their visit.
films.default_editorial: A young rock band’s tour is the subject of this unique music documentary: a cool road movie resembling a social experiment. As Turkey nears a political milestone in the backdrop, the maverick band members are challenged when they meet Anatolian people living under strict rules and traditions.

films.title: Get Ready

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: Found footage from a feature film. From an idyllic scene at the sea to a speedy car driving by night. The radical movement of objects, bodies and senses illustrates the power of cinema.
films.short_synopsis_html: Found footage from a feature film. From an idyllic scene at the sea to a speedy car driving by night. The radical movement of objects, bodies and senses illustrates the power of cinema.
films.default_editorial: A propulsively jittering journey through the cinematic imaginary using glitchy found footage and jacked-up cyber sounds, Get Ready hits the highway hard and takes us with it. A car crash? An escape? This turbo-charged condensation of cinematic moods and tropes makes much of its tiny run-time.

films.title: The Capsule

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A group of seven stone-faced women are awakened by candlelight in a palatial mansion, perched at the top of a Cycladic rock. They engage in a bizarre series of ritualistic endeavours for their matriarch, which could prove to be just as incredible as life itself, before receding back to their lair.
films.short_synopsis_html: A group of seven stone-faced women are awakened by candlelight in a palatial mansion, perched at the top of a Cycladic rock. They engage in a bizarre series of ritualistic endeavours for their matriarch, which could prove to be just as incredible as life itself, before receding back to their lair.
films.default_editorial: In a sensuous short that luxuriates in feminine mythology, all things carnal, pendulous, and tentacular spill from flawless flesh. Ariane Labed’s high priestess takes pleasure in pulling the strings on her harem of beautiful, obedient women, combining sadomasochism and Sapphism to delectable ends.

films.title: The Tango of the Widower and Its Distorting Mirror
films.original_title: El tango del viudo y su espejo deformante
films.title_upcase: THE TANGO OF THE WIDOWER AND ITS DISTORTING MIRROR

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A man is haunted by the ghost of his wife, who appears everywhere he goes. Gradually, he starts to resemble her, spiraling into a chilling reality where we learn he was never married. Instead, it’s a psychological unraveling—a schizophrenic game of identity and illusion.
films.short_synopsis_html: A man is haunted by the ghost of his wife, who appears everywhere he goes. Gradually, he starts to resemble her, spiraling into a chilling reality where we learn he was never married. Instead, it’s a psychological unraveling—a schizophrenic game of identity and illusion.
films.default_editorial: Originally intended to be Raúl Ruiz’s debut feature in 1967, this experimental drama was posthumously revived by Valeria Sarmiento through editing and dialogue reconstruction. The melancholic and the grotesque become strange bedfellows, as a haunted widow descends into a whirlpool of hallucinations.
films.default_editorial_html: Originally intended to be Raúl Ruiz’s debut feature in 1967, this experimental drama was posthumously revived by Valeria Sarmiento through editing and dialogue reconstruction. The melancholic and the grotesque become strange bedfellows, as a haunted widow descends into a whirlpool of hallucinations.

films.title: That Sinking Feeling

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Unemployed and aimless teenager Ronnie, and his hapless pals, spend their time hanging around the rainy parks and dingy cafes of dreary Glasgow. But their world is about to change when Ronnie hatches a complicated scheme to make them all rich by stealing stainless steel sinks from a warehouse.
films.short_synopsis_html: Unemployed and aimless teenager Ronnie, and his hapless pals, spend their time hanging around the rainy parks and dingy cafes of dreary Glasgow. But their world is about to change when Ronnie hatches a complicated scheme to make them all rich by stealing stainless steel sinks from a warehouse.
films.default_editorial: Quick cash proves to be more than just a pipe dream in Bill Forsyth’s buoyant debut about a group of Glaswegian lads who speculate to accumulate in ludicrous fashion. Shrugging off a gloomy tradition of kitchen-sink realism, this cheery comedy looks at the follies of youth with genuine affection.

films.title: The Arrival

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: First you see the arrival of the film itself, which shows the arrival of a train at a station. But that train collides with a second train, causing a violent crash, which leads us to an unexpected third arrival, the arrival of a beautiful woman—the happy-end.
films.short_synopsis_html: First you see the arrival of the film itself, which shows the arrival of a train at a station. But that train collides with a second train, causing a violent crash, which leads us to an unexpected third arrival, the arrival of a beautiful woman—the happy-end.
films.default_editorial: A part of Peter Tscherkassky’s CinemaScope trilogy, this experimental short manipulates classically-shot found footage into an explosive cacophony of sound and images. Evoking the origins of cinema, the film also deconstructs the innate artificiality of the medium by playfully tugging at its seams.

films.title: An Odd Turn

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Lucrecia—a museum security guard—struggles with inflation in a country descending into economic chaos. One night, she bets her severance pay on a speculative move inspired by an improvised pendulum. Before she knows it, her life spirals into a frenzied combination of sex, money, and temporary jobs.
films.short_synopsis_html: Lucrecia—a museum security guard—struggles with inflation in a country descending into economic chaos. One night, she bets her severance pay on a speculative move inspired by an improvised pendulum. Before she knows it, her life spirals into a frenzied combination of sex, money, and temporary jobs.
films.default_editorial: Winner of Best Short Film at the Berlinale, Francisco Lezama’s idiosyncratic comedy sees life for what it is: absurd and mundane, with sporadic moments of serendipity. Twisting together diverse modern phenomena—dating apps, global finance—An Odd Turn is alive to the present in all its surprises.

films.title: The Modern Jungle

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A story of globalization filtered through the fever dream of a Mexican shaman, The Modern Jungle is also an intimate portrait of Zoque culture, commodity fetish, and the predicament of documentary.
films.short_synopsis_html: A story of globalization filtered through the fever dream of a Mexican shaman, The Modern Jungle is also an intimate portrait of Zoque culture, commodity fetish, and the predicament of documentary.
films.default_editorial: The Modern Jungle highlights the ethical complexities of nonfiction filmmaking. What is the relationship between ethnographer and subject? What is owed and what is transacted? A daring project of documentation and uneasy exchange that explores the relationship between indigenous and Western culture.
films.default_editorial_html: The Modern Jungle highlights the ethical complexities of nonfiction filmmaking. What is the relationship between ethnographer and subject? What is owed and what is transacted? A daring project of documentation and uneasy exchange that explores the relationship between indigenous and Western culture.

films.title: OK, Good

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: An aspiring Los Angeles actor spirals ever downward during the grueling process of trying to find steady work.
films.short_synopsis_html: An aspiring Los Angeles actor spirals ever downward during the grueling process of trying to find steady work.
films.default_editorial: Slamdance, the upstart rival of Sundance, celebrates the cutting edge cinema “indie” used to mean, and Daniel Martinico’s caustically funny and forlorn comic tragedy truly epitomizes its spirit. With its verité style, this madcap dive into the world of acting is nightmarish and captivating at once.
films.default_editorial_html: Slamdance, the upstart rival of Sundance, celebrates the cutting edge cinema “indie” used to mean, and Daniel Martinico’s caustically funny and forlorn comic tragedy truly epitomizes its spirit. With its verité style, this madcap dive into the world of acting is nightmarish and captivating at once.

films.title: Kokoloko

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In a small village on the Oaxacan coast, Marisol dreams of joining a self-defense group and living in freedom. But in reality she is constantly navigating a battle between the two men who seek to control her destiny: her passionate lover Mundo and her violent cousin Mauro who keeps her captive.
films.short_synopsis_html: In a small village on the Oaxacan coast, Marisol dreams of joining a self-defense group and living in freedom. But in reality she is constantly navigating a battle between the two men who seek to control her destiny: her passionate lover Mundo and her violent cousin Mauro who keeps her captive.
films.default_editorial: Nine years after his previous picture Miss Bala electrified Cannes, Mexican filmmaker Gerardo Naranjo returns with this stylistically adventurous follow-up. Shot on grainy Super 16mm film in Academy ratio, Kokoloko is a jaggedly freewheeling examination of machismo and star-crossed love.
films.default_editorial_html: Nine years after his previous picture Miss Bala electrified Cannes, Mexican filmmaker Gerardo Naranjo returns with this stylistically adventurous follow-up. Shot on grainy Super 16mm film in Academy ratio, Kokoloko is a jaggedly freewheeling examination of machismo and star-crossed love.

films.title: For You I Will Fight

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: We follow a girl, at the end of the adolescence, Ana, who does not know any more who she is and what she wants, but who chooses to fight, to arm herself, and who finds in the group, in the discipline, and sometimes even in the alienation, a stand to be.
films.short_synopsis_html: We follow a girl, at the end of the adolescence, Ana, who does not know any more who she is and what she wants, but who chooses to fight, to arm herself, and who finds in the group, in the discipline, and sometimes even in the alienation, a stand to be.
films.default_editorial: The first installment of Rachel Lang’s Ana Trilogy is an exploration of the transition from adolescence to adulthood and the uncertainty that comes with it. This Silver Leopard winner marks the beginning of the collaboration between Lang and Salomé Richard, which will culminate in Baden Baden.

films.title: Leningrad Cowboys Meet Moses

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Living in Mexico with a top-ten hit under their belts, the Leningrad Cowboys have fallen on hard times. But when their manager, who has become a delusional self-proclaimed prophet, secures a gig for the band on Coney Island, they must illegally cross the Mexico-United States border to get there.
films.short_synopsis_html: Living in Mexico with a top-ten hit under their belts, the Leningrad Cowboys have fallen on hard times. But when their manager, who has become a delusional self-proclaimed prophet, secures a gig for the band on Coney Island, they must illegally cross the Mexico-United States border to get there.
films.default_editorial: The boys are back in town for this rowdy sequel to Leningrad Cowboys Go America. With half the band killed off by some dodgy tequila, the remainder take to the road for a deliriously dippy satire of communism and religion. Aki Kaurismäki plays the hits, but the gags come thick and fast.

films.title: Around a Small Mountain

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: French maestro Jacques Rivette directs Jane Birkin in this comedy-drama about a woman who returns to a small provincial circus.
films.short_synopsis_html: French maestro Jacques Rivette directs Jane Birkin in this comedy-drama about a woman who returns to a small provincial circus.
films.default_editorial: The very last film by Jacques Rivette, the most consistently underrated of the French New Wave critics-turned-filmmakers (a group which includes François Truffaut and Jean-Luc Godard), Around a Small Mountain is a wry, gentle gem starring 60s icon Jane Birkin.
films.default_editorial_html: The very last film by Jacques Rivette, the most consistently underrated of the French New Wave critics-turned-filmmakers (a group which includes François Truffaut and Jean-Luc Godard), Around a Small Mountain is a wry, gentle gem starring 60s icon Jane Birkin.

films.title: Je t'aime moi non plus

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Johnny is a petite waif-like waitress working in a diner, lonely for love. She develops a crush on gay garbage collector Krassky, who is attracted to her boyish looks. Already an unconventional relationship, matters are further complicated by their inability to consummate it.
films.short_synopsis_html: Johnny is a petite waif-like waitress working in a diner, lonely for love. She develops a crush on gay garbage collector Krassky, who is attracted to her boyish looks. Already an unconventional relationship, matters are further complicated by their inability to consummate it.
films.default_editorial: What to expect from Serge Gainsbourg’s directorial debut? Venturing outside of his recording career was in this case a total success for the enfant terrible: this sensual tale of doomed love is as charming and romantic as his music. And it stars Jane Birkin & burly Warhol superstar, Joe Dallesandro!

films.title: [sic]

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Artist Eric Baudelaire constructed an ‘imaginary reality’ after a sojourn in Kyoto. In an art bookstore, a girl is responsible for ‘bokashi’: obscuring images. The entire book collection has passed through her hands. She determines what we can and cannot see.
films.short_synopsis_html: Artist Eric Baudelaire constructed an ‘imaginary reality’ after a sojourn in Kyoto. In an art bookstore, a girl is responsible for ‘bokashi’: obscuring images. The entire book collection has passed through her hands. She determines what we can and cannot see.
films.default_editorial: The film work of Eric Baudelaire embodies a voice uniquely committed to reality’s representation, that makes politics its very own poetry, and vice versa. This quietly playful meditation takes censorship in Japan as a starting point to delve into the nature, power and significance of images.

films.title: As Long as Shotguns Remain
films.original_title: Tant qu'il nous reste des fusils à pompe

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In a village in the south of France, it is hot and all lies abandoned. Joshua, 18, wanders around aimlessly, with the memories of his friend Silvain’s death guiding him. Joshua wants to die too, but he doesn’t want to leave his brother alone. Meanwhile, he meets a gang called the Icebergs.
films.short_synopsis_html: In a village in the south of France, it is hot and all lies abandoned. Joshua, 18, wanders around aimlessly, with the memories of his friend Silvain’s death guiding him. Joshua wants to die too, but he doesn’t want to leave his brother alone. Meanwhile, he meets a gang called the Icebergs.
films.default_editorial: In search of purpose and connection, the despondent siblings in this atmospheric short ramble through sleepy suburbs that are filmed like the background of a video game. Cool in style and melancholy in subject, this film is also miraculously warm, imbued with a young man’s love for his brother.

films.title: Jesus, You Know

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Six fragmentary portraits of believers who ask questions, look for answers, and spill their hearts out to Jesus Christ.
films.short_synopsis_html: Six fragmentary portraits of believers who ask questions, look for answers, and spill their hearts out to Jesus Christ.
films.default_editorial: Mixing interviews with scripted monologues, this polyphonic portrait of Catholic faith is a frank, honest exploration of the relationship with God. Jesus, You Know is unafraid of portraying believers’ darker thoughts born from crises, though is wholly sympathetic to their earnest conviction.

Jesus, You Know is unafraid of portraying believers’ darker thoughts born from crises, though is wholly sympathetic to their earnest conviction.

films.title: Brothers of the Night

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Soft boys by day, kings by night. Young Bulgarian Roma who come to Vienna looking for freedom and a quick buck. They sell their bodies as if that’s all they had. What comforts them, so far from home, is the feeling of being together. But the nights are long and unpredictable.
films.short_synopsis_html: Soft boys by day, kings by night. Young Bulgarian Roma who come to Vienna looking for freedom and a quick buck. They sell their bodies as if that’s all they had. What comforts them, so far from home, is the feeling of being together. But the nights are long and unpredictable.
films.default_editorial: Too few films depict stories set within the Roma community with stylish aesthetics and burlesque humour. Reminiscent of Fassbinder’s Querelle, this stylised documentary further subverts the norm by exploring this community through a seldom seen angle: gay sex work.
films.default_editorial_html: Too few films depict stories set within the Roma community with stylish aesthetics and burlesque humour. Reminiscent of Fassbinder’s Querelle, this stylised documentary further subverts the norm by exploring this community through a seldom seen angle: gay sex work.

films.title: My Skin, Luminous

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Having lost the pigment in his skin, Matias, an infirmed orphan at a Michoacán primary school, has been quarantined from his classmates. Meanwhile, the presence and words of novelist Mario Bellatin offer the prospect of healing to his ailing body.
films.short_synopsis_html: Having lost the pigment in his skin, Matias, an infirmed orphan at a Michoacán primary school, has been quarantined from his classmates. Meanwhile, the presence and words of novelist Mario Bellatin offer the prospect of healing to his ailing body.
films.default_editorial: Originally commissioned by the Mexican Ministry of Education, Nicolás Pereda and Gabino Rodríguez’s hypnotically mysterious, hybrid object unravels and metamorphoses within the walls of a school. This oneiric journey from light to darkness is a gorgeously abstracted tale of childhood and healing.

This oneiric journey from light to darkness is a gorgeously abstracted tale of childhood and healing.

films.title: The Fight

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: It is a sunny day on the river Trebbia. In the distance a patrol of German soldiers is approaching: they are nazis, guns blazing. It seems like they are chasing somebody. Tonino is the fugitive, a partisan with nothing left to do but dive into the river. This river will bring him to his real life.
films.short_synopsis_html: It is a sunny day on the river Trebbia. In the distance a patrol of German soldiers is approaching: they are nazis, guns blazing. It seems like they are chasing somebody. Tonino is the fugitive, a partisan with nothing left to do but dive into the river. This river will bring him to his real life.
films.default_editorial: A young partisan drifts through clashing epochs in Marco Bellocchio’s magical-realist short, a poignant ode to the 1940s resistance movement in his Italian hometown of Bobbio. At once a historical witness and a symbol of rebirth, the beautiful Trebbia river provides a beguiling portal to the past.

films.title: Lovely Rita

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Rita is a wilful and unruly teenager on the verge of womanhood. Her sexual awakening leads her to intimacy with a young schoolboy and an older bus driver. Rita’s efforts to break out of her solitude and claustrophobic environment isolate her even more until, one day, she crosses the line.
films.short_synopsis_html: Rita is a wilful and unruly teenager on the verge of womanhood. Her sexual awakening leads her to intimacy with a young schoolboy and an older bus driver. Rita’s efforts to break out of her solitude and claustrophobic environment isolate her even more until, one day, she crosses the line.
films.default_editorial: In an acerbic feature debut, Jessica Hausner added her own sharp shocks to extreme cinema at the turn of the millennium, plumbing the profane depths of a teenage girl’s desires. Shot in serrated, lurid lo-fi, transgressions are made all the more raw and vibrant in this daring coming-of-age film.

films.title: Bad Seed

films.default_editorial: Here’s a treasure from the vaults: the directing debut of Billy Wilder, a comedy made in France in between his flight from Germany and his arrival in Hollywood. Starring Danielle Darrieux (Madame de…), it shows Wilder’s sweet-and-sour sensibility, mixing romance and cynicism, comedy and drama.

films.title: 9 Muses of Star Empire

films.short_synopsis: Nine young women are followed for a year as they train to be the next K-pop sensations. Chosen by the powerful Star Empire Agency to be part of a new girl group called 9 Muses, the women undergo intense scrutiny as they are molded into an image created by the CEO.
films.short_synopsis_html: Nine young women are followed for a year as they train to be the next K-pop sensations. Chosen by the powerful Star Empire Agency to be part of a new girl group called 9 Muses, the women undergo intense scrutiny as they are molded into an image created by the CEO.
films.default_editorial: With K-pop artists filling up stadiums all around the world, this riveting and definitive documentary from renowned investigative journalist Lee Harkjoon exposes the darker side of a complex industry. Behind the limelight and the fan chants, the price of fame is paid with more than sweat and tears.

films.title: Quiet Chaos

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Aging entertainment industry exec Pietro returns from a beach trip to find his wife dead. Distraught, Pietro renews his dedication to raising his 10-year-old daughter, Claudia. But trouble ensues when he begins neglecting his job, electing to sit on a park bench outside Claudia’s school instead.
films.short_synopsis_html: Aging entertainment industry exec Pietro returns from a beach trip to find his wife dead. Distraught, Pietro renews his dedication to raising his 10-year-old daughter, Claudia. But trouble ensues when he begins neglecting his job, electing to sit on a park bench outside Claudia’s school instead.
films.default_editorial: Starring the wonderful Nanni Moretti in the lead role, Quiet Chaos’ eccentric storyline is the perfect means to explore a panoply of characters, proving that it is our most bizarre thoughts and behaviors that makes us all the more human. This award-winning film is an enchanting and touching delight.

films.short_synopsis: An experimental exploration and celebration of the Juggalo subculture in Buffalo, New York. Surreal scenes shot in long and static takes of Juggalos engaged in their favorite activities, first and foremost of which—causing mayhem.

films.default_editorial: America, land of subcultures! This award-winning short, experimental documentary examines the riotous fans of shock hip hop duo Insane Clown Posse in their natural habitat, with a whimsical eye for Americana and a cheeky disregard for conventional narrative. Get ready for mayhem.

films.title: Sincronía

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: When Arturo is offered a job in another country, he is forced to reevaluate his feelings towards his friend Sandra. Things get even more complicated when Sandra’s request for a loan to start her own business is approved. Soon, they’ll both have to make a decision between love and their careers.
films.short_synopsis_html: When Arturo is offered a job in another country, he is forced to reevaluate his feelings towards his friend Sandra. Things get even more complicated when Sandra’s request for a loan to start her own business is approved. Soon, they’ll both have to make a decision between love and their careers.
films.default_editorial: In the hands of Jorge Iván Morales, this indie love story reminds us of the innocence and synchronicity of romance: when there is nothing better than coinciding, if only briefly. Built from the fabric of conversations, this deceptively simple day-in-the-life tale goes straight to the heart.

films.title: Léa

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Léa, a student in Le Havre, takes care of her grandmother who requires constant attention, and works as a waitress to make ends meet. But when she is accepted at a prestigious school in Paris, she must make decisions. In order to pay her way through school, she becomes a stripper.
films.short_synopsis_html: Léa, a student in Le Havre, takes care of her grandmother who requires constant attention, and works as a waitress to make ends meet. But when she is accepted at a prestigious school in Paris, she must make decisions. In order to pay her way through school, she becomes a stripper.
films.default_editorial: Moving from the town of Le Havre to the city of Paris, and one class to another, Léa is a character study with a sly, clever set-up: a close-up on a young woman who resorts to a career in stripping to bankroll her studies. A debut feature from Bruno Rolland, co-written with lead actor Anne Azoulay.

films.title: Afterschool

content_rating.label: adult
content_rating.description: Contains very strong sexual and/or violent content.

films.short_synopsis: Robert is a student at an elite East Coast school who accidentally captures on camera the tragic death of two classmates. Their lives become memorialized as part of an audio-visual assignment designed to speed up the campus-wide healing process. But the video results in an atmosphere of paranoia.
films.short_synopsis_html: Robert is a student at an elite East Coast school who accidentally captures on camera the tragic death of two classmates. Their lives become memorialized as part of an audio-visual assignment designed to speed up the campus-wide healing process. But the video results in an atmosphere of paranoia.
films.default_editorial: The ruthlessly assured debut from Antonio Campos, Afterschool is a narcotized study of detachment in the YouTube era. With echoes of Michael Haneke and Gus Van Sant, Campos forges a style marked by its disquieting distance, capturing the deadening moral and emotional effects of a life lived online.

films.title: Blind Pig Who Wants To Fly
films.title_upcase: BLIND PIG WHO WANTS TO FLY

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Eight people living in urban Indonesia embark on absurd journeys in order to fit into society. There’s a tale of a father who is desperate to win a green card lottery, another about a young girl who believes that firecrackers expel ghosts, and six other stories of locals hoping for a better life.
films.short_synopsis_html: Eight people living in urban Indonesia embark on absurd journeys in order to fit into society. There’s a tale of a father who is desperate to win a green card lottery, another about a young girl who believes that firecrackers expel ghosts, and six other stories of locals hoping for a better life.
films.default_editorial: Well-known for his avant-garde shorts, experimental filmmaker Edwin expands his scope with this eccentric debut: a darkly comic chronicle of a Chinese-Indonesian woman adrift in her own country. An outlandish mosaic of oft-kilter vignettes and riotous gags, guided by an earnest yearning to belong.

films.title: La Paz in Buenos Aires

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Erasmo Chambi is a Bolivian migrant who survives on the outskirts of Buenos Aires by giving lucha libre wrestling performances in small local clubs, bringing his own hand-made ring to each show. Back home, he was a legendary wrestler named “El Ciclon.” Now, he trains his son to become his successor.
films.short_synopsis_html: Erasmo Chambi is a Bolivian migrant who survives on the outskirts of Buenos Aires by giving lucha libre wrestling performances in small local clubs, bringing his own hand-made ring to each show. Back home, he was a legendary wrestler named “El Ciclon.” Now, he trains his son to become his successor.
films.default_editorial: Marcelo Charras’ up-close-and-personal documentary on the world of local wrestling in Buenos Aires intimately studies the intergenerational bond among the tight-knit community of Bolivian immigrants. The love between a former champion and his son is embodied by hours of blood, sweats and tears.

films.title: Satan in High Heels

content_rating.label: adult

films.short_synopsis: Stacey Kane (Meg Myles) is the anti-hero of Satan in High Heels, a carnival stripper who goes on the lam and proceeds to bend the nightclub world to her devices in a series of intense power plays.
films.short_synopsis_html: Stacey Kane (Meg Myles) is the anti-hero of Satan in High Heels, a carnival stripper who goes on the lam and proceeds to bend the nightclub world to her devices in a series of intense power plays.
films.default_editorial: The early 60s New York club scene acts as the tawdry backdrop to this flamboyant, fetish-laden sexploitation film. Shot through with tinges of film noir, Satan in High Heels is a rollicking ride of burlesque nightclubs, underground S&M, and fabulous fetish wear, starring pin-up model Meg Myles.

films.title: Letter

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: In a remote village in the Northwest of Russia, a psychiatric ward exists in an old wooden house. The place and its inhabitants seem to be untouched by civilization. But in this pristine setting, no articulate human voice is heard, and all pain is muted.
films.short_synopsis_html: In a remote village in the Northwest of Russia, a psychiatric ward exists in an old wooden house. The place and its inhabitants seem to be untouched by civilization. But in this pristine setting, no articulate human voice is heard, and all pain is muted.
films.default_editorial: Made by Ukrainian auteur Sergei Loznitsa while shooting his 2001 doc The Settlement , this short film eerily plays with time and space. Shot with a special camera—with each image appearing as if it was taken in the early years of the 20th century — Letter is an impressionistic work of non-fiction.

films.title: The Protagonists

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: An actress takes an Italian film crew on a tour of London, recounting a senseless real-life murder that occurred just four years previous. The culprits were two upper-class teenagers from Oxford who traveled to London, driven by delusions with the intent to kill. The crew reconstructs the crime.

films.default_editorial: Long before Queer and Call Me By Your Name, Luca Guadagnino partnered with the one-and-only Tilda Swinton for his experimental debut feature. A surreal faux-documentary about a mysterious murder, this cinematic fever dream presciently taps into the current cultural obsession with true-crime dramas.

films.title: The Dream and The Silence
