films.short_synopsis: Oriol and Yolanda live in Paris with their two daughters. Oriol is an architect and Yolanda is a teacher. During a holiday at the Ebro River Delta they have an accident that changes their lives.
films.short_synopsis_html: Oriol and Yolanda live in Paris with their two daughters. Oriol is an architect and Yolanda is a teacher. During a holiday at the Ebro River Delta they have an accident that changes their lives.
films.default_editorial: A minimalist work of transcendent beauty, Jaime Rosales’ film navigates loss and emotional disconnection through exquisite black-and-white cinematography and impeccable use of sound. His deliberate sense of distance invites reflection on the unspoken fractures within human relationships.

films.title: Beauty Is Not a Sin

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In an Italian town, a young woman attends confession. She reveals to the priest various fantasies involving greed, lust, and temptation. The priest undergoes a crisis of faith after her confession ignites desires he can’t ignore, sharing in her sin through a forbidden act.
films.short_synopsis_html: In an Italian town, a young woman attends confession. She reveals to the priest various fantasies involving greed, lust, and temptation. films.default_editorial: Playing irreverently with the religious iconography of Italy, Nicolas Winding Refn comes tantalizingly close to sacrilege in this erotically charged short. Created for motorcycle brand MV Agusta and premiering at the Venice Film Festival, this striking advert surrenders to delicious temptation.

films.title: The Delta

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: At a Memphis movie house, romance sparks between Lincoln, an affluent white teenager, and Minh, the migrant son of a G.I. and a Vietnamese woman. But when they take a spontaneous trip down the Mississippi in Lincoln’s father’s boat, the two lovers soon uncover what they do not have in common.
films.short_synopsis_html: At a Memphis movie house, romance sparks between Lincoln, an affluent white teenager, and Minh, the migrant son of a G.I. and a Vietnamese woman. But when they take a spontaneous trip down the Mississippi in Lincoln’s father’s boat, the two lovers soon uncover what they do not have in common.
films.default_editorial: Immersed in the tantalizing erotics of water and bathed in blue, Ira Sachs’s feature debut was a groundbreaking intervention into New Queer Cinema in the 1990s. Swirling race and class into the sultry pool of sexuality, The Delta cruises into quivering nights of threat, pleasure, and discovery.

films.title: Shanty Tramp

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A small-town Southern white prostitute has to decide between her lust for a black man and her meal-ticket, the sleazy revival-tent preacher who’s just rolled into town.
films.short_synopsis_html: A small-town Southern white prostitute has to decide between her lust for a black man and her meal-ticket, the sleazy revival-tent preacher who’s just rolled into town.
films.default_editorial: This extraordinarily tawdry sleaze-fest of Southern Gothic melodrama emerged from the disturbed mind of exploitation legend (and circus freak) K. Gordon Murray, working alongside Cuban director Joseph G. Prieto. So much about this film that is just plain wrong it’s hard to know where to start…

films.short_synopsis: After many years apart, Bianca and her mother meet again in the streets of Porto. Together, they hit the road with their stripping show, running after lost time, impossible love, and strange fantasies.
films.short_synopsis_html: After many years apart, Bianca and her mother meet again in the streets of Porto. Together, they hit the road with their stripping show, running after lost time, impossible love, and strange fantasies.
films.default_editorial: Once we discovered French director Yann Gonzalez’s debut, You and the Night, we had to see more. So we’ve tracked down the short he made just before his first feature—and, unsurprisingly, it is pure kink featuring a mother-daughter stripping act. Hyper-stylized, campy and sexy, the film simply pops!

films.title: Lips of Blood

content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: When a photograph of a decrepit seaside château evokes a childhood vision of an encounter with a mysterious girl, Frederick is compelled to investigate. Soon, he uncovers a surreal and erotic netherworld of vampirism from which he might never return.
films.short_synopsis_html: When a photograph of a decrepit seaside château evokes a childhood vision of an encounter with a mysterious girl, Frederick is compelled to investigate. Soon, he uncovers a surreal and erotic netherworld of vampirism from which he might never return.
films.default_editorial: Elegantly roaming from castle ruins to the streets of Paris, the wanton vampires in Jean Rollin’s bloodsucking classic are ethereal visions of eros. Fired up by passions that transcend time and space, this spellbinding cinematic puzzle is entranced by the enduring hold of childhood memories.

films.title: The Human Surge

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Buenos Aires. Exe, 25 years old, has just lost his job and is not looking for another one. Online, he meets Alf, a boy from Mozambique who is also bored with his job and who is about to follow Archie, another boy who has run away into the jungle.
films.short_synopsis_html: Buenos Aires. Exe, 25 years old, has just lost his job and is not looking for another one. Online, he meets Alf, a boy from Mozambique who is also bored with his job and who is about to follow Archie, another boy who has run away into the jungle.
films.default_editorial: Shot across three continents—and divided in three parts interlinked in unexpected ways—Eduardo Williams’s enigmatic feature debut takes us on a visceral journey to explore the ominous hyper-connectivity of today’s world. One of the most accomplished and refreshing films of recent years.

films.short_synopsis: When Tamara Drewe returns to the village of her youth, life for the locals is thrown upside down. Tamara – once an ugly duckling – has been transformed and is now a minor celebrity, beginning a comedy of manners with the townsfolk.
films.short_synopsis_html: When Tamara Drewe returns to the village of her youth, life for the locals is thrown upside down. Tamara – once an ugly duckling – has been transformed and is now a minor celebrity, beginning a comedy of manners with the townsfolk.
films.default_editorial: From versatile director Stephen Frears comes this British countryside comedy: a modern retelling of Thomas Hardy’s  Far from the Madding Crowd whose source material is a graphic novel! Transposing the romantic foibles of Victorian England to the modern day, Tamara Drewe is pure escapist fun.

films.short_synopsis: Bud Eagle, an aspiring teen pop singer, lands in L.A. to try and make it big. But when he is given a shot by Mike McCauley, the crooked owner of a small record company, Bud soon finds himself swallowed up by the evils of showbiz.

films.title: Life Span of the Object in Frame (A Film About the Film Not Yet Shot)

content_rating.label: mature

films.short_synopsis: Choosing photography as his subject and memory as a guide, the director finds himself trapped in a labyrinth. Engaged in a back and forth between theoretical meditations and visual flashes, he winds through the image-filled maze, encountering an angel, Dante, Muybridge’s sequences and much more.
films.short_synopsis_html: Choosing photography as his subject and memory as a guide, the director finds himself trapped in a labyrinth. films.default_editorial: At once a meditation on time and memory, this experimental feature takes a photograph as its material of choice to examine its properties in relation to cinema. From Ukrainian artist-filmmaker Aleksandr Balagura, this fascinating film is a hypnotic provocation in photography’s enchanting enigmas.

films.title: The Second Game

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: In 1988, one year before a revolution toppled Romania, a Bucharest football game between the country’s leading teams took place. It was refereed by the director’s father. The director and his father watch the match, their commentary accompanying the original television images in real-time.
films.short_synopsis_html: In 1988, one year before a revolution toppled Romania, a Bucharest football game between the country’s leading teams took place. It was refereed by the director’s father. The director and his father watch the match, their commentary accompanying the original television images in real-time.
films.default_editorial: Corneliu Porumboiu’s minimalist doc might feel as simple as chatting during a match, yet he creates a super-charged situation where audiences come to dissect the hidden meaning lurking behind the images. A captivating look at Romanian history, father-son relationships, and football.

films.short_synopsis: When estranged siblings Luisa and Gabino visit their parents in a deserted mining town in Mexico, the presence of Luisa’s actor boyfriend gives rise to awkward scenarios. Their father’s ambivalence toward his children is transformed by his fixation on Paco’s role in a famous narco-themed TV series.
films.short_synopsis_html: When estranged siblings Luisa and Gabino visit their parents in a deserted mining town in Mexico, the presence of Luisa’s actor boyfriend gives rise to awkward scenarios. films.default_editorial: The obsession with Narcos is an unexpected subject for the prolific director Nicolás Pereda, whose ninth feature shares with the drug-cartel drama the actor Francisco Barreiro. This droll look at dysfunctional families takes several unexpected swerves, to keep you, as in the show, on your toes.

content_rating.label: general

films.short_synopsis: Agricultural laborers in Valle del Cauca, Colombia, harvest a field of sugarcane using machetes. The camera keeps its distance as it observes their smooth movements. Soon the rhythmic movements of the machetes develop their own choreography, whilst time appears to expand.
films.short_synopsis_html: Agricultural laborers in Valle del Cauca, Colombia, harvest a field of sugarcane using machetes. The camera keeps its distance as it observes their smooth movements. Soon the rhythmic movements of the machetes develop their own choreography, whilst time appears to expand.
films.default_editorial: Corta is an intensely rhythmic, starkly minimalistic, and photosensitive experience from Colombian director Felipe Guerrero. This gesture of cinematic purity somehow brings the Lumières back to life. The sugar cane harvesters could very well be those workers leaving the factory in 1895…

films.title: Soundtrack to War

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: George Gittoes, a lone documentary filmmaker, ventures into Iraq to see firsthand how music plays a part in the American Army’s life. This film takes us on an emotional roller coaster ride of the young and talented who have found themselves in the hell of war, and who want to stay alive.
films.short_synopsis_html: George Gittoes, a lone documentary filmmaker, ventures into Iraq to see firsthand how music plays a part in the American Army’s life. This film takes us on an emotional roller coaster ride of the young and talented who have found themselves in the hell of war, and who want to stay alive.
films.default_editorial: Putting a remarkable human face on the war at the height of its controversy, Soundtrack to War is a look at pop culture hardwired into tanks and helicopters, and it showcases live performances by a striking cast of the young and battle-weary, with destroyed cities as their backdrop.
films.default_editorial_html: Putting a remarkable human face on the war at the height of its controversy, Soundtrack to War is a look at pop culture hardwired into tanks and helicopters, and it showcases live performances by a striking cast of the young and battle-weary, with destroyed cities as their backdrop.

films.title: Clowns

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A small theater company is rehearsing a play based on the opera I Pagliacci in front of a small audience, including the mother of the singer, a wealthy woman and benefactor of the project. That evening, during a dinner party, the guests undergo a hypnosis session that goes wrong.
films.short_synopsis_html: A small theater company is rehearsing a play based on the opera I Pagliacci in front of a small audience, including the mother of the singer, a wealthy woman and benefactor of the project. That evening, during a dinner party, the guests undergo a hypnosis session that goes wrong.
films.default_editorial: Once again, a mother-son relationship takes center stage in Marco Bellocchio’s volatile short, in which a revival of Ruggero Leoncavallo’s I Pagliacci erupts in explosive confrontations. Operatic in its expression, this vortex of raw emotions evokes the eternal tension between money and art-making.

films.title: Caricaturana

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Inspired by an idea from Soviet director Sergei Eisenstein, director Radu Jude silently flips through satirical lithographs by 19th-century French artist Honoré-Victorin Daumier. Soon, the caricatures’ original texts are read out. Finally, the caricatures are used as commentary for actual news.
films.short_synopsis_html: Inspired by an idea from Soviet director Sergei Eisenstein, director Radu Jude silently flips through satirical lithographs by 19th-century French artist Honoré-Victorin Daumier. Soon, the caricatures’ original texts are read out. Finally, the caricatures are used as commentary for actual news.
films.default_editorial: Who else but Radu Jude could have brought together 19th-century lithographs, Russian film theory, and… Gwyneth Paltrow’s infamous scented candles? And all in under 10 minutes! Fusing visual pranks with social commentary, this mischievous game of free association tickles the brain hilariously.

And all in under 10 minutes! Fusing visual pranks with social commentary, this mischievous game of free association tickles the brain hilariously.

films.title: Elegy to the Visitor from the Revolution
films.original_title: Elehiya sa dumalaw mula sa himagsikan
films.title_upcase: ELEGY TO THE VISITOR FROM THE REVOLUTION

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A woman from the end of the 19th century visits modern day Philippines and observes three interwoven stories: that of a prostitute, a group of criminals and a musician.
films.short_synopsis_html: A woman from the end of the 19th century visits modern day Philippines and observes three interwoven stories: that of a prostitute, a group of criminals and a musician.
films.default_editorial: One of the most crucial aspects of the cinema of Filipino director Lav Diaz is a desire—or, most likely, a need—to connect the Philippines of the colonial past with the Philippines of the present. This film vividly does exactly that: a portrait of today seen through the eyes of a country’s history.

films.title: Plan 9 from Outer Space

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Flying saucers visit Earth, and not for the first time. And as ever, their attempts at peaceful communication are ignored by Earth’s generals. This time, the aliens will prove their existence to all humans—by enacting Plan 9: Reanimating the corpses of Earth.
films.short_synopsis_html: Flying saucers visit Earth, and not for the first time. And as ever, their attempts at peaceful communication are ignored by Earth’s generals. This time, the aliens will prove their existence to all humans—by enacting Plan 9: Reanimating the corpses of Earth.
films.default_editorial: Wonky sets. A wonky script. Toy flying saucers on visible strings. It’s both midday and midnight in most scenes. Dracula and Vampira are here—but the film forgets they are vampires. And sometimes Dracula is really a chiropractor in disguise. If this is Plan 9, Plans 1 to 8 must have been terrible.

Dracula and Vampira are here—but the film forgets they are vampires. And sometimes Dracula is really a chiropractor in disguise. If this is Plan 9, Plans 1 to 8 must have been terrible.

films.title: The Deep End

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Lucille, an introverted eleven year old girl, lives with her parents in a public swimming pool, where they are caretakers. She refuses to brave the deep end, as she rejects her own confused and ambiguous desires for the swimming instructor.
films.short_synopsis_html: Lucille, an introverted eleven year old girl, lives with her parents in a public swimming pool, where they are caretakers. She refuses to brave the deep end, as she rejects her own confused and ambiguous desires for the swimming instructor.
films.default_editorial: In this cinematic curiosity, the swimming pool becomes a bizarre space where desire and anxiety lie, emphasizing the confusion of teenagehood. Through a striking color palette and imagery, and with its aquatic, otherworldly atmosphere, this short film is a puzzling, evocative and truly unique work.

Through a striking color palette and imagery, and with its aquatic, otherworldly atmosphere, this short film is a puzzling, evocative and truly unique work.

films.title: Stark Fear

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A noir psychodrama set amongst the oil fields of Oklahoma with obvious nods to a particular Hitchcock classic, Stark Fear is the sole film directed by WWII cameraman Ned Hockman, with B-pic favorites Beverly Garland and Skip Homeier (in a particularly oily performance).
films.short_synopsis_html: A noir psychodrama set amongst the oil fields of Oklahoma with obvious nods to a particular Hitchcock classic, Stark Fear is the sole film directed by WWII cameraman Ned Hockman, with B-pic favorites Beverly Garland and Skip Homeier (in a particularly oily performance).
films.default_editorial: A sleazy, slippery noir set in the shadowy oil fields of Oklahoma, Stark Fear was the only film directed by WWII cameraman Ned Hockman. More than a B-movie oddity, this cult grindhouse classic is laced with the sting of Hitchcock, and pitch-perfect performances from Beverly Garland & Skip Homeier.
films.default_editorial_html: A sleazy, slippery noir set in the shadowy oil fields of Oklahoma, Stark Fear was the only film directed by WWII cameraman Ned Hockman. More than a B-movie oddity, this cult grindhouse classic is laced with the sting of Hitchcock, and pitch-perfect performances from Beverly Garland & Skip Homeier.

films.title: The Makes

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: The starting point of this film is a book of unfilmed scripts by Antonioni: That Bowling Alley on the Tiber. This film essay is ‘acted out’ by the real-life critic Philippe Azoury, who plays a non-existent critic discussing these non-existent films from Antonioni’s non-existent ‘Japanese period’.
films.short_synopsis_html: The starting point of this film is a book of unfilmed scripts by Antonioni: That Bowling Alley on the Tiber. This film essay is ‘acted out’ by the real-life critic Philippe Azoury, who plays a non-existent critic discussing these non-existent films from Antonioni’s non-existent ‘Japanese period’.
films.default_editorial: Baudelaire’s The Makes is an inventive, amusing reflection on the interchangeability of reality and fiction. This love letter to Antonioni is enacted through a critical commentary of his apocryphal Japan period. This is a film that doesn’t look like a film and talks about films that don’t exist!
films.default_editorial_html: Baudelaire’s The Makes is an inventive, amusing reflection on the interchangeability of reality and fiction. This love letter to Antonioni is enacted through a critical commentary of his apocryphal Japan period. This is a film that doesn’t look like a film and talks about films that don’t exist!

films.title: Amy George

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Thirteen-year-old Jesse wants to be an artist but believes his mundane middle-class Toronto life has left him unprepared. After reading a book on what it takes to be a ‘true artist,’ he sets out looking for risk, ecstasy, wildness, and women.
films.short_synopsis_html: Thirteen-year-old Jesse wants to be an artist but believes his mundane middle-class Toronto life has left him unprepared. After reading a book on what it takes to be a ‘true artist,’ he sets out looking for risk, ecstasy, wildness, and women.
films.default_editorial: The debut feature from up-and-coming Canadian filmmakers Calvin Thomas & Yonah Lewis, Amy George is a sharp, moving, and unusually sober portrait of adolescence. Made for practically nothing, this honest slice-of-life feature beautifully captures the awkwardness of a difficult time in life.
films.default_editorial_html: The debut feature from up-and-coming Canadian filmmakers Calvin Thomas & Yonah Lewis, Amy George is a sharp, moving, and unusually sober portrait of adolescence. Made for practically nothing, this honest slice-of-life feature beautifully captures the awkwardness of a difficult time in life.

films.title: Miniatures: Many Berlin Artists in Hoisdorf
films.original_title: Miniaturen – Viele Berliner Künstler in Hoisdorf
films.title_upcase: MINIATURES: MANY BERLIN ARTISTS IN HOISDORF

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: On a weekend in June 1983, in what was deemed a “country outing,” an impressive number of Berlin-based artists went to a small German village to give the local residents a taste of Berlin’s avant-garde art scene. Back in Berlin, the footage was manipulated to produce an “experimental examination.”
films.short_synopsis_html: On a weekend in June 1983, in what was deemed a “country outing,” an impressive number of Berlin-based artists went to a small German village to give the local residents a taste of Berlin’s avant-garde art scene. Back in Berlin, the footage was manipulated to produce an “experimental examination.”
films.default_editorial: Playful and otherworldly, Peter Tscherkassky’s visual record of an avant-garde experiment put on by a group of Berlin artists erase the undue emphasis on individuality. Instead, the collective are highlighted, as scratched, manipulated Super 8 images transform human figures into enigmatic shadows.
films.default_editorial_html: Playful and otherworldly, Peter Tscherkassky’s visual record of an avant-garde experiment put on by a group of Berlin artists erase the undue emphasis on individuality. Instead, the collective are highlighted, as scratched, manipulated Super 8 images transform human figures into enigmatic shadows.

films.title: The Nest of the Cuckoo Birds
films.original_title: The Nest of the Cuckoo Birds
films.title_upcase: THE NEST OF THE CUCKOO BIRDS

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: An undercover agent is sent to infiltrate bootleggers in the Florida Everglades, but winds up lost in the swamps and stuck in a decrepit hotel with a few of peculiar inhabitants. What starts off like a police actioner quickly morphs into an unholy fairy tale of Southern Gothic melodrama and horror.
films.short_synopsis_html: An undercover agent is sent to infiltrate bootleggers in the Florida Everglades, but winds up lost in the swamps and stuck in a decrepit hotel with a few of peculiar inhabitants. What starts off like a police actioner quickly morphs into an unholy fairy tale of Southern Gothic melodrama and horror.
films.default_editorial: Following a limited release, this mid-60s Southern Gothic melodrama disappeared into thin air but has since grown in cult status. A terrifying B-movie nightmare about deranged bootleggers, the film is suffused with a sinister mood, outré performances, and chilling, black-and-white imagery.
films.default_editorial_html: Following a limited release, this mid-60s Southern Gothic melodrama disappeared into thin air but has since grown in cult status. A terrifying B-movie nightmare about deranged bootleggers, the film is suffused with a sinister mood, outré performances, and chilling, black-and-white imagery.

films.title: Murder in Mississippi

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Torn-from-the-headlines exploitation or daring social commentary? Joseph P. Mawra’s film is a little of both, using the true story of the killing of civil rights workers in the American deep South as a gritty springboard for another ultra-low-budget entry from the director of Chained Girls.
films.short_synopsis_html: Torn-from-the-headlines exploitation or daring social commentary? Joseph P. Mawra’s film is a little of both, using the true story of the killing of civil rights workers in the American deep South as a gritty springboard for another ultra-low-budget entry from the director of Chained Girls.
films.default_editorial: From the prolific (and mysterious) exploitation director Joseph P. Mawra comes this noir-lit and furious grindhouse affair about a racist police force. Based on a true story, much of the material boldly confronts American race relations even as its underscored by a low-budget, sleazy aesthetic.
films.default_editorial_html: From the prolific (and mysterious) exploitation director Joseph P. Mawra comes this noir-lit and furious grindhouse affair about a racist police force. films.title: Touch of Crude

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: A woman moves into a new house. As she explores this empty and eerie space, she encounters a mysterious entity—a Black Box. When she peers through its peephole, the woman unlocks access to multiple universes, each viewed from the perspective of a different woman.
films.short_synopsis_html: A woman moves into a new house. As she explores this empty and eerie space, she encounters a mysterious entity—a Black Box. When she peers through its peephole, the woman unlocks access to multiple universes, each viewed from the perspective of a different woman.
films.default_editorial: Nicolas Winding Refn taps into fashion’s power to suggest strange and enticing worlds in this advert created for Prada. Influenced by the experimental cinema of Kenneth Anger and with hints of Lynchian surrealism, this enigmatic film conjures up an atmosphere that lies between danger and sensuality.
films.default_editorial_html: Nicolas Winding Refn taps into fashion’s power to suggest strange and enticing worlds in this advert created for Prada. Influenced by the experimental cinema of Kenneth Anger and with hints of Lynchian surrealism, this enigmatic film conjures up an atmosphere that lies between danger and sensuality.

films.title: The Ugly One

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Winter, Beirut. On a beach littered with cans washed up from the sea, Lili and Michel meet. Perhaps they know each other from before. As they struggle to piece together the fragments of an uncertain past, memories emerge: an act of terrorism, an explosion and the disappearance of a child, Elena.
films.short_synopsis_html: Winter, Beirut. On a beach littered with cans washed up from the sea, Lili and Michel meet. Perhaps they know each other from before. As they struggle to piece together the fragments of an uncertain past, memories emerge: an act of terrorism, an explosion and the disappearance of a child, Elena.
films.default_editorial: In Eric Baudelaire’s inspired collaboration with Masao Adachi—the notorious Japanese film director and member of the Red Army—a dislocation between sound and image gives shape to this impressionistic mosaic of infinite interpretations. Is it a love story? Or merely the wreckage of a revolution?
films.default_editorial_html: In Eric Baudelaire’s inspired collaboration with Masao Adachi—the notorious Japanese film director and member of the Red Army—a dislocation between sound and image gives shape to this impressionistic mosaic of infinite interpretations. Is it a love story? Or merely the wreckage of a revolution?

films.title: She-Man: A Story of Fixation

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A curious cross-dressing hybrid of psychodrama and intrigue, filmed in Florida, clearly made to capitalize on the Christine Jorgensen sex change mania of the 1950s. Directed by a pre-Porky’s and Black Christmas Bob Clark, with an arguably sympathetic viewpoint towards trans men and women.
films.short_synopsis_html: A curious cross-dressing hybrid of psychodrama and intrigue, filmed in Florida, clearly made to capitalize on the Christine Jorgensen sex change mania of the 1950s. Directed by a pre-Porky’s and Black Christmas Bob Clark, with an arguably sympathetic viewpoint towards trans men and women.
films.default_editorial: For a trashy exploitation film very much of its time, She-Man takes a surprisingly empathetic look at the lives of trans people, while still indulging in the usual traits of the sex film. Filmed by Black Christmas director Bob Clark, the film distinctly combines intrigue, psychodrama, and fetish.
films.default_editorial_html: For a trashy exploitation film very much of its time, She-Man takes a surprisingly empathetic look at the lives of trans people, while still indulging in the usual traits of the sex film. Filmed by Black Christmas director Bob Clark, the film distinctly combines intrigue, psychodrama, and fetish.

films.title: Sheep

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Aurélien, known as “Mouton” (Sheep), works in a restaurant in a small town. A cheerful 17-year-old, he leads a simple life and is loved by those who get to know him. That’s until Mouton disappears after a bizarre accident. The friends he leaves behind continue on with life, but miss him dearly.
films.short_synopsis_html: Aurélien, known as “Mouton” (Sheep), works in a restaurant in a small town. A cheerful 17-year-old, he leads a simple life and is loved by those who get to know him. That’s until Mouton disappears after a bizarre accident. The friends he leaves behind continue on with life, but miss him dearly.
films.default_editorial: This dynamic, restless film jumps from one character and one plot line to the next—with an abandon and constant upending of expectations rendered in a suitably cinema-vérité style. Its profound, even existentially ramshackle and random quality won it a prize at the prestigious Locarno Festival!
films.default_editorial_html: This dynamic, restless film jumps from one character and one plot line to the next—with an abandon and constant upending of expectations rendered in a suitably cinema-vérité style. Its profound, even existentially ramshackle and random quality won it a prize at the prestigious Locarno Festival!

films.title: Arena Azteca Budokan

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Every single corner of the Arena Azteca Budokan located in Nezahualcóyotl City, Mexico, is built with the hands, blood, sweat and tears of the Moreno family, a dynasty of outstanding Mexican gladiators. This film shows their legacy and the colossal life lessons that revolve around their world.
films.short_synopsis_html: Every single corner of the Arena Azteca Budokan located in Nezahualcóyotl City, Mexico, is built with the hands, blood, sweat and tears of the Moreno family, a dynasty of outstanding Mexican gladiators. This film shows their legacy and the colossal life lessons that revolve around their world.
films.default_editorial: Orlando Jiménez lived with the Moreno family—who run the famous Lucha Libre venue that gives the film its name—for over 6 years while making this documentary. Thanks to his intimate approach, we get to know the fighter’s personal stories in this colorful portrait of the people behind the sport.
films.default_editorial_html: Orlando Jiménez lived with the Moreno family—who run the famous Lucha Libre venue that gives the film its name—for over 6 years while making this documentary. Thanks to his intimate approach, we get to know the fighter’s personal stories in this colorful portrait of the people behind the sport.

films.title: My Name is Annemarie Schwarzenbach

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A biopic about Annemarie Schwarzenbach, who was a shimmering figure of bohemian society of the 1920s. A talented writer, she was lesbian, addicted to drugs, a globetrotter, bewitchingly androgynous and – much to her domineering Nazi-loving mother’s chagrin – also anti-fascist.
films.short_synopsis_html: A biopic about Annemarie Schwarzenbach, who was a shimmering figure of bohemian society of the 1920s. A talented writer, she was lesbian, addicted to drugs, a globetrotter, bewitchingly androgynous and – much to her domineering Nazi-loving mother’s chagrin – also anti-fascist.
films.default_editorial: With the fascinating (and underrecognized) figure of Annemarie Schwarzenbach as its subject, Véronique Aubouy delivers a suitably unconventional and journeying documentary. A boundary-breaking and formally-challening portrait of the poet, travel writer and photojournalist.
films.default_editorial_html: With the fascinating (and underrecognized) figure of Annemarie Schwarzenbach as its subject, Véronique Aubouy delivers a suitably unconventional and journeying documentary. A boundary-breaking and formally-challening portrait of the poet, travel writer and photojournalist.

films.title: Occidental

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In a boho Parisian hotel, two sexually and politically ambiguous Italians romp through a succession of blatantly artificial set pieces, stoking the prejudices of staff members and guests. Outside, riots rage and protesters march, threatening to spill into the feverish atmosphere gathering indoors.
films.short_synopsis_html: In a boho Parisian hotel, two sexually and politically ambiguous Italians romp through a succession of blatantly artificial set pieces, stoking the prejudices of staff members and guests. Outside, riots rage and protesters march, threatening to spill into the feverish atmosphere gathering indoors.
films.default_editorial: French-Algerian artist Neïl Beloufa’s second feature is a flamboyant spectacle: a mix of thriller, comedy and melodrama overflowing with queer effervescence. Calling Fassbinder to mind, its 70s atmosphere and cult aura render an impossibly eccentric take on Europe’s political unrest and moral decay.
films.default_editorial_html: French-Algerian artist Neïl Beloufa’s second feature is a flamboyant spectacle: a mix of thriller, comedy and melodrama overflowing with queer effervescence. Calling Fassbinder to mind, its 70s atmosphere and cult aura render an impossibly eccentric take on Europe’s political unrest and moral decay.

films.title: An Investigation on the Night that Won’t Forget
films.title_upcase: AN INVESTIGATION ON THE NIGHT THAT WON’T FORGET

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Erwin Romulo, the best friend of the late film critic Alexis Tioseco, recalls the events after the critic and his girlfriend Nika Bohinc’s murder during a buglary in their home in Quezon City. Lav Diaz makes use of one long take to allow Romulo an uninterrupted narration of the events.
films.short_synopsis_html: Erwin Romulo, the best friend of the late film critic Alexis Tioseco, recalls the events after the critic and his girlfriend Nika Bohinc’s murder during a buglary in their home in Quezon City. Lav Diaz makes use of one long take to allow Romulo an uninterrupted narration of the events.
films.default_editorial: One of the essential qualities of Lav Diaz is how he turns cinema into a testimony, one against exploitation, marginalization, and entrenched power. Perhaps none of his films is closer to personal testament than this address in remembrance of the murder of two important figures in the film industry.
films.default_editorial_html: One of the essential qualities of Lav Diaz is how he turns cinema into a testimony, one against exploitation, marginalization, and entrenched power. Perhaps none of his films is closer to personal testament than this address in remembrance of the murder of two important figures in the film industry.

films.title: The Reconstruction

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: In 1983 a fifteen-year-old boy was kidnapped and brutally murdered. Seventeen years later, the five men convicted still claim their innocence. This film follows the police investigation and juridical process using the original videotaped reconstructions of the murder performed by the defendants.
films.short_synopsis_html: In 1983 a fifteen-year-old boy was kidnapped and brutally murdered. Seventeen years later, the five men convicted still claim their innocence. This film follows the police investigation and juridical process using the original videotaped reconstructions of the murder performed by the defendants.
films.default_editorial: The independent and deeply incisive Israeli documentarian Avi Mograbi ignores the dramatic thrills to emphasize institutional procedure as he re-visits and re-imagines the scene of a terrible crime in this shocking documentary. Was justice served?
films.default_editorial_html: The independent and deeply incisive Israeli documentarian Avi Mograbi ignores the dramatic thrills to emphasize institutional procedure as he re-visits and re-imagines the scene of a terrible crime in this shocking documentary. Was justice served?

films.title: Winter House

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: Mario Bellatín is a one-armed Mexican writer with an amazing vitality; even when he says that he is already dead, and even when he writes auto-biographical texts where his own name perishes and is replaced by a heteronym who still recognizes himself as his own ghost.
films.short_synopsis_html: Mario Bellatín is a one-armed Mexican writer with an amazing vitality; even when he says that he is already dead, and even when he writes auto-biographical texts where his own name perishes and is replaced by a heteronym who still recognizes himself as his own ghost.
films.default_editorial: Argentine director Gonzalo Castro manages to capture the beauty of everyday life in this experimental portrait of the one-armed Mexican novelist (and ultimate prankster!) Mario Bellatín. Just like Bellatín’s fiction, the film treads a fine line between “truth” and “fiction”—wait, is the joke on us?
films.default_editorial_html: Argentine director Gonzalo Castro manages to capture the beauty of everyday life in this experimental portrait of the one-armed Mexican novelist (and ultimate prankster!) Mario Bellatín. Just like Bellatín’s fiction, the film treads a fine line between “truth” and “fiction”—wait, is the joke on us?

films.title: Our Life

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Claudio is a young construction worker who lives happily with his pregnant wife Elena. One day at the construction site, he discovers the corpse of an illegal Romanian worker, but decides not to report the discovery for fear he’ll be out of a job. Claudio’s life suddenly takes an unexpected turn.
films.short_synopsis_html: Claudio is a young construction worker who lives happily with his pregnant wife Elena. One day at the construction site, he discovers the corpse of an illegal Romanian worker, but decides not to report the discovery for fear he’ll be out of a job. Claudio’s life suddenly takes an unexpected turn.
films.default_editorial: A former assistant director to Italian auteur Nanni Moretti, Daniele Luchetti followed up his moving My Brother Is an Only Child with this turbulent portrait of Roman suburban life. Featuring a ravishing performance from actor Elio Germano, Our Life is an inspired piece of social realist cinema.

films.short_synopsis: One-of-a-kind “experimental grindhouse” film (and the sole effort by director Saul Resnick) is a series of kinky vignettes centered around a lonely, wandering soul, purportedly set in a 1928 Los Angeles that seems curiously infused with 1960s S&M iconography.

films.default_editorial: Saul Resnick’s sole film is a quirky quickie ripe with sexploitation sleaze. An experimental grindhouse with an avant-garde streak, The Maidens of Fetish Street perversely plays with early 60s S&M iconography and off-the-cuff quips in 20s L.A. It’s quick, it’s freaky, and it’s a lot of fun too!

films.title: The Burning Hell

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Never intended for general exhibition, this evangelical outreach film was made to depict, in the most vivid cinematic terms, where non-believers and sinners shall go lest they be saved. Based on the sermons of a Southern Baptist preacher and directed by notorious exploitation filmmaker Ron Ormond.

films.default_editorial: Located somewhere between the kitsch heaven of underground film and the fire and brimstone of evangelical propaganda stands The Burning Hell. If you’re familiar with grindhouse director Ron Ormond’s work (he started making religious films after surviving a plane crash), you’ll know what’s in store.

films.title: Baby Bump

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: 11-year-old Mickey House is no longer a child. But who is he? He doesn’t know. He’s friendless. He doesn’t understand his mother. He hates what’s happening to his body. Reality and imagination come together in a toxic mix. Events escalate to extremes… at home and at school.
films.short_synopsis_html: 11-year-old Mickey House is no longer a child. But who is he? He doesn’t know. He’s friendless. He doesn’t understand his mother. He hates what’s happening to his body. Reality and imagination come together in a toxic mix. Events escalate to extremes… at home and at school.
films.default_editorial: Super slick and visually striking, the mixed-media coming-of-age story Baby Bump bursts forth with array of spectacular imagery—combining animation and live-action—to capture a young man contending with the pains of puberty. A confident film feature debut from emerging talent Kuba Czekaj.

films.title: Guts and Glitz

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Audiovisual material gathered by filmmaker Fox Maxy over a decade, including documentary footage, television clips, and animation—sometimes layered on top of one another—are presented as one collage. Amid this sensory barrage, themes of sexual violence, community, confidence and joy are explored.
films.short_synopsis_html: Audiovisual material gathered by filmmaker Fox Maxy over a decade, including documentary footage, television clips, and animation—sometimes layered on top of one another—are presented as one collage. Amid this sensory barrage, themes of sexual violence, community, confidence and joy are explored.
films.default_editorial: Re-edited and re-titled specifically for our Next Prize collection, Fox Maxy’s dynamic feature debut moves between the personal and the virtual with dazzling inventiveness. With its vortex of genre-defying imagery, Guts and Glitz announces an impressive new voice in Indigenous experimental cinema.

films.title: Radio Mary

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Mary lives alone and is waiting for something to happen in her life. Riding the elevator to work, a strange man grabs her shoulder and speaks to her telepathically: “Do you believe in magic?”. Mary can now hear people’s thoughts, and she starts hearing music that seems to be broadcast from her mind.

films.default_editorial: Adapted from his own novel, Gary Walkow’s eerie, beguiling ghost story stars Kate Lyn Sheil as a woman haunted by a Mephistophelian mystery man and newfound telepathic powers. A new gem from a prizewinning independent filmmaker.

films.short_synopsis: A wraithlike fantasy that observes three thirtysomethings as they sleep, dream, read and receive visitors in a Mexico City apartment.
films.short_synopsis_html: A wraithlike fantasy that observes three thirtysomethings as they sleep, dream, read and receive visitors in a Mexico City apartment.
films.default_editorial: This short feature from director Nicolás Pereda is a beautifully dreamy and enchanting work of indolent bohemian languor. Inspired by Last Year at Marienbad, the film sees three individuals in an apartment communicating through sleeping positions and books, creating a wonderful psalm of nostalgia.

films.title: Prototype

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: As the deadliest natural disaster in US history strikes Galveston, Texas, taking between 6,000 and 12,000 lives, a mysterious televisual device projects images of unknown origin.
films.short_synopsis_html: As the deadliest natural disaster in US history strikes Galveston, Texas, taking between 6,000 and 12,000 lives, a mysterious televisual device projects images of unknown origin.
films.default_editorial: An experimental 3D film from one of the leading innovators in the form, this immersive feature by Blake Williams drops us into the immediate aftermath of one of America’s most destructive storms. At once visceral and mysterious, Prototype is also a singular meditation on the medium of cinema itself.

films.title: The Wife Master

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: 40-year-old Bora is gay, unemployed and lives at home. When his family kicks him out, he accepts his uncle’s offer to marry a Cambodian woman for $10,000 so she can come to the United States. When the money runs out, Bora gets another wife, then another… until he has more wives than he can handle.
films.short_synopsis_html: 40-year-old Bora is gay, unemployed and lives at home. When his family kicks him out, he accepts his uncle’s offer to marry a Cambodian woman for $10,000 so she can come to the United States. When the money runs out, Bora gets another wife, then another… until he has more wives than he can handle.
films.default_editorial: Shot in a vérité style, this irreverent comedy about green card marriages sharply critiques the homophobic intolerance within the Cambodian community and the absurdities of the immigration system in the US. While dealing with hefty topics, the film’s riotous performances make for a delightful watch.

films.title: Rocket Rain

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A video artist working on his latest project is unexpectedly visited by his long lost friend, who is having a troubled relationship with his wife. During their awkward reunion, they became aware of how far apart they have grown, and at the same time they engage in earnest conversations.
films.short_synopsis_html: A video artist working on his latest project is unexpectedly visited by his long lost friend, who is having a troubled relationship with his wife. During their awkward reunion, they became aware of how far apart they have grown, and at the same time they engage in earnest conversations.
films.default_editorial: There’s a breezy vibe to Anggun Priambodo’s Rocket Rain, despite the heavy subject matters under discussion by the central duo. The pain of divorce and responsibilities of adulthood come under investigation, but Priambodo finds room for colorful, fantastic asides—including some dancing genitalia!

films.title: Waging War

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Seven cousins find themselves for the last time in the house of their childhood. While they are bored, they find the suitcase preserving the disguises in which they used to dress-up in to play when they were children. They decide to throw for the last time a game of Waging War.
films.short_synopsis_html: Seven cousins find themselves for the last time in the house of their childhood. While they are bored, they find the suitcase preserving the disguises in which they used to dress-up in to play when they were children. They decide to throw for the last time a game of Waging War.
films.default_editorial: In this idiosyncratic black-and-white short, boiling grownup tensions and philosophical woes suddenly find a chaotic release in the form of therapeutic child play. The freewheeling cinematography emulates the emotional catharsis and clarity made possible by adults learning to be kids again.

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: Images of cherry blossoms, luminous fields bursting with color, and miscellaneous domestic ephemera are photographed from the screen of an obsolete televisual device.
films.short_synopsis_html: Images of cherry blossoms, luminous fields bursting with color, and miscellaneous domestic ephemera are photographed from the screen of an obsolete televisual device.
films.default_editorial: In Blake Williams’s impressionistic short, a flickering monitor provides an enigmatic visual commons in which intriguing footage of domesticity and the great outdoors wordlessly converge. Through inventive use of 3D technology, the fragility and malleability of the image becomes strikingly palpable.

films.title: Bad Girls Go to Hell

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: After hubby Ted goes to work, Ellen putters around the apartment in her nightgown cleaning up. When she takes the trash out, the janitor forces her into his apartment and rapes her. When he tries to rape her again, she dispatches him and then hits the road, a fugitive from injustice.

films.default_editorial: Bad Girls Go To Hell portrays a nightmarish cycle of violence and retribution through dizzying camerawork and disembodied voice-overs. Lacy lingerie, noir-lit bedsits, and a scuzzy N.Y. skyline bring to life this young woman’s flight from fate in the big bad city. One of our favorite Wishman films!

films.title: Walk the Walk

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: Previously lost, this is a sordid psychedelic saga starring Bernie Hamilton (brother of jazz drummer, Chico) as a desperate junkie trawling the L.A. hippie rock underground, and produced by the notorious carny barker of exploitation films, Kroger Babb.
films.short_synopsis_html: Previously lost, this is a sordid psychedelic saga starring Bernie Hamilton (brother of jazz drummer, Chico) as a desperate junkie trawling the L.A. hippie rock underground, and produced by the notorious carny barker of exploitation films, Kroger Babb.
films.default_editorial: Restored from its only surviving print materials, this semi-autobiographical debut from director Jac Zacha offers a jagged ride through the drug underground of the 1970s. With the stoner wilds of psychedelic Los Angeles as the main backdrop, Walk the Walk is a bizarre yet elegantly shot swan song.

films.title: House of Seven Belles

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: The late Andy Milligan never completed his Southern melodrama, and all he left behind was a single unfinished workprint. As he said, “it’s all there, except the finale I was unable to shoot.” Thus, it may be left to the viewer to complete his Civil War epic, revealed here for the first time.
films.short_synopsis_html: The late Andy Milligan never completed his Southern melodrama, and all he left behind was a single unfinished workprint. As he said, “it’s all there, except the finale I was unable to shoot.” Thus, it may be left to the viewer to complete his Civil War epic, revealed here for the first time.
films.default_editorial: Cult horror auteur Andy Milligan has a select yet fanatical fandom: among them is Nicolas Winding Refn, who protects his legacy by salvaging obscure prints. This incomplete Civil War epic is one of them. Shot on Staten Island, yet packed full of Southern gothic touches, it’s more than just a curio.

films.title: Indecent Desires

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: A man finds a doll in a garbage can, and seeing that the woman he lives with looks like the doll, he starts touching. However, the doll transmits these touches to her.
films.short_synopsis_html: A man finds a doll in a garbage can, and seeing that the woman he lives with looks like the doll, he starts touching. However, the doll transmits these touches to her.
films.default_editorial: One of Doris Wishman’s late 60s “roughies,” Indecent Desires features many of the legendary director’s authorial quirks, like cutaways to kooky interiors, out-of-sync voice-overs, and erratic continuity. This splintered tale of depravity and occultism up-turns male domination and obsessive desire.

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: Laberint d’Horta, Barcelona. In the park’s garden, at the center of its maze, a statue of Eros waits. Several journeys take place in search of the center. While navigating the maze’s false pathways, structures start to crack, and a mysterious underworld floods its gates.
films.short_synopsis_html: Laberint d’Horta, Barcelona. In the park’s garden, at the center of its maze, a statue of Eros waits. Several journeys take place in search of the center. While navigating the maze’s false pathways, structures start to crack, and a mysterious underworld floods its gates.
films.default_editorial: Light doubles and bends in Blake Williams’s sixth short, as the snaking camera twists and turns around corners that buzz with histories of 3D cinema. Deragh Campbell materializes toward the spectral end of this mesmeric experiment in perception, which coruscates with wonder in the Catalonian sun.

films.title: Opium

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: They say that the world got silent. They say that you went far away, with the cries, the laughs, the tomorrows. They say that the world has disappeared. But Oscar, he hears them whisper at night. Behind the walls, far from the men, at the end of the corridors…
films.short_synopsis_html: They say that the world got silent. They say that you went far away, with the cries, the laughs, the tomorrows. They say that the world has disappeared. But Oscar, he hears them whisper at night. Behind the walls, far from the men, at the end of the corridors…
films.default_editorial: In this suggestive fictional oddity, a mysterious aura imbues the vivid wallpaper of the eerie, dilapidated buildings its characters occupy. Through innovative film language and dystopian overtones, Opium crafts a singular, evocative world, full of palpable tensions and atmospheric spaces.

films.short_synopsis: In the darkroom, 50 unexposed film strips were laid across a surface, upon which a frame of La sortie des ouvriers de l’usine Lumière was projected to create a new kind of film…
films.short_synopsis_html: In the darkroom, 50 unexposed film strips were laid across a surface, upon which a frame of La sortie des ouvriers de l’usine Lumière was projected to create a new kind of film…
films.default_editorial: Stripping the Lumières’ famous first film of its figurative elements, Peter Tscherkassky’s experimental short playfully reinterprets the birth of cinema. The painstaking manipulation of film strips and the exposure process reimagine the medium in its purest form: a dance between light and darkness.

films.short_synopsis_html: Exploitation film maven Bob Cresse goes full drag as the matriarch of “Granny Good’s School for Good Girls” in this delightfully silly “nudie cutie,” which somehow mashes the “old dark house” monster movie, lowbrow comedy, the rock & roll dance party and the peep show, in eye-popping candy colors.

Naïve dramatic vignettes entail wildly inappropriate excuses for nudity—as the poster says, it was shot in “Nuderama” after all!

films.short_synopsis: This jaw-dropping non-documentary by sleaze sultan Joseph P. Mawra pulls out all the stops to paint a picture of the “plight” of the lesbian, circa 1965. Of course, it’s just a grindhouse picture for the raincoat crowd–but it’s also an amazing “accidental documentary” of mid-60s Greenwich Village.

films.title: In omaggio all'arte italiana!

content_rating.label: mature

films.short_synopsis: Presented at the 2015 Venice Biennale, this short film by Jean-Marie Straub is a fragment of the last reel of his film History Lessons, based on Bertolt Brecht’s The Business Affairs of Mr Julius Caesar and  dedicated to the memory and materiality of cinema.
films.short_synopsis_html: Presented at the 2015 Venice Biennale, this short film by Jean-Marie Straub is a fragment of the last reel of his film History Lessons, based on Bertolt Brecht’s The Business Affairs of Mr Julius Caesar and dedicated to the memory and materiality of cinema.
films.default_editorial: In a protracted act of adaptation, Jean-Marie Straub retrieves and recontextualises this installation piece from the last reel of one of he and Danièle Huillet’s Italian films: History Lessons, itself a retelling of Brecht’s unfinished historical novel The Business Affairs of Mr. Julius Caesar.

films.short_synopsis: A nudie cutie like no other, in which a pulp author and his wife are stranded in a graveyard and become slaves to the undead, enduring all manner of lascivious dancing. Starring Criswell (Plan 9 From Outer Space, whose Ed Wood wrote the screenplay here), filmed in gloriously garish candy colors.

films.default_editorial: A gloriously garish, über-camp “nudie cutie,” with a screenplay written by the infamous director Ed Wood: we’re sold! But wait, there’s more. It stars American psychic Criswell (of Plan 9 from Outer Space fame), a plethora of stripteases, and some truly demented costumes. In short: a cult classic!

films.title: Hot Thrills and Warm Chills

content_rating.label: adult

films.short_synopsis: Rita Alexander stars as the towering gang leader of a trio of hoodlum gals looking to make one last big score, run away with a mess of diamonds and live the dream in paradise. An eccentric gem from Texas wildcard director Dale Berry, underscored by a relentlessly brilliant Perez Prado soundtrack.

films.default_editorial: This much fun should be positively criminal! Mardi Gras is the beating heart of eccentric Texan director Dale Berry’s sleazy girl gang romp. Expect lots of tawdry dialogue, soft-core sex and naked dancing ladies, but don’t expect too much plot. With Latin rhythms from King of Mambo Pérez Prado!

films.title: Something Horizontal

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: Stroboscopic glimpses of Victorian domestic surfaces and geometric shadows transform the physical world into an impressionistic fantasia. Elsewhere, a specter emerges from the depths of German expressionist cinema.
films.short_synopsis_html: Stroboscopic glimpses of Victorian domestic surfaces and geometric shadows transform the physical world into an impressionistic fantasia. Elsewhere, a specter emerges from the depths of German expressionist cinema.
films.default_editorial: Haunted by a dead body and ghosts of cinema past, Blake Williams’s spooky short is accompanied by sounds of sirens and a turntable running—but with nothing left to play. Maximizing the prismatic potential of 3D, this hypnotic film glitches and glints its jagged way through ten spellbinding minutes.

films.title: Nude on the Moon

content_rating.label: caution
content_rating.description: Contains material that may not be suitable for children or young adults.

films.short_synopsis: Brilliant scientist Jeff inherits $3 million and builds his own rocketship. When he and the Professor reach the Moon, they find it inhabited by telepathic nudists with antennae. Suddenly, workaholic Jeff has time to learn about this thing called “love!”
films.short_synopsis_html: Brilliant scientist Jeff inherits $3 million and builds his own rocketship. When he and the Professor reach the Moon, they find it inhabited by telepathic nudists with antennae. Suddenly, workaholic Jeff has time to learn about this thing called “love!”
films.default_editorial: A luridly colored, futuristic nudie cutie from the innovative sexploitation director Doris Wishman, Nude on the Moon does exactly what it says on the tin! Who would have thought that the lunar landscape was populated by antenna-wearing nudists, tacky swimming pools, and tropical palm trees?

films.title: Olga's House of Shame

content_rating.label: mature

films.short_synopsis: The notorious exploitation entry that jumpstarted an entire “roughie” genre of S&M-tinged exploitation films. Audrey Cambell plays Olga, a sadistic jewel-thieving madame who hides in an abandoned mine and exacts all kinds of misery upon those who defy her—all told in oddball semi-documentary style.

films.title: January

content_rating.label: mature
content_rating.description: Contains material and themes suitable only for mature audiences.

films.short_synopsis: After murdering his wife, Horatio and his lover Lucrecia run away to a cabin in the country. As Horatio becomes increasingly consumed by guilt and memories of his dead wife, Lucrecia starts to question whether she should remain by his side or not.
films.short_synopsis_html: After murdering his wife, Horatio and his lover Lucrecia run away to a cabin in the country. As Horatio becomes increasingly consumed by guilt and memories of his dead wife, Lucrecia starts to question whether she should remain by his side or not.
films.default_editorial: Adrián González’s debut feature film—the first produced by a Michoacán director!—makes us feel like voyeurs as we become witnesses to the breakup of a relationship. Following a “crime of passion,” two lovers are forced to confront the consequences of their actions and the limits of their boundaries.

films.title: Lateral

content_rating.label: general
content_rating.description: Generally suitable for all ages, but viewer discretion is advised.

films.short_synopsis: Artist Charlie Shackleton realizes he can trick the human brain into detecting 3D images without using two cameras. He scours cinema history for hidden depths, testing out tracking shots from various films, including works by Chantal Akerman and Stanley Kubrick.
films.short_synopsis_html: Artist Charlie Shackleton realizes he can trick the human brain into detecting 3D images without using two cameras. He scours cinema history for hidden depths, testing out tracking shots from various films, including works by Chantal Akerman and Stanley Kubrick.
films.default_editorial: Adopting a simple formal trick, this understated short is a beautiful reminder that the human eye plays a crucial part in the creation of movie magic. Inviting us to participate in a quietly stunning experiment, Charlie Shackleton’s soothing narration conjures up exciting filmmaking horizons.
